loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
Maria es comerciante, en su casa tiene una tienda que ella misma administra y es su única fuente de ingresos que le permiten mantener su hogar, también Luisa cuida a su madre que es edad avanzada y requiere ciertos cuidados.
Solicita el crédito para comprar productos para su tienda y abastecer el inventario para mantener estable la venta comprando granos básicos, golosinas, bebidas, productos de higiene personal y demás, además necesita hacer unas reparaciones en la casa. Sus aspiraciones son tener una tienda bien abastecida con mayor variedad de productos y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is a merchant. In her house she has a store that she runs herself. It is her only source of income that allows her to support her home. She also takes care of her mother who is elderly and needs certain care. She is asking for the loan to to buy products for her store and stock up on inventory to keep her sales stable by buying basic grains, snacks, beverages, personal hygiene products and more. She needs to make some repairs on the house. 
Her goals are to have a well stocked store with a wider variety of products and to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks, beverages, personal hygiene products and more.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia con mucho esfuerzo y con la ayuda de su familia, está siguiendo su carrera de contabilidad pública.
Comenta que le gustaría poder ayuda a las demás personas por medio de su carrera. Se está esforzando mucho para poder cumplir con su meta.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de titulación de su carrera, y de esa forma poder estar detrás de su meta.
texts.en:
With great effort and the help of her family, Emilia is continuing with her degree in Public Accounting. She says that she would like to be able to help other people with her degree. For this reason, she is trying very hard to reach this goal.

Emilia is requesting this loan so that she can cover the tuition expenses for her degree. As a result, she would be on course toward meeting her goal.

loans.use: to pay her tuition expenses.

loans.name: Evert Lito

texts.es:
Evert Lito tiene 35 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, vive con su cónyugue y su menor hijo de 8 años de edad el cual cursa primaria en colegio nacional del caserio de Cabra Chica, Evert Lito es natural de la zona, tiene muy buena referencias tanto personales como laborales en su comunidad, la misma que está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Evert Lito es la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de piña, ubicado en el caserío de Cabra Chica, con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años, el préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agricolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto a un buen precio, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Evert Lito is 35 years old and lives in his own home made of basic materials. He lives with his wife and their eight-year-old son who is enrolled at a national primary school in the village of Cabra Chica. Evert Lito is a native of the area. He has many good personal and work-related references from his community. This residents of this area engage in agriculture, livestock breeding, and trade. The community is located in the District of Pucará in Jaén Province, which is in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Evert Lito is a farmer who specifically grows pineapples in the village of Cabra Chica. He has 10 years of experience in this line of work. The loan he will be issued will be used for farm work, the application and incorporation of phytosanitary products, fertilizers, and labor during the harvest season. All of this will help to improve the physiology, morphology, and productivity of his crops so that he can have a timely harvest. In the end, his production will be greater and result in a better quality product. Evert Lito should have no problems with selling his product at a good price. In the short term, he will be able to increase his earnings, improve his income, and eventually improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to pay for farm work, the application and incorporation of phytosanitary products, fertilizers, and labor during the harvest season.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
Alcides tiene 40 años de edad, vive en casa alquilada de material semirustico. El domicilio de Alcides se ubica en el distrito de Pucara en la provincia de Jaén – dpto: Cajamarca. La comunidad donde vive el cliente es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se dedican básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que desempeña Alcides es el de prestar servicio de transporte urbano en su unidad vehicular cubriendo la ruta a las ciudades de JAEN – PUCARA en el departamento de Cajamarca. Alcides solicita el préstamo para invertir en mantenimiento de su vehículo, con lo que podrá asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo para poder seguir generando ingresos para su subsistencia.
texts.en:
Alcides, age 40, lives in a rented house that is made from somewhat rustic material.  Alcides’s house is located in the Pucara district, Jaén province, Cajamarca department.  The community where he lives is a small rural area where the inhabitants work basically in agriculture, with livestock, and in commerce.

Alcides’s business activity is providing urban transportation service in his vehicle.  He covers the route to the cities of Jaen – Pucura in the Cajamarca department.

Alcides is requesting the loan for maintenance of his vehicle.  This way he will be able to assure the correct functioning of his work tool.  By doing so he will be able to continue generating income to support himself.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 46 years old and has two children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

Elisa is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elisa has been fattening pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco, tiene 47 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 4 hijas, reside en una aldea del municipio de Morazán, Yoro. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura cultivando granos básicos, siendo el cultivo del maíz su principal producción y fuente de ingresos. Este producto lo vende en el mercado local.  Este préstamo que solicita es el segundo ciclo en la institución y es por 3,500 Lempiras para comprar semilla de maíz, abono y limpieza del terreno para siembra. Su plan es seguir cultivando maíz y apoyar a sus hijas para que terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Francisco is 47 years old, married, and has four daughters. He resides in a neighborhood in the town of Morazán, Yoro. Francisco has always worked as a farmer by cultivating basic grains. Corn is the main product that he cultivates as a source of income. His product is sold at the local market.

This is Francisco’s second loan cycle with ODEF and he is requesting 3,500 HNL in order to buy corn seeds, compost, and pay to have his land cleared for planting. He plans to continue cultivating corn so that he can support his daughters until they finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, compost, and to pay to have his land cleared for planting.

loans.name: Pedro Juan

texts.es:
Pedro de 63 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 4 hijos todos mayores solo una hija vive con él y es independiente. Solo estudio hasta 6° grado de educación básica, dejo el estudio porque sus padres pensaban que del estudio no iba a vivir, cosa que él todavía se sigue lamentando. Su esposa es ama de casa y le apoya siempre en ciertos trabajos que hace.

Pedro es agricultor, trabaja con maíz, frijol y café; aprendió trabajando con su padre que siempre lo llevo con él a trabajar al campo. También se dedicó por 6 años a la elaboración de pan por completo. Hoy en día trabaja más la agricultora, siempre elabora pan, viaja cerca de 1 hora y media en autobús para llegar al lugar donde está la panadería que administran sus hijos y que pedro les donó por ser muy difícil para él el trabajo debido a su edad y por tener problemas de delincuencia en el lugar donde la tenía.

Pedro solicita el préstamo para cosechar el maíz y el frijol que sembró y una parte lo necesita para la reparación de unas tumbas. Su sueño es seguir trabajando mientras pueda, esta satisfecho por el legado de trabajo que deja a sus hijos y nietos.
texts.en:
Pedro is 63 years old, is married, and has 4 children, but only one lives with him and she is an adult. He attended school until 6th grade, but left because his parents thought that school would not help him in life, which he still regrets. His wife works in the home and always supports him in the various jobs that he does.

Pedro is a farmer and grows corn, beans, and coffee. He learned this from his father who always brought him to work in the fields. For the past 6 years, he has also worked as a bread baker. These days, he mostly works on his farm but still always makes bread. He travels about an hour and a half by bus to get to the bakery that his children run. Pedro gave it to them because it is very difficult for him to run due to his age and the crime near the location.

Pedro is requesting the loan to help him to harvest corn and beans that he plants and to repair some graves. His dream is to continue working while he still can. He is happy to leave a legacy of his work to his children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to harvest the corn and beans that he plants and to repair some graves.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a ready-to-wear clothes business in the Philippines.

Elsa has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothes to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Elsa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo es de la ciudad de Concepción, es una persona que se está esforzando para poder ser alguien en la vida, y por medio de su profesión poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Alfredo está estudiando la carrera de derecho y una vez terminada  la carrera podrá ser un buen abogado que podrá ayudar a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir tras su meta y ser alguien en la vida, útil a los demás
texts.en:
Alfredo is from the city of Concepción. He is the type of person who strives to make something of his life. Through his profession, he hopes to be able to help other people.

Alfredo is studying for a law degree. Once he finishes his education, he hopes to become a good lawyer who can help other people.

Alfredo is requesting this loan so that he can pay his fees. As a result, he can continue toward his goal of making something of his life and being useful to others.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase boxes of ice cream and cones.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman living in Ormoc City, Leyte. She has a small sari-sari or general store selling various goods to the people in her community. Lorna also raises pigs for additional income. Lorna is asking for a loan to buy more piglets, animal feed and groceries for the store, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

With a loan, Lorna will be able to improve her store's inventory, thus attracting more buyers. She can also raise healthy pigs.

In the future, Lorna hopes to make her business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more piglets, animal feed, and groceries for her store

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 61 years old and widowed. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Elvira has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Elvira requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elvira has been in this business for 48 years. In the future, Elvira would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en: Orlando grows pineapple in the field. He grows the fruit for eight months before he can harvest it. It’s a relatively long time before he can harvest the fruit so he needs capital to sustain his crops by applying right amount of inputs. Orlando is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy fertilizer, and to pay for labor costs in planting, irrigating, and cultivation. He needs to do all of this to grow and harvest delicious fruit. Orlando believes that by having the loan he will produce more fruit to sell. He hopes to sell the fruit at a competitive price to recover his costs and earn higher income to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pay for labor costs in planting, irrigating, and cultivation.

loans.name: Mirtha Margot

texts.es:
Mirtha es una mujer de 55 años de edad, casada, sin hijos y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de gelatinas.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ el barrio más poblado de la ciudad, un sitio caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas que lo realizan descendientes de las etnias ‘Ayoreas’ del lugar y descendientes de mineros relocalizados de occidente, ahora como segunda generación de los originales se dedican al comercio y la manufactura, De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura ambiente que varía entre 21º y 35º grados centígrados durante el día y todo el año.
Mirtha es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello obscuro, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja en el mismo negocio, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta ambulante de gelatinas y otros como; Los bolis o congeladas (son deliciosas golosinas que gozan de gran aceptación en el mercado por ser refrescantes y económicas), a base de fruta natural hace que sea muy nutritiva, “empecé mi negocio porque vimos que el sector demandaba este producto y tuvimos suerte, ahora necesitamos ampliar el negocio…” comenta. su sueño es tener un puesto fijo de venta, ella desea realizar la ampliación de su negocio mediante la compra de una congeladora y una vitrina, para congelar más productos y luego ponerlos en exposición. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Mirtha solicita un préstamo para la compra de una congeladora y una vitrina para producir gelatinas en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a 55 year-old woman who is married without children. Her business is producing and selling gelatins. She is enterprising, independent, responsible, and hard-working. Her business takes place in the 'Plan 3000" zone, the most populous neighborhood in the city, which is characterized by its business district. The workers in this area are descendants of the Avoreas ethnic group and of relocated miners from the west, whose subsequent generation now work in commerce and manufacturing. 

The climate is hot, tropical, and humid, with a temperature that varies between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade during the day and throughout the year. 

Mirtha has brown skin, dark hair, and a strong physical complexion; she is of short stature, her native language is Guarani, and she speaks Spanish for business purposes. She shares her life with her husband, who works in the same store, and they live in their own brick home that has potable water and electricity. Their business is the production and sale of gelatins and other products, such as bolis or ice creams, which are delicious treats that their customers enjoy due to how refreshing and affordable they are. They are healthy treats because they are fruit-based. 

Mirtha says, "I started my business because we saw that the market demanded this product and we were lucky, now we need to amplify the business." Her dream is to have her own fixed point-of-sale, and she wishes to grow her business by purchasing a freezer and a glass display case to freeze more products and display them for her customers. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 5 years that she has been operating her business. It is for those reasons that Mirtha is seeking a loan, so that she may be able to produce a larger quantity of her gelatins and products to sell.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and a display case to produce larger quantities of gelatins.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is is 51 years old and married with three children. She lives with her family in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She used her previous loan from GDMPC for her retailing business and it helped to increase her income. She still wants to fertilize her entire coconut farm to restore soil nutrients. She took  a new loan recently to buy organic fertilizer to have a more productive harvest. Her future plan is to improve the entire farm and to be able to renovate her house for the family to have a comfortable living space.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to have a more productive harvest

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 40-year-old married mother of four children who lives in Ormoc City, Leyte. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than six years now. This is the source of her income.  Mercy is asking for  a loan to buy piglets to raise and animal feed. With a loan, she will be able to grow more healthy pigs which she can sell to the market after several weeks. 
In the future, Mercy hopes of making her business sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Rosita Melba

texts.en:
Rosita Melba is a widow operating a sari-sari (or variety) store. She sells basic commodities like eggs, seasonings, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, toothpaste,and soap. She is 60 years old and the mother of two grown children. She lives in Mcarthur, Leyte. She has been operating her store for three years now.

She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy additional merchandise like soft drinks, soap, canned goods, and noodles. These stocks will help Rosita Melba to fill the display shelves of her store and attract more customers.  

In the coming months, her income will increase. She is willing to invest in any possible business opportunities to improve her standard of living, and hopefully it will be the way going to sustainable livelihood as well.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise like soft drinks, soap, canned goods, and noodles

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. Melanie is married and has a business making kitchen tools in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her furniture shop.

Melanie has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Melanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her furniture shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Christmas decorations to meet the demand of the large number of customers looking for these items at this time.

loans.name: Crista Isabel

texts.es:
Crista es comerciante y productora, vende leche que ordeña ella misma de tres vacas que le dejo su esposo cuando viajó, con el tiempo se hizo de experiencia y ahora cría su propio ganado. Crista es una mujer líder en su comunidad, es presidenta de la directiva.

Solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para construir un baño en su casa para beneficio de su familia. Su sueño  es tener un negocio estable como una tienda para proveer a su familia y no tener que sufrir la desintegración familiar.
texts.en:
Crista works in commerce and production, selling milk that she receives from her three cows that her husband left her with. With time, she became experienced in this work and is now raising her own herd. Crista is a leader in her community and is the president of the director's board.

She is asking for this loan to buy construction materials to build a bathroom in her house for the benefit of her family. Her dream is to have a stable business, such as a store, to provide for her family and not have to suffer through family disintegration.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a bathroom in her house.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario works hard to support her family. She has a dried-fish-making business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish.

Rosario has been in this business for 3 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Pukuri Ambakiti Group

texts.en: To find out more about how Ejido Verde is working to create opportunity for indigenous populations watch this video In the Purépecha language, the phrase “pukuri ambakiti” means “good pine, pine resin tapper”. This is also the name of a group of resin tappers in the indigenous community of Cherán that is nestled in the heart of the mountains of Tarasco. This is the birthplace of the indigenous people who are of the Purépecha race, which is situated in the State of Michoacán, Mexico. The representative for this group is Rosalío, who is also part of the Communal Council. Rosalío is married and his wife is a homemaker. They have four children. His oldest child is 25 years old and the youngest is 16 years old. Pine resin has had a positive impact on his life. This business benefits his family by providing a 60% profit. Thanks to this industry, there is more business movement in the community, which has facilitated the trading of products among the resin tappers. This loan will be used and applied to the natural resources in the forestry industry. In other words, the entire planting process includes preparation, fencing, maintenance, and harvesting. This loan will also provide adequate support and care to the land that is currently producing resin. In addition, this will strengthen his business and allow him to devote himself entirely to the forest. His future plans include leaving the next generation everything that he had when he was younger so that they can enjoy the beautiful forest. His dream and that of his family is to rebuild what they had in the forest. The one thing that he is most proud of is the work he has done. He feels fortunate to have the opportunity to walk and work in close contact with nature. Rosalío feels very proud to be part of a community that has attracted interest from people from other parts of the world who are concerned about the environment and making it productive. He would like to tell people who are lending to this project of planting commercial pine trees that the production of resin takes a bit of time, but once it starts generating income, the benefits can be reaped for more than 50 years. In his opinion, Rosalío believes resin production can support the environment for more than 70 years and can continue to do so for many more years. He thinks that if we are beneficiaries of nature, then we have the obligation to preserve it. The challenges and obstacles are the same ones being faced by the community, so the inhabitants understand that they can live in the forest and have a productive pine resin business.

loans.use: to buy and plant resin producing pine trees. The resin will be harvested annually, providing income for many years.

loans.name: Mujeres De Exito1 Group

texts.es: Marta, tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, vive con su madre en el municipio de Yoro. Hace 10 años que decidió por tener su propio negocio de venta de maíz, frijoles y también vende ropa. Ella anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura. Marta a venido superando con su negocio poco a poco mediante la inversión de varios prestamos, actualmente solicita otro por 19,000 lempiras en forma grupal para comprar granos básicos como maíz y frijoles para revender. Su idea es mantener siempre su fuente de ingresos. Ella tiene como meta ampliar el negocio para obtener mayor rentabilidad y comprar un vehículo. El grupo se llama Mujeres de Exito1, formado por cinco mujeres que se dedican a la venta de abarrotes y granos básicos y viven en la misma comunidad. El monto de préstamo es de 85,000 Lempiras para invertirlo en sus negocios. En la foto esta Sara a la izquierda, Filena, María Teresa, Marta y Bertha a la derecha.
texts.en:
Marta, age 41, is a single mother with one child. She lives with her mother in the town of Yoro. Ten years ago, she decided to have her own business of selling corn, beans, as well as clothes. She previously worked in agriculture. Marta gradually excelled at her business by investing several loans. She is currently requesting another loan in the amount 19,000 HNL as part of her group so that she can buy basic grains, such as corn and beans, that she can resell. Her idea is to always maintain her source of income. Marta’s goal is to expand her business so that it becomes more profitable. She would also like to purchase a vehicle.

The group is named “Mujeres de Exito 1” (Women of Success 1) and consists of five women who sell groceries and basic grains in the same community where they live. The amount of their loan totals 85,000 HNL and will be invested in their businesses. The photo shows Sara on the left, followed by Filena, María Teresa, Marta, and finally Bertha on the right.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Renelyn

texts.en:
Renelyn is married and  the mother of four children; the oldest child is 22 ,and the youngest is 13. 

She runs a vulcanizing shop.  She offers services like  welding works, auto detailing, and vulcanizing with a tire changer. She has been engaged in this kind of business for 20 years. Aside from operating a vulcanizing shop, she engages in food vending as additional source of income. She sells chicken and meat barbecue.

Renelyn is asking for a loan of PHP 35,000 PHP to buy more supplies like meat, chicken, and seasonings and to raise capital for the start-up of a hog-raising business. 

Hopefully, this can be a great help for Renelyn and her family to produce more barbecue to sell and to start to raising hogs as additional sources of income.

In the future, Renelyn is expanding her livelihood for the welfare of her children and to be successful as well in handling her business.

loans.use: to buy more supplies like meat, chicken and seasonings and to raise capital to start a  hog-raising business

loans.name: Cira

texts.es:
Cira tiene 70 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente. Vive en casa propia, junto a su esposo y 01 hijo en sector fundo san Felix. Cira cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad rural dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia. Ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Cira se dedica al cultivo y comercio de alfalfa, y adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores tales como cerdos y patos. El destino del crédito será para invertir en construcción de 02 habitaciones más en su vivienda para poder tener mayor comodidad en su vivienda, lo que permitirá obtener una mejora en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cira is 70 years old, married, and lives in her home with her husband and her first son in the San Felix sector. Cira counts on good personal and working references, and has a united family. She lives in a rural community that is engaged in commerce, agriculture, and raising livestock. It is located in the Cayalti districte, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. 

Cira grows and sells alfalfa, and additionally, she raises and sells small animals like pigs and ducks. This loan will be used to invest in the construction of two more bedrooms in her home so that her family may live more comfortably and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the construction of two more bedrooms in her home.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling nipa roofing (shown in the photo) in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell

Merlinda has been in this business for seven years. Merlinda earns other income from food vending.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Katia Miriam

texts.es:
katia es una mujer de 34 años de edad, soltera tiene un hijo varón de 6 años y dos hijas mujeres de 8 y 3 años, y su negocio es la carnicería.
Ella es buena madre, responsable, paciente, comprometida con su trabajo, y constante. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, zona residencial un área caracterizada por el comercio de buen gusto en todas las áreas, de clima cálido y seco.
Katia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la realiza junto a sus 3 hijos; los dos mayores estudian en la escuela y el menor se encuentra a su cuidado, viven en la casa de sus familiares construida de ladrillo y cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es la venta de carne, sus cortes más vendidos son; bife de chorizo, bola de lomo, colita, corazón de cuadril, cuadrada, lomo, nalga, peceto, tapa de nalga, tortuguita, vacío, matambre, entraña, tapa de asado, ojo de bife, aguja y paleta. Trabajo que realiza en un cuarto de su casa habilitado como carnicería y también como tienda de barrio porque vende refrescos, huevo, verduras, etc. “antes trabajaba como peinadora asalariada, por consejo de una prima decidí abrir mi propio negocio, ahora tengo nuevas metas por cumplir…” comenta. su sueño es abrir una sucursal en un barrio cercano, porque tiene muchos clientes que vienen desde el vecino barrio a comprarle. Ella desea realizar la ampliación de su carnicería mediante la refacción del vidrio de su exhibidora de carne, que se encuentra dañado y no puede ser utilizada porque se escapa el frio. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 9 meses que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Katia solicita un préstamo para la reparación de su exhibidora de carne para ofertar más variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Katia is 34 years old, single, and a patient, steadfast, and devoted mother of two daughters, ages 8 and 3, and a 6-year-old son. The two oldest children attend primary school while the youngest still stays home with Katia. The family lives with some of Katia's relatives in a brick home that has running water and electricity. Katia is petite, with a brown complexion and long dark hair; she is also a native Aymara speaker, though she typically uses Spanish in her business. 

Katia is also a committed and diligent businesswoman who runs a butcher shop in a vibrant commercial neighborhood in the southern part of La Paz, where the climate is warm and dry. The most popular cuts of meat in the shop include chorizo beef, round, rump steak, flank steak, rib eye, chuck steak, and others. Katia also sells soft drinks, eggs, vegetables, and other groceries. The business is in a room in the family's home that Katia has converted into a butcher shop. Katia used to work as a staff hairdresser in a salon, but followed a cousin's advice to open her own business, and now works for herself, sets her own priorities, and meets the goals that she has set.  

Katia's ambition is to open a second shop in a nearby part of town, as so many of her customers come to her current location from that neighborhood to buy from her. She'd also like to improve her current location by repairing the display case window, which is broken and makes proper refrigeration impossible. Katia  opened the shop nine months ago and is applying for her first loan in order to pay for the repair of the window and offer a greater variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: for the repair of her display case, which will allow her to offer her customers greater variety.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina tiene 68 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge e hija. Ella cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Su familia es muy unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Luz Marina se dedica a la cría y venta de animales menores (pavos, patos, gallinas) en el distrito de Saña desde hace aproximadamente más de 10 años. El destino del préstamo es para la compra de animales, alimentación y arreglo de corral, para poder criar en mejores condiciones y calidad a sus animales. Al aumentar su stock y diversificarlo Luz Marina podrá satisfacer las diversas necesidades y preferencias de su público consumidor; lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is 68 years old, and lives in her home with her husband and daughter. She counts on good personal and working references, and she has a very united family. She lives in a community that is engaged in commerce, agriculture, and raising livestock. It is located in the Saña district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the norhern coast of Peru.

Luz Marina raises and sells small animals, such as squirrels, ducks, and hens, in the Saña district. She has done this for approximately more than ten years. This loan will be used to purchase animals and feed and to repair the corral, which will allow her to be able to raise her animals in better conditions, resulting in improved quality. 

By increasing and diversifying her stock, Luz Marina will be able to satisfy the diverse needs and preferences of her consumers, which will allow her in the short term to increase her income and profits, and in the end, improve the quality of life for her family and herself.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed and to repair the corral to be able to raise her animals under better conditions for improved quality.

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: A sus 24 años Fátima ha logrado salir adelante con la venta de ropa interior, está casada pero aún no tiene hijos. Hace tres años inicio vendiendo ropa interior variada y con las ganancias obtenidas logro incrementar su inventario. Su esposo le apoya en los gastos familiares ya que tiene un negocio de elaboración de zapato. Solicita el crédito para compra mas cantidad de ropa interior variada. Este crédito le será de mucho beneficio ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y con ella la época de regalos y sus clientes presentan mayor demanda. Su plan futuro es establecer otro tramo y ofrecer mayor mercadería a sus clientes.
texts.en: At 24, Fatima has managed to get ahead through the sale of lingerie. She is married and has no children yet. Three years ago, she began selling various lingerie and underwear. With her profits, she has increased her inventory. Her husband supports her in paying household expenses as he has a business making shoes. She is requesting a loan to purchase a higher amount and more varied underwear. The loan will be of great benefit because the holiday season is approaching and it is the time to give gifts. Her customers have increased demand. Her future plan is to take another step and offer more merchandise to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of underwear to sell during the holiday season

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 35 years old and married with three children. With her three children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Angeline runs a general store in the Philippines. She sells a variety of items such as detergent, soap, shampoo, canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, cereals, etc. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items, as listed above, to sell.

Angeline has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items like detergent, soap, shampoo, canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Isrrael Benjamin

texts.es:
Israel de 52 años de edad, está casado y tiene 6 hijos, 28, 27, 26, 24,21 y 16 años de edad solo el menor estudio y los demás ayudan en el trabajo de campo a su padre, solo cuatro hijos y su esposa viven con él. Solo estudió hasta primer grado de educación básica.

Israel es agricultor desde que tenía 15 años aprendió con su padre que siempre lo educó para que algún día dependiera de este trabajo, no tiene otra fuente de ingreso, camina 10 minutos para llegar al lugar de trabajo y la lo realiza por 6 horas desde la 6:00 am.

Solicita el préstamo para pagar mano de obra para cosechar su cultivo y para pagar maquinaria para desgranar la mazorca y preparar el grano para la venta. Espera seguir trabajando y con ello sacar a delante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Israel is 52 years old, married, and has 6 children ages 28, 27, 26, 24, 21, and 16 years of age. Only the youngest is in school; the others help their father with the farming. Only four children and his wife live with him. Israel completed a first grade basic education. He is a farmer and since he was 15 years old he learned with his father who educated him so that one day he could do this work. Israel doesn't have any other source of income. He walks 10 minutes to arrive to work and works from 6:00 AM for 6 hours.

He seeks a loan to pay for labor to harvest his crop and to pay for the machinery to take the corn off the cobs and prepare the grain for sale. He hopes to continue working and help his son get ahead.

loans.use: to pay for labor to harvest his crop and to pay for the machinery to take the corn off the cobs.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia works hard to support her family. She is widowed and does business buying and selling herbal medicines in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional quantities of herbal medicines to sell.

Aurelia has been in this business for 7 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional quantities of herbal medicines to sell

loans.name: Ma. Romelia

texts.en:
Ma. Romelia is married, with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Romelia is 45 years old and has four children in school.

Ma. Romelia has a business selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines. Ma. Romelia has requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Ma. Romelia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Ma. Romelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items of ready-to-wear to sell

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San (shown in the photo) is 31 years old. She lives at Kean Svay district, Kandal province, Cambodia. She has been married since 2003 and has two daughters and two sons. Two of her children are attending school and the others are still young.

San is a battery-charging entrepreneur with six years of experience, while her husband is a fisherman with 15 years of experience. She wants to apply for a loan to buy pigs to raise, because she wants to earn more money to support her whole family. She said that she wants life to be bright in the future.

loans.use: tbuy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por 20 mujeres inspiradas en una mejor y buena calidad de vida, tienen como objetivo poner mucho empeño en sus actividades laborales para ir creciendo en el ámbito económico y para un buen  estilo de vida de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Hilaria, que se encuentra contenta por formar parte del comité, así ella y sus compañeras cuentan con una oportunidad de poder trabajar y generar sus propios ingresos, son mujeres que desean mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Ella se dedica a hacer comidas varias que luego sale a vender de manera ambulante, ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser carne, verduras, hortalizas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su emprendimiento como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The committee is made up of 20 women inspired to pursue a better quality of life. Their objective is to put great effort in their work to continue growing in the economic sector and to create a good lifestyle for their families.

One of the members is Hilaria, who is happy to be part of the committee for it allows her and her peers the opportunity to work and generate their own incomes. They are woman who hope to improve the quality of life for their families.

She makes a living by preparing various meals which she later sells by traveling around as a street vendor. She asks for this loan to buy supplies to prepare her food, such as meat, vegetables, leafy greens and more, so that she can continue with her enterprise as she has been.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, leafy greens and more to make meals for sale

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a 56 year old married woman and a mother of eight grown-up children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She earns a living through her hog raising business. Arlene has been in the business for more than 10 years now. She is in need of additional capital for the expansion of her business.

Arlene is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise and animal feed. With this, she will be able to raise more pigs which she can sell to the market after several weeks.

In the future, Arlene has hopes of making her business more profitable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix, is married and operates a farm where he grows fruit trees, vegetables and other root crops. He has been involved in farming since he was young. His farm is located in a fertile area, and his primary source of income is bananas and coconut.

Felix says his biggest business challenge is price stability. He will use this loan to buy farm inputs like organic fertilizer to have a more productive harvest.

His business goal is to be a successful farmer within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to invest in his business.

loans.use: to  buy farm inputs like organic fertilizer to have a more productive harvest

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Maribel works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell frozen foods. Maribel is borrowing PHP 19,500 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle.

Maribel has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Jesus Heraldo

texts.es:
Jesús de 35 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad que no están estudiando. Él estudió hasta 9° grado y se retiró por no tener recursos económicos para seguir estudiando. Su esposa es ama de casa y solo ella y sus hijos viven con él.

Jesús es albañil desde hace 15 años, aprendió trabajando como ayudante para un amigo, antes era agricultor pero no tenía los ingresos que tiene hoy trabajando por contrato, a veces tiene que ir a otro departamento a trabajar.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar dos novillas que le venden a buen precio, ya tiene una que por falta de tiempo con su trabajo se las cuida el papá. Sueña con tener vacas en ordeño para vender leche y sus derivados así como para vender terneros.
texts.en:
Jesús is 35 years old, married, and has two children ages 8 and 5 who do not attend school. Jesus completed a 9th grade education and stopped his education only because of his family's economic situation. His spouse is a housewife and only she and the children live with Jesus. Jesus has worked as a bricklayer for 15 years. He learned the work as an assistant for a friend. Previously he was a farmer but didn't have income compared to what he has today. Sometimes he has to go to a neighboring department (region) to work.

He seeks a loan to buy two calves at a good price. He has one that his father takes care of because of how busy he is with work. He dreams of having milking cows in order to sell milk and dairy products as well as to be able to sell calves.

loans.use: to buy two calves at a good price.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is from the village of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She has been planting and harvesting bananas and other crops to sell. She used her previous loan for fertilization of her farm, and it helped improve the farm. The loan was repaid successfully. She is taking a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer to restore nutrients on the entire farm. She wants to have an improved and sustainable farm and a better living in the near future with her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José de 29 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene dos hijos de 12 y 9 años de edad ambos estudian, él estudio hasta bachillerato, su esposa es ama de casa y solo ella y sus dos hijos viven con él.

José se dedica a hacer pedidos de repuestos por mayoreo y luego visita a sus clientes que están hasta en otros departamentos que le compran dichos pedidos, viaja en autobús y solamente a esto se dedica.

Solicita el crédito para realizarle un estudio clínico a su madre que se encuentra mal de salud y está a punto de operarse. Es un examen urgente y necesario para el diagnóstico. José espera su madre se recupere y seguirá trabajando para tener sus medicinas a tiempo.
texts.en:
José is 29 years old. He is in a common-law marriage and has two children, ages twelve and nine, who are both in school. He has a high school education, his wife is a homemaker, and both of his children live with him. He works buying orders of spare parts wholesale and delivering them to his customers, who live in other areas and buy from him. He travels by bus and this is his only job.

José is requesting this loan so that his mother can get some medical exams done. She is not in good health and is about to get surgery. It's an urgent exam and she needs to have it done in order to get a diagnosis. José hopes his mother will recover, and he will continue working in order to have her medicines on time.

loans.use: to pay for his mother's medical exams.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan de 54 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 5 hijos, solo cuatro viven con él y de los cuatro solo uno estudia los otros le ayudan trabajando en el campo.

Juan es agricultor desde que tenía 14 años de edad, aprendió gracias a su papá, para llegar al lugar de trabajo camina 15 minutos y lo hace de 6:00 am hasta las 12:00 m. solamente esta es su fuente de ingresos.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar 14 quintales de maíz debido a que tuvo problemas con su cultivo y decidió mejor comprar el grano, además quiere comprar una novilla. Juan sueña con seguir trabajando y comprar más vacas para seguir vendiendo leche y sus derivados.
texts.en:
Juan is 54 years old. He is in a common-law marriage and has five children, four of whom live at home. One of the four is in school and the others help him in the fields.

Juan has been a farmer since he was fourteen years old. He learned from his father. His place of work is a fifteen-minute walk away. He works from 6:00 am to 12:00 pm. This is his only source of income.

He is requesting this loan to buy fourteen quintals of corn, because he had trouble with his crops and has decided to purchase the grain. He also wants to buy a heifer. Juan wants to keep working and purchase more cows in order to continue selling milk and dairy products.

loans.use: to buy fourteen quintals of corn.

loans.name: Srea's Group

texts.en: Srea’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Srea makes a living cultivating rice. He also does extra work as a tailor and as a construction worker to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each group member to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. They will also save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase towel cloth for his factory.

loans.name: Mab

texts.en:
Mab (shown in photo) is 22 years old, single and lives with his family in the Pon-Nhea Leu district, Kandal province, Cambodia. He is a student at the university.

He is studying for his bachelor's degree, now in his first year, first semester, at Build Bright University, majoring in Management. He would like to apply for a loan to pay his school fees.

He will graduate when he is 25, in October of 2018. He strongly hopes that he will become a good manager in the future.

loans.use: To pay his school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items for his shop.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 30 años de edad, vive con sus hijo, en el sector de Ex Pesebre, donde la vida es muy tranquila y armoniosa. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Jessica se dedica a las actividad de venta de abarrotes con más de 1 año de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en su domicilio, Jessica solicita préstamo para la compra de mercaderia(arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc), dicha inversión le servirá para poder diversificar y aumentar su stock para poder cumplir y/o satisfacer las diversas necesidades y preferencias de su público consumidor. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jessica is 30 years old, she lives with her children in the Ex Pesebre sector, where life is tranquil and harmonious. The base economy of her community is  agriculture, cattle raising, and commerce. Located in the district of Cayalti, Chiclayo province, northern coast of Peru.

Jessica makes a living by selling groceries out of her home. She has more than one of year of experience in this business. Jessica is requesting a loan to purchase commodities (rice, sugar, olive oil, etc...) this investment will serve to diversity and and increase her inventory to fulfill and satisfy the diverse needs and preferences of the consuming public. This could allow her to improve short term revenue, grow her earnings, and ultimately improve the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: Jessica is requesting a loan to purchase commodities (rice, sugar, olive oil, etc...) this investment will serve to diversity and and increase her inventory.

loans.name: Sokh's Group

texts.en: Sokh’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sokh makes a living cultivating rice. He also does extra work as a tailor and as a construction worker to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. It will also help them save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 54 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She used her previous loan from GDMPC for her farm, and it helped to improve and increase her farm yields.

Now she wants to fertilize the entire farm to restore nutrients to the soil. She took a new loan recently to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticides to have a more productive harvest. Her future plan is to improve the entire farm and be able to renovate her family's house, to make it more comfortable for them all to live in.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticides to have a more productive harvest

loans.name: Kimratvannak

texts.en:
Kimratvannak (in the photo) is twenty years old, single, and lives with his parents and sisters in a suburb of Phnom Penh. His parents sell noodles with soup. 

Kimratvannak is now a second-year, second-semester student at Phnom Penh University, majoring in Electrical Engineering. He hopes to graduate with a degree that will get him into a professional position. 

He is applying for a 250 USD loan through MAXIMA to pay his tuition.

loans.use: To pay his tuition.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 58 years old. She is known in the Dapitan City area for her sari-sari store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. 

She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she has asked a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and lumber. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). 

This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and lumber for her house.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry owns and operates an agriculture business, planting and harvesting corn to sell. Jerry has been engaged in his business for four years and earns well from these activities. 

His farm is still doing well, and yet he needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently, he took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer to have a more productive farm. 

He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his farm as well as to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to have a more productive farm.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is 33 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling nipa roofing in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

Mirasol has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business buying and selling nipa roofing for 11 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor de 50 años de edad está casado y tiene 4 hijos de 27, 26, 22 y 21 años de edad,  dos ya trabajan como profesionales y dos viven con él y su esposa. Tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y se graduó de contaduría pública. 

Victor tiene 20 años de trabajar como contador,  lo hace en su casa desde que se graduó, con el tiempo ha ido obteniendo clientes a los que les hace la declaración de la renta, no involucra a sus hijos debido a que todavía están estudiando. Su  le apoya con algunos trámites, trabaja de 8:00 am hasta las 4:00 pm.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar un mueble para su computadora y uno para guardar sus facturas, solo cuenta con un escritorio y con frecuencia se llena de papeles. Victor sueña con que su hijo menor termine sus estudios, ya que es la única herencia que le va a dejar.
texts.en:
Victor is fifty years old. He is married and has four children, ages 27, 26, 22, and 21. Two of them already work as professionals and the other two still live at home. He was able to go to school and graduated with a degree in Public Accounting.

Victor has been working as an accountant for twenty years. He has been working from home ever since he graduated. In time, he garnered more and more customers, for whom he files tax returns. He doesn't get his children involved in the business because they are still in school, but he gets some help with certain paperwork. He works from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm.

He is requesting this loan to buy a stand for his computer and a file cabinet to keep his invoices. He only has one desk now, which is often piled up with papers. Victor's dream is for his youngest son to finish school, since that is his only legacy.

loans.use: to buy a computer stand and a file cabinet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric for his factory

loans.name: Piseth

texts.en:
Piseth (photo) is eighteen years old, single and lives with his parents in Phnom Penh. His father has been a teacher at a public school for 10 years. 

Piseth is now a first-year, first-semester student at Sitech Institute, majoring in Information Technology systems. He hopes to graduate with a degree that will get him into a professional position. 

He is applying for a 580 USD loan through MAXIMA to pay his tuition.

loans.use: To pay his school fees.

location.town: Chroy Changva district Phnom Penh city

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Kyrey esta en su Segundo ciclo, también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, como un medio de que cada una conozca su situación de vida y pueda mejorarla.
La señora Susana, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que debe esforzarse un poco mas para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Susana se dedica a la venta de joyas variadas, y comenta que ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, y que siempre le hacen muchos pedidos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar joyas variadas para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar cada día. Todas las integrantes agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
The group named “Kuña Kyrey” is in its second loan cycle. The members are also participating in the poverty elimination program so that each woman can become familiar with her life situation and be able to make improvements.

Sra. Susana’s survey indicated that she is at a Stage 1 poverty level. What this means is that she must try a bit harder so that she can improve her living conditions. Susana sells various types of jewelry. She says that she has built up a very good clientele and her customers always place many orders.

Susana is requesting a loan in order to buy various types of jewelry that she can sell. As a result, she can continue her sales and strive to improve each day. All of the members appreciate the opportunity they have received so that they can improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy various types of jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel is 71 years old and lives in Molave-Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is a widow with one adult son. She has a hectare of land where she grows coconut and corn, which is now managed by her son.

Ariel has done this farming activity for five decades now. She has requested a loan to pay for labor and corn land cultivation. She has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Ariel wants her son to have a stable career.

loans.use: to pay for labor and corn land cultivation

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can obtain financial assistance for her chosen business. 

Diosdada has maintained her membership in good standing without default up to this day. She has taken several loans, and all were repaid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she obtained a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Diosdada wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of  feed and animal vitamins

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty lives in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a pensioner at 74 years old, with two adult children. 

She borrowed an amount of PHP 50,000 for purchasing materials for house repair. This financial assistance, aided by PMPC, toward Letty will help her to have a comfortable home to live in.

loans.use: To purchase materials for housing repair

loans.name: Balbena

texts.en:
Balbena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase fish net, wood, bamboo, etc., for her fishing business.

Balbena has been in this business for five years.  She also earns income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish net, wood, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Thuon's Group

texts.en:
Thuon’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Thuon makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families as well as save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Phak's Group

texts.en: Phak’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Phak makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families as well as save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Koemsrean's Group

texts.en:
Koemsrean’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Koemsrean makes a living cultivating rice and planting watermelons, and she also does extra work as a construction worker to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families as well as save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Samut's Group

texts.en:
Samut’s group livess in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Samut makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a construction worker to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families as well as save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on products for her store.

loans.name: Cristóbal Silva

texts.es:
Llegar de nuevo a la finca de Cristóbal seis meses después de su último préstamo fue bastante motivador, ya que se observa que este agricultor de maíz y criador de vacas, ha podido acondicionar mejor el lugar. Él se siente muy agradecido con todas las personas que lo ayudaron con el préstamo anterior, con el que compró los alambres para mejorar el potrero y pudo limpiar el lugar para la cosecha de esa temporada. 
Cristóbal de 53 años de edad, también se dedica a cortar semilla de zacate para venderla en la nueva temporada, la cual hace falta poco para iniciar. Por esta razón es que solicita un nuevo préstamo para pagarle a sus trabajadores y comprar zacate para obtener un excelente corte de semilla de este mismo y poder venderlas. Al terminar de pagar este crédito, considera pedir uno nuevo para comenzar el próximo año con el pie derecho en la siembra de maíz.
texts.en:
Arriving again at Cristobal's farm six months after his last loan was very motivating, as one can see that this corn and livestock farmer has been able to improve his farm. He is very grateful to all the people who helped him with the previous loan, with which he bought the wire to improve the pasture and he could clean the fields for this season's crops.

Cristobal is 53 years old and he also cuts forrage to sell in the new season, which will begin shortly. For this reason he seeks a new loan to pay his workers and buy forrage in order to have an excellent seed harvest and be able to sell it. Upon finishing paying this loan, he will consider asking for a new loan to being the next year on the right foot with his planting of corn.

loans.use: to pay his workers and buy forrage.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace the sheet metal in one of the rooms in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in materials for her business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is living in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 60 years old and married with 2 school-age and 6 adult children. 

She has a hog raising business which generates her income. She has been in the business for 10 years since her children have all started school. 

Her growing piglets need enough vitamins to be healthy so she requested a loan of 14,900 PHP. 

This financial assistance, given by PMPC, will help increase her income and sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and vitamins for her growing hogs and piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Kulbarchyn

texts.ru: Кульбарчын, 59 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. В поиске источника доходов для своей семьи, она с 2005 года стала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Кульбарчын достигла хороших успехов и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеется 3 коровы, 20 овец. На участке мерою 3,33 Га, выращивает горох, Кульбарчын обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 140,000 сом (KGS), который она направит на покупку 2 коров, 8 овец. Доходы от кредита Кульбарчын планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Kulbarchyn is 59 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. In search of a source of income for her family, she became involved in farming and animal husbandry in 2005. Thanks to her strenuous and extensive work, Kulbarchyn achieved good results and started to earn a monthly profit in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Today her farm contains 3 cows and 20 sheep. She grows peas on 3.33 hectares of land. Kulbarchyn requested a loan in the amount of 140,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 2 cows and 8 sheep. Kulbarchyn plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows and 8 sheep in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Tazhikan

texts.ru: Тажикан, 57 лет,  замужем, 4 детей. У Тажикан высшее образование, она спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. Тажикан работает кассиром в музее изобразительных искуств и получает ежемесячную зарплату в размере около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Тажикан в этом году хочет сделать ремонт в доме, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS). На полученные средства она купит обои, краску, батареи и прочие строительные материалы. Получив кредит, Тажикан сможет сэкономить свою заработную плату и откладывать ее на дальнейшее улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Tazhikan is 57 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  She has a higher education.  She is quiet, well-balanced and hardworking.  She works as a cashier at the Museum of fine Arts and she receives a monthly salary of about 5,000 som (KGS).  This year, she would like to make some repairs in her house, and for this reason, she has turned to Bai Tushum for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy wallpapers, paints, radiators and other building materials.  Thanks to this loan, she will be able to save her salary and invest it into further improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wallpapers, paints, radiators and other materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира, 54 года, замужем, имеет 6 детей. Образование - высшее, работает в школе учителем. Также Замира в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав в 1998 году. Благодаря упорному труду Замиры, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы. На участке мерою 1,53 Га она выращивает пшеницу и кукурузу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Замира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Замира планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Zamira is 54 years old, married, and she has six children.  She has a higher education and works as a teacher in a school.  In addition, she became involved in agriculture and animal husbandry in 1998, and these two activities constitute her family's main source of income.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns four cows and she grows wheat and corn on 1.53 hectare of land.  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy additional livestock for fattening and resale.  Zamira plans to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda Gambo is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Dauda Gambo joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Gabriel, Meshak and Jeremiah. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Dauda Gambo would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs to purchase items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dauda Gambo can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price during harvest. When asked, Dauda Gambo  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Diana works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Diana is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase scissors, sewing thread, a tape measure, needles, and clothing materials for her tailoring business.

Diana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase scissors, sewing thread, a tape measure, needles, and clothing materials.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mohammed would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mohammed can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Mohammed said, “I would now be able to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for my family, and eventually become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
A farmer from Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines is no other than Nila. She is 51 years old with two adult-age children and she is happily married. 

Nila generates income through her wide range of farming business in her barangay. But, Nila needs financial assistance to sustain the good growth of her plants and to have a good harvest in her production. That's why she asked for help from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC), to loan an amount of PHP 20,000. This will help Nila in her endeavor.

loans.use: to buy farm insecticide and fertilizer.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 50-year-old, married woman, residing in Mcarthur, Leyte. She is a mother of six children. Her youngest child is 19. 

Teresita raises and sells hogs. In addition to that, she engages in a tuba (coconut) wine-vending business. She makes and sells coconut wine to the nearby community. She has been engaged in this kind of business for more than 20 years.

Teresita is asking for a loan  in the amount of PHP 20,000 to purchase an additional piglet and tungog (it has a maroon color and gives a bitter taste that helps the natural fermentation in tuba (coconut) wine). These are very important tools needed to operate her livelihood. With this loan, she could produce more tuba, at the same time raising and selling more pigs in the coming few months.

In the future, Teresita dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable, to support the college education of her child.

loans.use: to purchase an additional piglet and tungog (it has a maroon color and gives a bitter taste that helps the natural fermentation in tuba (coconut) wine).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve the pasture for his livestock to increase production output, and give a better life to his family

loans.name: Decenia

texts.en:
Decenia is married with two children; she manages a piggery for a living. She has been raising pigs for many years. Aside from this, she was also engaged with other businesses, like transportation services and nipa making. She always finds ways to augment their living. 

Her previous loan, used for buying livestock feeds and piggery maintenance, has been repaid successfully. She took a new loan recently  to purchase additional piglets, feeding supplies for her piggery, and motor repair and maintenance costs. 

She wants to expand her business, as well as improving the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feeding supplies for her piggery and motor repair and maintenance costs

loans.name: Ave Fenix Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Ave Fenix está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 1 de las integrantes se encuentra en un nivel rojo y debe mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juana quien se dedica a las ventas, tiene una despensa en la que trabaja y lucha día a día para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Juana es una persona muy luchadora y trabajadora.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, bebidas, panificados, frutas, carnes  y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group Ave Fenix is on its third loan cycle of the program of women committees, where they all work and help each other get ahead. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, where one of the members is in a red level and needs to improve. 
One of the members is Juana, who makes a living with sales. She has a grocery store in which she works and struggles day to day to be able to help her family and her loved ones. 
Juana is a hard-working and determined person. She asks for this loan to be able to buy several supplies for her store, such as vegetables, drinks, baked goods, fruits, meats, and more, and in this way be able to continue with her work as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, drinks, baked goods, fruits, meats, and more.

loans.name: Claidy

texts.en:
Claidy owns and operates an agriculture business growing bananas for sale. Victor has been engaged in this business for many years and he earns well from these activities. His farm is still doing well, and he earns well after taking his previous loan.  

Recently, Claidy took a new loan from GDMPC micro to buy organic fertilizer for a more productive farm. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his farm to improve his farm as well as the family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for a more productive farm

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo  se llama Mujeres Emprendedoras está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento.
