La Sra. Maria es una de las integrantes, ella es comerciante, tiene una mercería donde vende todo tipo de productos, y comenta que le va muy bien en sus ventas, y que por medio de este trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas, calzados y demás artículos de bazar para la venta. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de de poder seguir con su trabajo y crecer para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Emprendedoras is in its first loan cycle in the committee women's program in the city of Concepcion, which is located a little distance from the city center zone and in an area that is still growing.

Maria is one of the members. She is a businesswoman and has a general store where she sells all kinds of products. She comments that her sales are going very well and through this work she has the means to be able to support her family. She seeks this loan to buy clothing items, shoes and other general items to sell. She is thankful for the opportunity that she receives to be able to continue with her work and grow in order to help her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing items, shoes and other general items to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is a 59-year-old married man. He settled to earn his living in Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, together with his three children. For many years, Carlos was able to manage his farm that absolutely met the needs of his family. Until now, the farm was still doing well and was giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. With his generated revenue, he was able to save for their future needs. 

Recently, he took a new loan to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer to improve his farm. With the acquisition of in-demand basic commodities, Carlos expects an increase in the harvest so as to expand his farm and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer to improve his farm

loans.name: Erica

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Erica works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell gasoline business in the Philippines. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional containers of gasoline to sell for her buy and sell gasoline business.

Erica has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additonal containers of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorreti is a 34-year-old female, single with five children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Gorreti is a fish monger; she has been in the fish business for eight years. She has managed to acquire land and start construction with the proceeds from her business. 

She has a dream of completing her house, however, she is faced with a challenge of poor roads leading to high transport costs and weather changes affecting her business. 

Gorreti intends to use the loan to buy iron sheets and timber to roof her house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets and timber to roof her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cloth for his shop.

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en:
Nat’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Nat makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor and construction worker to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kheang's Group

texts.en:
Kheang’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Kheang makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama San Juan, es un grupo compuesta por 18 mujeres, se encuentran en el segundo ciclo, son de la ciudad de Santaní, una zona eminentemente rural y que aun sigue en crecimiento. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras.
Todas las integrantes se dedican a actividades rurales, como la cría y venta de animales, una de ellas es la Sra. Alejandra, que también se dedica a la cría de animales de corral y su posterior venta, comenta que también es la presidenta del grupo.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, de manera a poder seguir con la cría y venta de animales para poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en: The committee's name is San Juan. It is a group comprised by 18 members, who are in their second loan cycle. They are from the city of Santani, a mainly rural area which is still growing. They are very hardworking women. All of the members work in rural activities, such as raising and selling animals. One of them is Alejandra, who also works raising farmyard animals and selling them later. She says that she is also the president of the group. She is requesting this loan to buy balanced food for her animals, in order to continue raising and selling animals and be able to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy balanced food for animals.

loans.name: Alicio

texts.es:
El Sr. Alicio es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, es presidente de la Aguatería Saguasu, comenta que la Aguatería que preside tiene 180 usuarios, y por medio de su servicio le da a estas personas el acceso a algo tan importe como es el agua.
Comenta que la junta que él preside desea poder ir mejorando para hacer llegar ese servicio a más usuarios.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de un motor de agua más potente ya que el que poseen ya no da abasto.
texts.en:
Alicio is from the city of Paraguarí, and is the president of the Saguasu Water Plant. He comments that the Water Plant over which he presides has 180 users, and by means of its service, gives to these people access to something as important as water.

He comments that the committee over which he presides wishes to be able to go on making improvements to make this service come to more users. 

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of a more powerful water motor since the one that they possess cannot keep up.

loans.use: to purchase a water motor.

loans.name: La Florida Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “La Florida” conformado por 06 socias emprendedoras y dinámicas. Rosa de 21 años de edad  es soltera. Ella se dedica  a la venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos. Producto a su constante dedicación ha logrado obtener más clientes lo cual le permite crecer en su negocio. Su mayor deseo es contar con una tienda bazar. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de cremas, talcos, perfumes y colonias. El grupo “La Florida” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por facilitar este crédito. Rosa es la tercera del lado derecho y viste chompa crema.
texts.en:
This is the group "La Florida", composed of six dynamic and entrepreneurial  members.  Rosa, age 21, is single.  She makes a living selling beauty products and cosmetics. As a result of her constant dedication she has managed to obtain more customers, which has allowed her to increase her business.  Her primary wish is to have a stationery shop.  She asked for the loan in order to purchase creams, powders, perfumes, and colognes.  

The group "La Florida" thanks the Kiva investors for making this loan possible.  Rosa is the third from the right, wearing a cream colored sweater.

loans.use: to purchase creams, powders, perfumes and colognes.

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en:
Nary’s group lives in a rural village in the Battambang province of Cambodia. Nary works as a farmer to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara es de la ciudad de Villarrica, ella esta luchando por poder ser una profesional exitosa, que pueda ayudar a los demás por medio de su carrera.
Ella esta estudiando la carrera de derecho, y quiere poder ser útil, no solo a si mismo, sino también a los demás, y es por eso que está luchando.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Sara is from the city of Villarrica. She is striving to become a successful professional who can help others through her career.

She is studying law and wants to be useful, not only to herself but also to others and that is why she is striving for this.

She requests this loan in order to pay her tuition and in this way, continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Miguel está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo, que se formo en la ciudad de  Curuguaty,  una zona que aun se encuentra en crecimiento y bastante alejada de la capital de país.
La Sra. Maria es una de la integrante, ella se dedica a las pequeñas ventas de queso leche y también se dedica a la cría de  animales domésticos, como gallinas, cerdos y otros.  Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de las capacitaciones y a través del programa de comités vaya mejorando.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de balanceados, animales para la cría y otros. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The group San Miguel is in its number one cycle of the program of women committees. It is a new group, which was formed in the city of Curuguaty, in an area that is still growing, and quite far away from the capital of the country.
Maria is one of the members, she makes a living with small sales of milk cheese, and also by breeding domestic animals, such as chickens, pigs, and others.
She hopes that as times goes by, and through the training and the committees program, she will improve.She asks for this loan to buy animal feed, animals for breeding, and more. In this way, she will be able to keep growing her business, and give her family what they need to have a life without deprivation.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, animals for breeding, and more.

loans.name: San Pedro Y San Pablo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Pedro y San Pablo se formo en la ciudad de Curuguaty, una zona eminentemente rural y que aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Todas las integrantes de este grupo desean un mejor bienestar para sus familias.
La Sra. Evarista es una de las integrantes, ella tiene una despensa bien surtida que formo con mucho sacrifico y esfuerzo, y que hoy es el sostén de su familia y le permite darles una vida sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para poder surtir su negocio, con verduras, carne, productos a granel, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo y sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Las integrantes de este grupo están agradecidas por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo de ir mejorando cada día.
texts.en:
The group called "San Pedro y San Pablo" was formed in the city of Curuguaty, a very rural area that is still growing. All the members of this group want better well-being for their families.

Evarista is one member. She has a well stocked store that she made htrough much sacrifice and effort. Today it sustains her family and allows her to provide them with a life without hardships. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy a variety of supplies to stock her store. Like vegetables meat, bulk products, breads and others. In this way she can continue with her work and her sales as she has been doing.

The members of the group are grateful for the opportunity that they are receiving to improve every day.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, bulk products, breads,etc.

loans.name: Kuña Joaju Kuera Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Joaju Kuera; está en su ciclo número    3  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, es un grupo que se formo para que las integrantes puedan ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo unido de todas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Liz, quien está en pareja y tiene 2 hijos;  ella en su última encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza mostro que ha podido mejorar mucho. Liz tiene un cotillón donde vende todo tipo de productos varios.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar artículos para fiestas, mascaras, globos y otros artículos de cotillón, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Todas ellas luchan por sus familias, para poder darles una mejor vida.
texts.en:
The group named Kuña Joaju Kuera is in its third cycle number of the women’s committee program, where they all work and help each other to come out ahead. It is a group that formed so that the members could help their families by means of the all of their combined work.

One of the members is Liz, who is in a relationship and has 2 children. In her last survey for the elimination of poverty, she showed that she has been able to improve a lot. Liz has a party favor store where she sells all types of varied products.

She is requesting this loan to be able to purchase items for parties, masks, balloons, and other party favor items, in a way to be able to continue with her work as she has been doing. The all struggle for their families, to be able to give them a better life.

loans.use: to purchase parties, masks, balloons, and other party favor items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase:  yucca, corn on the cob, corn, oil, tomatoes, sugar, vegetables, etc. for the sale of local dishes.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
Shirley proviene de una familia humilde y trabajadora, ella está vendiendo ropas para poder seguir con sus estudios, quiere terminar su profesión y abrir su propio consultorio cuando se reciba de enfermera.
Ella es una persona luchadora que se está esforzando por poder salir adelante y ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Shirley comes from a humble and hard-working family. She is selling clothing to be able to continue with her studies. She wants to finish her degree and open her own practice when she graduates as a nurse.
She is a determined person who is making an effort to be able to get ahead and be somebody in life. 
She asks for this loan to pay her degree fees, and in this way be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Nathalia

texts.es:
Nathalia es estudiante de la carrera de Derecho, es soltera vive con sus padres que son comerciantes, dentro de unos años se ve ejerciendo su profesión. Le gustaría  terminar su carrera y trabajar en su propia oficina.
Ella es una persona que se esfuerza y está luchando por ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Nathalia is studying for a law degree. She is single and lives with her parents, who are retailers by trade. She sees herself practicing her profession in a few years. She would like to finish her degree and work in her own office.
She is a person who makes an effort and is determined to be somebody in life.
She asks for this loan to pay her degree fees, and in this way be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yessica es estudiante de la carrera de Derecho, actualmente está cursando el primer año, y tiene como meta ser una buena profesional y ayudar a las demás personas. Vive con sus padres en casa propia ella es comerciante vende productos de cosméticos para poder seguir sus estudios.
 Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus cuotas, de manera a seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Yessica is a first year Law student and her goal is to become a good professional and to help other people. She lives with her parents in their own house.
She sells cosmetics to support her studies.

She is asking for this loan to cover her education costs so that she can continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay her university costs

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en: A farmer from Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur is no other than Wilfredo. He is happily married with children at age 64. He has a rice field where income generation takes place. He has been in the business for many years already and has become a member of PMPC since the year 2012. To maintain good growth of his crops, he is borrowing money from PMPC amounting to PHP 36,000 to buy bottles of chemicals and sacks of fertilizers. This is indeed helpful to Wilfredo as a farmer and the father of his family.

loans.use: to buy bottles of chemicals and sacks of fertilizers to maintain a good crop harvest.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita started her small time business and became successful in managing her sari-sari store. She has to ensure having enough inventory to serve her customers well. She rolls over her capital and additional revenue to gain more profit. Every day she makes good sales since she is the only store in their barangay. Recently she approached Paglaum for her much needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to mount a descent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Angie

texts.en: Angie  is married and lives in Clarin with her family. She earns a better income from her transportation business and was able to support her children's education. She also bought some home appliances from her generated income. Her previous loan was used for maintenance of her vehicle and was repaid successfully. To make her services more comfortable and safe, she took a new loan recently to purchase body parts and accessories for her motorcycle and pay repair costs. She plans to use her profit to buy a sidecar for improvement of her business.

loans.use: to purchase body parts and accessories for her motorcycle and pay repair costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his collection of goods to include detergents

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, esta estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, ella quiere ser una profesional que pueda ayudar a las demás personas.
Rocio quiere ayudar también a su familia, es por ello que esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder cumplir su meta.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la carrera, y de esa forma cada vez estar mas cerca de cumplir su meta de ser un buen administrador.
texts.en:
Rocio is from the city of Caaguazu, and she is studying a degree in business administration. She wants to be a professional who can help other people.
Rocio also wants to help her family, this is why she is making her best effort to be able to achieve her goal.
She asks for this loan to pay her degree fees, and in this way be closer every day to achieving her goal of being a good administrator.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es:
Alexis es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es soltero, vive con sus padres. Estudia, y está cursando el segundo año   de la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial. 
Es una persona que quiere salir adelante, es por eso que esta luchando y esforzándose cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus útiles de la universidad y demás gastos que implica eso.
texts.en:
Alexis is from the city of Curuguaty. He is single and lives with his parents.

He is a student and is in his second year of a Commercial Engineering degree. He is a person who wants to get ahead and that is why he is struggling and striving every day. He is asking for this loan so he can pay his university fees and other related expenses.

loans.use: to pay university fees and other expenses related to his studies.

loans.name: Welfredo

texts.en:
Welfredo is 50 years old and married, with five children.  He lives in the hamlet of Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

He has a farming site where he grows vegetables and generates income to support the needs of his family. 

However, to sustain the needs of his production, he has borrowed PHP10,000 to buy sacks of fertilizers to have a good harvest. 

This is a big help to Welfredo to boost his harvest production..

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer for farming, to sustain the needs of his family

loans.name: Ityan

texts.en:
Ityan is 20 years old and single, living in Irbid with her family. 

Ityan is studying to take her bachelor degree in music. She is in need of a new violin to be able to continue, but she does not want to burden her father with it.  He has a lot of financial responsibilities, having a family of seven members to support. 

She decided to apply for a loan that can help her buy a violin to proceed with her semester classes.

loans.use: to help her buy a violin to proceed with her semester classes.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea vive con su mamá  y su abuela, ella trabaja en un local comercial, está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería en alimentos.
Ella quiere ser una profesional útil para la sociedad y también a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de su tesis, para que de esa forma pueda terminar su carrera.
texts.en:
Andrea lives with her mother and her grandmother. She works in a local store, and is studying a degree in food engineering. 
She wants to be a useful professional for society and also for her family. 
She asks for this loan to be able to invest in the payment of her thesis, and in this way be able to finish her degree.

loans.use: to pay expenses for her thesis.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 45 years old and married, with five children. The oldest is 23 and the youngest is 11. She lives in Mcarthur, Leyte. 

She owns and operates a sari-sari (or variety) store. She sells a variety of merchandise ranging from biscuits, noodles, vinegar, sugar, canned goods, cooking oil, soap, and seasonings. Aside from operating a store, Yolanda also raises and sells hogs, as an additional source of income. She has been engaged in this kind of business for thrree years now.

She is in need of capital to finance her existing business. Yolanda is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 PHP buy more items for the store, like beverages, soft drinks, canned goods, and toiletries, and to purchase pig feed and vitamins. These are essential tools that will help Yolanda fill her store with a variety of stocks and, hopefully, raise healthy pigs in the coming months.

In the future, Yolanda hopes that she can handle both her businesses to be successful and productive for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy more items for her store, like beverages, soft drinks, canned goods, and toiletries and to purchase pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Gretchen

texts.en:
Gretchen is a 30-year-old married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She owns a boarding house, which provides her the income that she needs. The house was ruined after a super typhoon hit the country a year ago. Gretchen is also engaged in a fishing business.

Gretchen is asking for a loan to buy materials for the repair of her house, including wood, nails, cement, gravel, and sand, as well as a new fishing net. This loan will enable to repair and renovate her boarding house, thus allowing to cater to more lodgers. In the future, Gretchen hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her boarding house, including wood, nails, cement, gravel, and sand, as well as a new fishing net

loans.name: Dindo

texts.en:
Dindo, a hard-working farmer from Molave, has invested his time and effort into his rice production. He is 51 years old, happily married, and has two school-aged children. Dindo's rice field is the only means he has to generate income to feed and support his family. However, paying for laborers will cost him. 

Therefore, Dindo is borrowing PHP 50,000 to meet that need. This loan will help him continue his farming activities and he hopes to have a good harvest for the next season.

loans.use: To pay laborers for harvesting crops, purchase fertilizers, and chemicals for a good harvest

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting.  She earns an income as well. Susan has supported her husband with doing this type of work.  

Like a farmer, she has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds which will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.  

Someday, Susan hopes to purchase and cultivate another rice which could potentially add to the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds which will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Sachidananda

texts.en:
Sachidananda is 49 years old and lives in Kelahabad, Deoghar, Jharkhand. He is married and has two sons. His elder son has joined CISF (Central Industrial Security Force) and the younger son is studying. 

Sachidananda is very responsible and persistent by nature. He is a farmer; he has some cultivable land. His family also helps in his business. His family is very tight-knit and amicable towards each other. 

In order to expand his business further, he wants to cultivate potatoes and other vegetables. Sachidananda is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR to buy seeds and fertilizer, etc. This will allow him to increase his agriculture. Also, Sachidananda is planning to save for his son’s education and to reinvest into his business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Deng's Group

texts.en:
Deng, a farmer living in Kampong Cham province, is 41 years old and the mother of two children. 

She overcomes her family’s hardship via rice cropping and rice husking to make extra income. 

For Deng, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of six members, she is the group leader. 

She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Chameli Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en:
The Self-Help Group of “Chameli Mahila Samuha” is being led by Mejun (the lady who is standing with her hand raised). It comprises distinctive and hardworking women members who hail from Josidih, a small village in the Deoghar district of Jharkhand. These members, who run various small businesses, have collectively approached MESP (Micrograam’s field partner) for a loan of INR 50,000. 

Mejun’s husband does brick manufacturing; initially, Mejun and her husband were both working as helpers in a brick manufacturing unit, then recently her husband started his own business. Mejun has two sons. Her younger son is helping his father and the elder son is working under a cement factory as a daily wage laborer. 

The family income is not sufficient to meet the family expenses, so Mejun planned to take a loan from Kiva to invest in her husband’s business, which will help her to increase her family's monthly income. The rest of the members need the amount to improve their livelihoods. All of these members have been running their own businesses for a long time now. The loan that they have asked for will help them in increasing their family incomes, and will also help them in planning a better future for their children. This will help them save their income and gear themselves up in case of emergencies. If the assistance they asked for is provided to them, it surely will change their lives. They will repay the loan in a stipulated time frame on a repayment schedule.

loans.use: to invest in a brick manufacturing unit

loans.name: Jago Bahena Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en:
Anchhi is the featured borrower of “Jago Bahena Mahila Samuha.” Anchhi is a daily wage laborer in the agriculture fields, and her husband is a carpenter. They live in a rural area of Deoghar District in Jharkhand. They have two sons; they are in 6th and 8th grade, respectively. 

Now Anchhi’s husband is getting good orders to make furniture for weddings, but there is insufficient capital. The family needs some working capital to run the business smoothly. With the loan, Anchhi’s husband will buy more equipment for his carpentry business. 

Anchhi has a desire to construct a new house in their village and to educate her children. Like Anchhi, the other four members are also seeking loans to improve their livelihoods for which they are in need of sufficient capital. Your loan will help five hardworking and deserving families take a big step toward improving their lives.

loans.use: to buy more equipment for a carpentry business

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is 64 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children, now at their adult age. 

Claudia earns income from her little sari-sari (or variety) store and from snack sales as a street food vendor. She’s been engaged in this business for 15 years already. She earns approximately PHP 5,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity. That amount is so helpful to support her family needs. 

She has requested a loan to purchase additional stocks of groceries, snacks, and meats for retail. 

Claudia has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Claudia hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of groceries, snacks, and meats

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es una persona que proviene de una familia muy humilde, sus padres son separados, vivo con su madre, su meta es poder recibirse para de esa forma poder sobresalir adelante y ayudar a su madre económicamente.
Él está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y por medio de su profesión quiere ir abriéndose camino.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas , para que pueda seguir estudiando
texts.en:
Francisco is a person who comes from a very humble family. His parent are divorced, and he lives with his mother. His goal is to be able to graduate and in this way be able to get ahead and help his mother economically.
He is studying an accounting degree, and through his profession he wants to pave his way forward. 
He asks for this loan to be able to invest in fee payments, and be able to keep studying.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: El Progreso De La Feria Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “El Progreso De La Feria” conformado por 06 socios solidarios y dinámicos. Yessica de 38 años de edad  separada con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica  a la venta de juguetes. Hace más de 02 años que viene trabajando positivamente en su negocio dando una buena atención a sus clientes. Gracias a su esfuerzo puede darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus menores hijos. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de peluches, muñecas y luces navideños. El grupo “El Progreso De La Feria” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por facilitar este crédito. Yessica es la primera del lado izquierdo y lleva en brazo a su bebe.
texts.en:
This is the group "El Progreso De La Feria" made up of 6 supportive and dynamic partners. 

Yessica is 38 years old and separated with 3 dependent children. She makes a living selling toys. For more than 2 years she has worked positively in her business, giving good service to her customers. Thanks to her efforts, she can provide a better quality of life to her small children. She's requesting this loan to buy stuffed animals, dolls, and Christmas lights. 

The group "El Progreso De La Feria" is grateful to the Kiva investors for providing this loan. Yessica is the first on the left side and carries her baby on her arm.

loans.use: to buy stuffed animals, dolls, and Christmas lights

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, una persona que quiere salir adelante y es por ello que se está esforzando para poder salir adelante.
Está estudiando la carrera de análisis de sistemas, para que por medio de esta carrera pueda abrirse camino.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, de manera a poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Carlos is from the city of Carapeguá. He is a person who wants to get ahead and that is why is working so hard. He is studying for a degree in Systems Analysis and he thinks this will open a career path for him.

He is asking for this loan to cover expenses related to his degree.

loans.use: to pay expenses related to his degree.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, está estudiando y esforzándose mucho, la carrera que esta siguiendo es la de contabilidad.
Comenta que su sueño es trabajar para poder aportar económicamente en su hogar, recibirse y poder lograr su meta y tener algun día su propio estudio contable.
Pide este prestamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Patricia is from the city of San Ignacio, she is studying and making a big effort. She is following a degree in accounting. 
She says that her dream is to be able to contribute economically to her home. She wants to graduate to be able to achieve her goal, and one day have her own accounting office. 
She asks for this loan to be able to invest in degree fees, and in this way be able to continue with her studies. 
.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita lives in Liloan, Bonifacio, Philippines. She is 53 years old and has two children. She has been a farmer for many years and has a wide rice field from which she generates income to meet the needs of her family.

To maintain a good harvest of her crops, Teresita borrowed PHP 35,000 to buy sacks of fertilizers. This will help her in her endeavors to continue a good harvest.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizers for her rice production to maintain a good harvest of the crops

loans.name: Duotha

texts.en:
Duotha, 25 years old, lives in a rural area of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He is a garment factory worker with a daily salary of USD 5.00. His wife, Sokhim, is a garment factory worker too. On average, she can make an income of USD 7.00 per day.

Duotha would like to apply for a Kiva loan via HKL and he is going to use this loan to buy a motorbike. With the support from this loan, he hopes to experience a convenient way of travelling with his own vehicle. He would like to thank all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Freddie Ii

texts.en: Freddie Ii, 33, is married and settled for a living at Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He manages his own farm for a living. His farm is doing well and he had a better income from this and was able to buy a secondhand motorcycle. Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to cover motorcycle repair costs for a safe service. He wants to have a comfortable house and improved living situation for the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to cover motorcycle repair costs for a safe service.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Veronica successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Veronica's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Afusa

texts.en:
Afusa is a 40-year-old woman who is divorced with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She used the previous to buy land for farming and managed to plant cocoa. Afusa works very hard to look after her children and educate them, since she is a single mother. She is affected by seasonality changes in her business and maintains her dream of owning a big restaurant, supplying big companies in town and doing outside catering services.

She wants a loan to buy foodstuffs like bananas and rice for the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs like bananas and rice for the restaurant.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 28-year-old married man living in Jarash. He opened a barbershop two years ago and during the past two years he has been able to add one more barber chair and to buy more barber tools.

Now Mohammad is working on improving his shop and he wants to redecorate it so it can fit more clients without his having to buy another shop. For this purpose, he is applying to this youth loan.

loans.use: to redecorate his barbershop to fit more clients

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es:
Yesica viene de una familia humilde, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación sigue su carrera de Ingeniería Química porque tiene que trabajar para solventar sus gastos. 
Su  objetivo a  futuro es mejorar el nivel de vida de  su familia por medio de sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir sus estudios.
texts.en:
Yesica comes from a humble family. With a lot of effort and dedication, she is following a career in Chemical Engineering, because she has to work to settle her expenses.
Her future objective is to improve the standard of living of her family through her studies. 
She asks for this loan to be able to pay her fees, and in this way, be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn is always enthusiastic about farming. She cultivates their rice land in Mahayag and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work.

Recently, she applied for a loan to buy sacks of fertilizers and bottles of chemicals for a good crop and harvest. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Renalyn knew that she had to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers and bottles of chemicals for a good harvest.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting, and has earned income as well. Carmen has supported her husband doing this type of work.

As a farmer, Carmen has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she could always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan for pigs as an extra activity for family survival.

Someday, Carmen hopes to have an additional business to earn income.

loans.use: to purchase pigs as an extra activity for family income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school supplies and other study expenses.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro lives in Mahayag. He makes a good living from his farming activities, which is how he supports his family and sends his children to school. 

Pedro wants to increase his farm yield, especially since he has additional expenses because his children entered college. Therefore, he approached Paglaum to borrow funds to purchase a knapsack insecticide sprayer. Pedro has high hopes that he will have good produce this season.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack insecticide sprayer

loans.name: Janeta

texts.en: Janeta thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Janeta has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase additional hogs for commercial sale. The income generated from it is intended to repair her house for safe and decent living. Janeta wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional hogs for commercial sale; the income generated from it is intended to repair her house for safe and decent living

loans.name: Kinyankoko Twanzane Group

texts.en:
Emmanuelina is thirty-three years old, widowed, and has six children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda and is a member of the Kinyankoko Twanzane Group.

Emmanuelina used her previous loan to buy cassava flour to sell. For the past fifteen years, she has been in the business of selling cassava flour, which has helped her meet her family's needs. Her dream is to educate her children. However, she faces the challenges of limited capital and competition. Emmanuelina will use the loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Sheila Mae

texts.en:
Sheila Mae is 27 years old and married with one child in school. Sheila Mae works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Sheila Mae has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is 55 years old and single. He lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. 

For the past two years, Renato has been a farmer. He earns 1,500 PHP each month and is a new member of PMPC. He is requesting a 13,600 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, he hopes to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to maintain a good crop

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is 42 years old and lives in Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children, one of whom is now an adult and three are school age. 

Benedicta has been engaged in operating agricultural equipment, particularly a rice tractor and a rice thresher, for 10 years already. She earns approximately PHP 7,500 each month doing this type of business activity.  She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing steel plates, flat and round bars, bolts and paints for tractor and rice thresher maintenance and repair.
 
Benedicta has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Benedicta hopes to purchase additional units of rice tractor and rice thresher so it is easy for her to expand the business in other agricultural areas.

loans.use: To purchase steel plates, flat and round bars, bolts and paints

loans.name: Howard

texts.en:
Howard is 52 years old. He is an entrepreneur who has been in the mobile money transfer business since 2012. He has successfully opened 11 mobile money outlets across the Copperbelt province of Zambia. He employs 18 people.

With Howard’s business, his community no longer travels long distances to send and receive money as the service is on their doorstep. Howard is happy because his business allows him to look after his family. This has motivated him to open more locations.
 
Howard is requesting a Kiva loan so that he can expand his business. He will use the loan to service more customers across his region. This will help him to provide a quality service and earn more profits. He intends to save the profits so that he can open in more locations. This can only be made possible through this Kiva loan, as he currently does not have enough capital to carry out his expansion plans. His goal is to continue serving his community by providing this essential service and providing jobs to the youth.

loans.use: To have transaction cash to service more customers to grow his busines

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet is 22 years old. He is motivated and hard working. He lives in a rented house with his wife, their three children and three of his nephews. He runs a Zoona mobile money transfer business. His business provides financial services to people in his community that are not serviced by the banks.

Japhet enjoys the interaction with fellow businessmen and women. He says running his own business has given him an opportunity to meet a lot of people in his community. The business is his main source of income. He uses the profits from his business to provide basic needs for his family and pay for rental costs.
 
Japhet has requested a Kiva loan to help purchase a trading kiosk as he has not purchased the one he currently uses and to help him grow his business. He would like to increase the money he uses to serve customers so that he can increase his daily transactions. He is positive that once he receives his Kiva loan, his profit margins will increase. The increase in profits will help Japhet’s wife return to school to complete her high school education. He is grateful to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a Zoona branded kiosk and grow his business by increasing the funds he uses to serve his customers

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is 63 years old and lives in Kauswagan, Plaridel. She is married with six children. Teresa is managing her fishing business and owns fish cages. She earns a meager income each month doing this type of work, supporting the needs of her big family, especially her children's education until they graduate and get their own jobs. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase new nets, foams, and other fishing accessories to improve and expand her business. In the future, Teresa hopes to build a decent house for the whole family.

loans.use: to purchase new nets, foams, and other fishing accessories to improve and expand her business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Meet Joseph, a businessman who is 61 years old. He runs a Zoona mobile money transfers shop in his hometown of Chipata.  He is married and has six children. He has employed two of them to work with him.

Joseph has been running his mobile money transfers shop for almost two years. He says his business is the safest and cheapest way in which people can move their monies from one place to another. He is very pleased with his business because he has seen it grow in transaction value. He believes he has been able to stay in business because he is financially disciplined. Joseph accessed his first Kiva loan back in 2013. This loan was instrumental to his business as it gave him the capital he needed to serve his customers.

Joseph says his biggest challenge is that he does not have enough working capital to satisfy his growing number of customers. He sometimes has to keep customers waiting while he goes around looking for money. This slows down business, as he has to turn away customers and lose out on valuable commissions. He is, therefore, requesting a Kiva loan so that he can grow his capital base and serve customers with larger amounts to transfer. 
 
Joseph is hopeful that once the Kiva loan comes in, he will be able to increase his working capital and make more profit so that he can continue to grow his business. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase a new computer to make his transactions even quicker than using his mobile phone. 

In this photo, Joseph poses at his shop in Chipata.

Joseph says this loan will go a long way in boosting his business. He thanks the Kiva lenders for the help to date.

loans.use: to have more working capital to grow his mobile money business to service more customers in his community who need financial services

loans.name: Bonafe

texts.en:
In 2010, Bonafe learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Bonafe tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital.

Bonafe took out another loan to pay for seedlings and compost. This will give her farming income a big boost. She looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 30 years old and married with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Margret operates a retail shop of general merchandise since 2008 to earn a living. She also sells beers and spirits to increase her income.

She has a dream of expanding her business to a renown bar around town. However, she faces a challenge of limited capital. Margret intends to use the loan to buy spirits, beers, sugar and other merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy spirits, beers, sugar and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 53 years old. He is happily married to his wife Deacy and they have four children. Emmanuel is an entrepreneur. He runs his own Zoona mobile money transfer business. His business provides financial services to people in his community that do not have access to banking.

Emmanuel is a qualified Accountant. He studied at the University of Copperbelt in Zambia. He then worked as an Accountant for various organisations.  He retired in 2012 and started running his business.
 
Emmanuel loves his business because it gives him a chance to learn a lot of things from the different people he meets on a daily basis. He says his community benefits from his business because they do not have to move long distances to access financial services and his services are very easy to use and not intimidating. He has one Zoona outlet and employs one person to help him with the day-to-day transactions.

Emmanuel’s biggest challenge is that he does not have enough money in his business to service his customers and the trading booth he is using to transact is not one that he owns. He is, therefore, requesting his first Kiva loan to help him purchase a Zoona branded trading booth. The booth will cost him $950 USD; he will use the rest of the money to serve customers with the additional float. 

Emmanuel is excited to be connected to Kiva lenders. He sees this as a huge opportunity for the growth of his business. He is hopeful that once his loan comes in, he will serve more customers and earn more profits. The profits help Emmanuel to take care of his family. His dream is to expand his business to places that do not have mobile money outlets yet.

loans.use: To purchase a Zoona trading booth and add to the funds that he uses to serve customers so that he can increase his revenue

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Annie works hard to support her family. She has a home products retail business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store.

Annie is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to buy a stock of home products to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of home products to sell.

loans.name: Resyl

texts.en: From a hobby to a sustainable enterprise is what Resyl finds pleasure in when doing her gardening activities. At the age of 28 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, she wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns and hopes to continuously supply flowers year-round.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Nalubega

texts.en: Nalubega, a single honest woman, lives in Kagadi, Uganda where she has sold new clothes and done farming since 2000 to generate her family's income. She desires to grow her business into a modern boutique in town despite challenges of competition from similar businesses and the ever-changing fashions and designs. Nalubega is requesting a loan to buy new clothes for selling this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for selling this Christmas season.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged 27, and a married man. He has three children, and one of them attends school. He keeps poultry, and this business is supplemented by income from growing maize and beans. He hopes to expand and diversify his business. He is challenged by the high cost of chicken feed. He will use the credit facility to buy more feed for the chickens.

loans.use: to buy more feed for the chickens.

loans.name: Palermo

texts.en:
Palermo had the skills and expertise to be a potter, yet he had no capital to start a pottery business. A father from Lopez Jaena, he never gets tired of supporting his family in any way he can find, to earn an income. He joined PMPC after he learned he could gain financial assistance, and he decided to start a pottery business. It has been doing well, because he has worked to perfect the shape and quality of his pots. Palermo has maximized his profits and keeps pursuing his goals, for the good of his family.

He has requested another loan from PMPC. He will use it to purchase additional raw materials and needed equipment for his business. The loan will enable him to increase production, and to purchase stock in bulk. He hopes and prays that his business will grow and continue to benefit his family. Today, other retail businesses sell his pots, which in turn helps the owners of those businesses to earn income for their own families.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials and needed equipment for his pottery business, and to purchase stock in bulk.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a soft drinks retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF in order to buy more case of soft drinks to sell.

Carmen has been in this business for 10 years. Carmen earns more income from frozen foods and rice-retailing businesses.

Carmen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more cases of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 34 years old. She is married with five children between 2 and 14 years old. Four of them go to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover his semester fees, and resume progress toward his bachelor degree in Business Administration.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is 60 years old and married with four children who are all in their adult age. Her major source of income is rice farming. She is also engaged in palay trading and sells rice. She has been in this business for two decades. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got their own jobs. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Norma wants to expand her rice production so that her customers will be served well and able to supply more sacks of rice in the market. She is planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already availed loans previously to purchase more sacks of palay in order to supply more rice and now she is applying for another loan for her rice production business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of palay in order to supply more rice

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov, 48, is a resident of Kampong Cham province, and a mother of four children. She can earn income to support her family's living condition by growing rice, and by selling groceries to get more income.

This is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of five, she is the group leader. She will spend her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pay laborers' wages, to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can earn more income, to support her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay laborers' wages, to support her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a farmer from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is a married woman and a mother of four children. Grace grows rice and corn on her farm. Farming is her main source of income. Grace is standing next to sacks of newly harvested corn.

Grace is asking for a loan to buy a new hand tractor for the farm. With a tractor, she will be able to improve her farm, thus augmenting her productivity and income. In the future, Grace hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy a new hand tractor for her farm

loans.name: John

texts.en: John used the previous loans to buy clothes for selling. John is a 29-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. John is also a farmer growing crops such as maize, rice, cotton and others to earn additional income. John has a dream of having a model textile shop in the area. However, he is faced with the challenge of competition and high transport costs. John needs a loan to buy dresses, shirts, trousers, children's wear and other items for selling.

loans.use: to buy dresses, shirts, trousers, children's wear and other items for selling

loans.name: Dany's Group

texts.en: A residing living in Kampong Cham province, Dany is 27 years old. For her living, she sells grocery items as her main source of income and grows rice to supplement her income. This is the first loan for Dany with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She leads a group of six to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her farmland to get more yield to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Mohammad Darwich

texts.en:
Mohammad Darwich is a 47-year-old Syrian married father of five children, who started twenty two years ago working as a taxi driver to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Due to the increasing living costs, Mohammad Darwich's income is not enough anymore to satisfy his family's needs, thus he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his daughter's university tuition fees. His daughter is the lady sitting on the right of the photo.

Mohammad Darwich is a hard worker who hopes to increase his income in the future to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's university tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, including rice, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, and other beverages.

loans.name: Pomposa

texts.en:
Pomposa is married and lives in Plaridel-Calaca-an, Plaridel, in the Philippines.  For the past twenty years, Pomposa and her husband have been farmers.  She earns 30,000 PHP each cropping by focusing on her rice farm.  Pomposa became an active member of PMPC in 2011. 

Pomposa is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer that will produce a heavier and higher crop yield on her rice farm.  In the future, she hopes to buy a hectare of riceland to cultivate for business expansion and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to improve crop yield on her rice farm.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 48 years old and married with two children, with one child currently in school. Marilou works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as canned goods, shampoo, fabric conditioners, soft drinks, coffee, hair conditioners, etc. to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, fabric conditioners, soft drinks, coffee, hair conditioners, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marilou would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as canned goods, shampoo, fabric conditioners, soft drinks, coffee, hair conditioners, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Kasichana

texts.en:
Kasichana is married and has seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has owned a food stall business, with neighbours and town dwellers as clients. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients, hence leading to losses of perishable goods.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase stock of goods such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Buntheun

texts.en:
Buntheun, 58 years old, lives in the Kandal Province of Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of a single child and a married child. Since early 2014 she has been working as a cleaner in one organization which is located in her community, to earn a living. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 8 per day. 

Buntheun wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 60 years old and lives in Sumasap, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married, and has six children who are now at their adult age.

He is engaged in a buy-and-sell business, particularly pigs for 'lechon' (roasted pig). He has done this work for 20 years, already, as his main source of income. He earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month, doing this type of work. He has requested a loan, which he will use to purchase an additional four pigs ready for 'lechon,' for retail sale.

Benjamin has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, he hopes to establish his own piggery business.

loans.use: to purchase four pigs ready for 'lechon' (roasted pig).

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina, 40 years old, is married. She lives with her husband and three children, in Usocan, Plaridel. In order to survive, she has found ways to obtain income, particularly through her sari-sari (small grocery) store. It began with displaying a few inventories of canned goods, noodles, sugar, a dozen of shampoo and soap. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari store, in January of 2012. She became a MIGS (member in good standing), which is why she has received her fourth loan.

Now, she applies for 20,000 PHP. She will use the loan to pay for additional merchandise, to draw more customers to buy in her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to pay for additional merchandise, to draw more customers to buy in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is married, and she works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Ellen has been in this business for eleven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle works hard to support her family.  She is married and has operated a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines for the past 5 years.

Michelle requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Moris

texts.en: Moris is a 30-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. Moris has operated a general merchandise shop since 2012 to improve his family's welfare. Moris has a dream of growing his business into a general store. However, he is faced with the challenge of market competition. Moris is hardworking and has requested a loan to buy cassava flour for selling.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour for selling.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 52-year-old man who is married to Selvina, who is 39 years old.  Daniel is a civil servant and Selvina is a kindergarten teacher.  They have been blessed with 3 children named Jemi, 19, a Vocational High School student grade 3rd; Mayora, 18, a university student in the 2nd semester; and the last is Jefri, 10, a 5th grade Elementary school student.  

As their parents, Daniel and his wife have always put education for their children as a high priority.  Therefore he is requesting an individual loan of 5,000,000 IDR from TLM.  The purpose of the loan is to fund the semester registration fees for Mayora, as well as her other college fees and requirements.

loans.use: to pay registration fees for his daughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to include more building and construction materials for selling.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Michelle is 39 years old, and all her children are in school.

Michelle has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts, gasoline, etc. for her motorcycle.

In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, gasoline, etc. for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Euphrasie

texts.en: Euphrasie is 40 years old. She is married and has seven children, aged between 9 and 23 years. All of her children go to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been in business for 27 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate, and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Tuli No Mulangaliro Group

texts.fr: Setefano président du groupe TULI NO MULANGALIRO, a débuté ses activités champêtres en 1992 avec l'aide de sa mère et sa femme après la fermeture de la sucrerie de Kiliba, qui fut une grande entreprise de la place et qui employait la population tant locale que régionale. Cette période de soudure a été couverte par les revenus venant du champ prenant ainsi en charge l'alimentation, les soins médicaux et la scolarisation de ses enfants.   Avec l'espoir d'élargir son étendue culturale et d'acquérir une charrue dans un avenir proche, Setefano sollicite ce crédit afin d'éviter un retard dans ses travaux d'entretien. Le sol étant devenu pauvre et les plants meurtris par des maladies au moment du semis, il compte tout d'abord acheter les engrais pour l'enrichir. Sur la photo, Setefano tient sa main levée avec un carnet rose.
texts.en: Setefano, the president of the Tuli No Mulangaliro group, commenced his pastoral business in 1992 with the help of his mother and his wife after the closing of a sugar refinery in Kiliba, which had been a large local enterprise employing the local, as well as the regional, population. The hungry period between harvests was thus covered by the revenues coming from the field, taking care of the nutrition, medical needs and education of his children. With the hope of enlarging the reach of his cultivable land and of acquiring a plow in the near future,  Setefano is asking for this loan in order to avoid being late on his maintenance and upkeep work. The sun having become weak and the plants having been killed by disease during the seeding period, he expects to first of all buy grains to enrich the land. In the photo, Setefano has his hand raised with a pink notebook.

loans.use: pay for work to prepare the terrain, labor, hoeing, fertilizer purchases, and labor payments.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 22 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Julia, 36, lives in her own home with her family. She has had a small shop for 22 years, which is located in her home. She sells a variety of products such as sweets, soft drinks, basic grains, coffee, soup, eggs, jello, sugar, etc. She has many customers because of her good prices. She is requesting this loan to buy more wholesale merchandise because this is her only source of income and it will provide her with better profits and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soft drinks, basic grains, coffee, soup, eggs, jello, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Janet works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Janet is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell to her customers.

Janet has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a single woman with two children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her monthly expenses are food and school fees.

With the requested 30,000 KES loan she will pay school fees for her children.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access financial assistance.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Marina Estela

texts.es: Marina de 50 años de edad vive con sus tres  hijos y su esposo en casa propia, ella tiene un puesto de comida cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar,ella esta solicitando nuevamente un credito para la compra de mas materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú ya que le ha ido muy bien en el negocio y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Marina, 50, lives with her husband and three children in their own home. She has had a food stall near her home for several years. With the money she earns from her sales, she is able to pay household expenses. She is requesting another loan to buy more basic products such as rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, and more so she can add variety to her menu. Her business has been going well and this will allow her to have better income.

loans.use: to buy more basic products such as rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, and more.

loans.name: Yanira Carolina

texts.es: Yanira tiene 52 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su madre, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, posee muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Yanira, 52, lives in her own home with her mother. She has a small store in her home. She has many customers because of her good prices and her kind demeanor when selling. She is requesting this loan to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread, and other items so she can earn more income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread, and other items.

loans.name: Akkyz

texts.ru: Аккыз, 51 год, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Аккыз незаконченное высшее образование. В настоящее время занимается животноводством и полеводством, по хозяйству помогает муж и дети. Аккыз с большой ответственностью относится к своему делу. Ежегодно обрабатывает 1,4 Га земли, выращивает горох, фасоль, картофель, в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы и овцы. Аккыз обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) для покупки селитры для обработки почвы, чтобы выращивать экологически чистые овощи. Доходы от кредита она направит на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса, также хочет накопить на путевку в санаторий.
texts.en:
Akkyz is 51 years old, married and the mother of three. Akkyz left college without finishing her degree. At present she raises livestock and grows farm produce. Her husband and children help her in her business. Akkyz is fully committed to her business. Every year she works 1.4 ha [3.5 acres] of land and grows peas, beans, and potatoes. She has two cows on her farm and also keeps sheep. 

Akkyz has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 25,000 KGS to buy niter  [saltpeter] to  cultivate her soil and grow  environmentally clean vegetables. She will use her loan to develop her business further. She would also like to save up to buy a health resort package.

loans.use: to purchase nitre in order to cultivate her land and grow organic vegetables.

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es:
Sixto es egresado de la carrera de administración de empresa, actualmente está estudiando la carrera de habilitación pedagógica en el instituto formación docente, queriendo ser un gran profesional y con futuro asegurado para brindar un buen bienestar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando para crecer cada día más.
texts.en:
Sixto is a graduate in business administration and is currently studying pedagogical empowerment at a teaching university. He wants to be a professional with a stable future to provide his family with well-being.

He is requesting this loan to pay university costs for his degree, which will allow him to keep fighting to grow every day.

loans.use: to pay university costs.

loans.name: Suheni

texts.en:
Suheni is 35 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her children. She has two daughters. Her husband is a laborer for building construction

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 6,000,000 rupiah. This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for the family. She wants to have access to safe sanitation for her family. Her family's income is still not enough to build toilets and water resources with cash, but they are able to repay the loans they receive.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for the family

loans.name: Agim

texts.en: Agim is 46 years old and married with three sons and a daughter. He is the main source of income for his family and earns a living working in agriculture. He works on his land to sell corn and wheat in the area and also to feed his family. He has been working for so long that his tractor is now very old and damaged and he needs a new one in order to continue with his work. Agim is requesting a loan for the first time in order to purchase a new tractor. He is very optimistic about his future and his pleasant personality makes it easy for him to sell to others and gain customers. He hopes that this loan will help him to be able to continue his work and provide for his family. He appreciates the help and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: To purchase a new tractor

loans.name: Nizam

texts.en:
Nizam is a 49-year-old married father of two children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians, especially those who live in the camps, he started 14 years ago working as a taxi driver to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Today, Nizam is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to repair his car's motor to facilitate his customers' transportation. This loan is very important to Nizam for the car is his only source of income.

loans.use: to repair his car's motor

loans.name: Nona Dex

texts.en:
Nona Dex is a merchant from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is 35 years old, married and a mother of two children. Nona Dex runs a sari-sari store selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This has been the source of her income for more than three years now.
  
Nona Dex is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, snack foods, and rice. With a loan, Nona Dex will be able to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Nona Dex hopes to expand her store so that it will generate more revenue. She also wants to save money for her children's schooling.
