María y su conyugue como meta familiar desean adquirir su casa propia y tener dos hijos.  Su desafío es trabajar en unión y acceder a más oportunidades de financiación. Su meta en el negocio es a largo plazo ampliar su negocio para tener más clientes y así lograr avanzar en el mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 22 years old and has worked since 2011 offering hair-cutting services, dyes, drying, massages, and all sorts of treatments for hair care in her beauty salon. She works with her spouse since the business was originally his. This business is the household sustenance and is open from 9 am to 9 pm every day. Their primary customers are their neighbors and acquaintances who are loyal because of the quality of the services they get.  

Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will invest in the purchase of basic tools to outfit her business - a chair, television and clippers. This investment will have a positive effect, upon expanding the coverage and agility of services, with which she will provide better expected income for the family. María and her spouse have as a family goal the desire to have their own house and to have two children. Their challenge is to work together and get more loan opportunities. Their goal in the business is to, in the long run, expand htheirer business and have more customers, and so to be able to get ahead with improving their family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase basic tools to outfit her business - a chair, television and clippers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 58-year-old widow who is taking care of six children and has been operating a grocery stall for a period of ten years, earning herself an income of KES. 10,000 at the end of every month.

Mary has been able to repay her previous loans successfully and is now servicing her fourth loan of KES. 25,000. She intends to use the entire amount to buy tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages and maize to sell to her customers.

Mary plans to use the anticipated income to buy an additional dairy cow and hopes to become a successful business woman with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy stock of maize, cabbages, tomatoes and potatoes for selling in her grocery business.

loans.name: 020402190003 Liên Minh _ Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Niên, 54, is married with four children. She lives and works in the Hoang Hoa District, a rural area in Thanh Hoa Province, in Vietnam.

She has a retail business selling fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Niên is the leader of a five-member group, the 020402190003 Liên Minh _ Hoằng Trường solidarity group. In 2012, Niên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from FPW.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is her lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Niên hopes that her business will do well. With her profits, she hopes to buy more supplies and equipment for her business and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: José Eduardo

texts.es: José, inicio su negocio con su propio capital en el año 2013; él esta dedicado a varias actividades en los tres sectores de la economia: entre las  comerciales  realiza la venta de calzado, ropa y colonias; en las de producción, desarrolla actividades culinarias variadas, como  la elaboración y venta de almuerzos, empanadas, arepas y sus derivados, y  en el sector servicio ofrece alquiler de lavadoras. Este emprendedor joven de apenas 19  realiza sus compras de contado a los graneros, catálogos y almacenes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una estufa industrial, mesas y sillas.  Esta inversión permitirá ampliar la cobertura de clientes que actualmente esta atendiendo en su negocio de comidas y con ello tambien incrmentará la rentabilidad del negocio. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, transeúntes y trabajadores del sector, a quienes les ofrece facilidad de pago.  José desea continuar ampliando su negocio y construir la segunda planta de la casa  de sus padres e independizarse, aunque  sus desafíos sean continuar trabajando para ahorrar, y tener un excelente manejo de los créditos.
texts.en:
José started his business with his own capital in 2013. He makes a living in several activities in the three sectors of the economy: in sales, he sells shoes, clothing, and cologne; in production, he has various culinary ventures such as making and selling lunches, empanadas, corn cakes, and other byproducts; and in the service sector, he rents out washers.

This young entrepreneur is only 19. He makes his purchases in cash at the granaries, through catalogues, and at grocery stores.

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which is his first with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan, he will buy an industrial stove, tables and chairs. This loan will allow him to increase the number of customers he attends to in his food business, and it will also increase his business’s success. His main clients are his neighbors, passers-by, and those who work in the area, to whom he offers easy payment options.

José wants to keep growing his business and to build he second floor of his parents’ house to be independent. Even with his challenges, he’ll keep working to save and carefully manage his loans.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Ricardo Enrique

texts.es: Ricardo motivado por su mamá, quien identifico que él sentía gran fascinación por los aparatos eléctricos, ya que desde muy niño le gustaba jugar con este tipo de artículos “desarmaba, analizaba sus componentes y volvía a armarlos”, le propuso que hiciera un curso técnico de reparación y mantenimiento de electrodomésticos. Así lo hizo Ricardo, y hoy día tiene un negocio que inició desde el año 1994, en el cual ofrece los servicios de reparación y mantenimiento de electrodomésticos; sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, familiares, amigos  y referidos, a quienes les ofrece sus servicios de contado e incluso les brinda facilidades de pago.  Sus compras de repuestos y componentes de los electrodomésticos, las realiza en almacenes especializados de contado, por eso en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará repuestos para televisores, integrados, resistencias eléctricas entre otros articulos, inversión que garantizará la atención oportuna para la prestación de sus servicios. Ricardo tiene 47 años de edad y una larga trayectoria en su negocio, cuya meta a futura es continuara ampliándolo y capacitándose para estar actualizado. A nivel familiar desea continuar ayudando a sus hermanos y padres, aunque su principal desafío es trabajar mucho más,  para ahorrar.
texts.en: Ricardo was motivated by his mother. She saw that he felt a strong fascination for electronic devices because from the time he was very young he liked to play with these types of things. “I would take them apart, analyze their components and put them back together again”. She suggested that he take a technical course in the repair and maintenance of electronic appliances. That is what Ricardo did, and today he has a business that he started in 1994. In it, he offers repair and maintenance services. His main customers are his neighbors, relatives, friends and people who are referred to him. He offers them his service for payment up front and he even offers them payment plans. He purchases his appliance replacement parts and components in specialized stores and pays for them up front. That is why now he is asking for a Kiva loan. It is the first loan he has taken out with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, he will buy replacement parts for televisions, integrated circuits, and electrical resistors. This investment will guarantee that he can offer his services in a timely manner. Ricardo is 47 years old and has had his business for a long time. His goal for the future is to continue expanding it and making it capable to be up to date. At the family level, he wants to continue helping his siblings and parents, although his main challenge is to work a lot more so he can save.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for televisions, integrated circuits, and electrical resistors.

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Tam Thắng Hòa Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyết has a retail business selling clothes. Tuyết has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Tuyết is 34 years old, and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the Nhóm 02 Tam Thắng Hòa Lộc solidarity group. 

This is Tuyết's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothes to resell. Along with her business profit, Tuyết hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Mỹ Điền Đa Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mr. Dũng works in agriculture, raising poultry. Dũng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns him is a lack of capital. He is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Dũng is 31 years old, and he is married with two children. He is the leader of a three-member group, the Nhóm 03 Mỹ Điền Đa Lộc solidarity group. This is Dũng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With his business profit, Dũng hopes to buy a motorbike, for his family to be healthy and happy, and for his children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Melvin  Jose

texts.es:
Luego de 20 años de arduo trabajo, esfuerzo y dedicación Melvin ha logrado mantener su taller que ofrece reparaciones en refrigeración para los electrodomésticos del hogar, con la ayuda de su papa logró comenzar el negocio y ahora es uno de los mejores talleres de refrigeración, donde encontraras buena atención ofrecida por Melvin así como los mejores artículos a los mejores precios, Melvin ha sido un joven emprendedor y dedicado, ahora están reflejados los frutos del duro trabajo que ha realizado. Melvin cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, también cuenta con una amplia gama de clientela que confía en el trabajo de Melvin y que cada vez crece. 
Melvin tiene muchos sueños y metas, pero la principal es poder diversificar su negocio y poner otros puntos de acceso a su trabajo. Solicita el crédito para la compra de artículos que le ayudaran a variar su negocio, también para obtener  materiales de repuesto, de esa manera aprovechara las temporadas de mayor auge o demanda en el mercado para ofrecer sus productos, deposita su confianza en el financiamiento del crédito ya que con el dinero podrá incrementar sus ventas y con las  ganancias que logre obtener podrá ahorrar y poner otra sucursal, de esa manera solidificara sus ingresos y podrá ofrecerle una mejor economía a su familia.
texts.en:
After 20 years of arduous work, effort, and dedication Melvin has managed to maintain his shop that repairs refrigeration of household appliances.  With the help of his father he managed to start the business.  Now, it  is one of the best refrigeration shops.  In the shop you will find good attention provided by Melvin as well as the best items at the best prices.

Melvin has been a devoted and enterprising young man.  This is now reflected in the fruit of the hard work that he has done.  Melvin has his wife’s support.  He also has a wide range of clientele that trusts Melvin’s work.  His business is growing more with each job.

Melvin has a lot of dreams and goals.  However, his main one is to be able to diversify and expand his business.  He is requesting the loan to buy items that will help him vary his business.  He will also get more repair materials.  This way he will take advantage of the peak seasons or demand in the market in order to offer his products.  

He has faith in the loan because, with the money, he will be able to increase his sales.  With the earnings that he manages to get he will be able to save and open another branch.  This way he will solidify his profits, and he will be able to provide his family with a better financial situation.

loans.use: to buy items that will help him vary his business and to buy more repair materials.

loans.name: Gleider

texts.es:
Gleider es una mujer de 41 años de edad, soltera, tiene dos hijos varones de 22 y 3 años y una hija mujer de 21 años, y su negocio es una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, constante, activa, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘Llojeta’ un barrio residencial, que conecta la zona Central con la zona Sur de la ciudad, de clima soleado, con una temperatura ambiente entre 8 y 21 grados centígrados.
Gleider es de tez trigueña, cabello color castaño rizado, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español por el comercio. su vida la comparte junto a sus 3 hijos; los mayores estudian y trabajan y el menor se encuentra al cuidado de su madre. Viven en un departamento alquilado que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad, como; pan, azúcar, huevos, galletas, leche, refrescos, agua, detergentes, etc. el negocio está ubicado en la avenida principal y por el lugar no existen otros negocios de este tipo, su negocio es muy conocido porque es bastante completo; “comencé mi negocio por la necesidad de trabajar, y encontré un lugar donde no hay tiendas, eso fue el inicio, ahora tengo muchos clientes que me piden que amplíe mi negocio…”. Su sueño es tener una casa propia en la ciudad, y desea realizar la ampliación de su negocio mediante la compra de una congeladora de alimentos para almacenar pollo, carne y otros congelados. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Gleider solicita un préstamo para la compra de una congeladora de alimentos y pollo, carne por mayor.
texts.en:
Gleider, 41, is single and has two sons, 22 and 3, and a daughter, 21.  Her business is a neighborhood store with food staples.  She's enterprising, tenacious, active, responsible, and hardworking, and she's a good mother.  She works in the Llojeta area of a residential neighborhood that connects the central and southern parts of the city.  The climate is sunny and the temperature ranges between 8 and 21 degrees centigrade.

Gleider is dark and has wavy brown hair.  Her native language is Aymara and she speaks Spanish for work.  She lives with her three children.  The older ones are in school and work, and the youngest is in Gleider's care.  They live in a rented apartment that has services: potable water, electricity, and a sewage system.

Her business is a neighborhood store with bread, sugar, eggs, cookies, milk, soft drinks, water, detergent, and other staple items.  The store's on the main street and there aren't other businesses like it in the area.  Her business is very well known because it's very complete.  "I started my business because I needed to work, and I found a place without stores.  That was the beginning.  Now I have a lot of customers who are asking me to expand my business."

Gleider's dream is to have her own house in the city.  She also wants to expand her business with the purchase of a freezer to store chicken, meat, and other frozen food.  This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the two years she has been doing this work.  For those reasons Gleider's requesting a loan to buy a food freezer as well as chicken and meat wholesale.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for food as well and chicken and meat wholesale

loans.name: Ana Aracely

texts.es:
Ana de 38 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene tres hijos estudiando; estudió hasta 3° grado de educación básica, no siguió estudiando porque sus padres no contaban con los recursos económicos para seguir dándole el estudio. Su pareja es agricultor cultiva hortalizas en invernaderos trabajos en las que Ana le apoya y se suman sus hijos en sus tiempos libres.
Ana es comerciante de frutas y verduras, se dedica a esta actividad desde que estaba muy pequeña ya que sus padres se dedican a lo mismo, ellos cultivan el producto que venden. No tiene un lugar estable donde vender, pero lo hace en los mercados locales y sus hijos le ayudad a movilizarse con la mercadería.
Solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en sus cultivos en la compra de pesticidas y fertilizantes y dar el correcto manejo para tener una buena producción. Ana espera tener algún día un lugar estable de venta, así facilitaría mucho su trabajo, además le gustaría que su esposo aumentara la cantidad sembrada para aumentar la venta de la cosecha.
texts.en:
Ana is 38 years old. She is married and has three children who are in school. She went to school up to the third grade. She didn't stay in school because her parents didn't have the financial resources to keep giving her an education. Her spouse is a farmer and grows vegetables in a greenhouse. Ana helps him with the work and their children join them in their free time. 

Ana is a fruit and vegetable merchant. She has done this activity since she was very young because her parents did the same thing. She and her husband grow the produce they sell. She doesn't have a fixed place to sell from, but she does it in the local markets and her children help her get around with the merchandise.  

She is asking for the loan to invest in her crops by buying pesticides and fertilizer and to manage them properly for a good yield. Ana hopes to one day have a fixed place to sell, as this will make her job a lot easier. In addition, she would like for her husband to increase the planting to increase the sale of the harvest.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Jose Cayetano

texts.es:
José de 34esta acompañado y tiene un hijo, estudio hasta 3° grado de educación básica, no continuo con sus estudios porque su familia no tenía la capacidad económica para dárselo y con los frutos del trabajo cubrían los gastos del hogar.
José es comerciante, en su tienda vende diversos productos desde artículos de primera necesidad y accesorios, hasta productos de la temporada como pólvora nacional, tiene 6 años dedicándose a esta actividad que la inicio gracias a la propuesta de un amigo que lo convenció de ser un buen negocio. Antes era chofer de un camión en el que transportaba  materiales. En su negocio le apoya su pareja.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar 300 discos (DVD) de películas, cuadernos, lápices, lapiceros y papelería variada, con lo que espera mantener estable el inventario de su tienda y así sus ventas. José espera algún día ampliar grandemente su tienda y emplear personas, nada le gustaría más que ser una fuente de trabajo, además quiere repara su casa que está muy deteriorada.
texts.en:
José is 34 years old. He is married and has a son. He went to school up to the 3rd grade. He didn't continue with his education because his family didn't have the financial ability to give it to him and with his work they could cover the household expenses. 

José is a merchant. In his store, he sells varied products, ranging from staple products and accessories to seasonal products such as fireworks. He has been doing this for 6 years, working at the activity that she started thanks to the proposal of a friend who convinced him it would be a good business. Before he was a truck driver and transported materials. His wife helps him in his business. 

She is asking for a loan to buy 300 movie disks (DVDs), notebooks, pencils, mechanical pencils, and various paper items. With it, he hopes to keep the inventory stable in his store, and thus his sales. José hopes to one day expand his store and hire people. Nothing would please him more than being a source of employment. He also wants to repair his house, which is in very poor condition.

loans.use: to buy 300 movie disks (DVDs), notebooks, pencils, mechanical pencils and various paper items.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 35 years old. She is married with five children aged between 4 and 15 years; all of them go to school. She sells local drinks and has been doing this business for 20 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy sorghum for making more local drinks to resell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy sorghum for making more local drinks to resell

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Loice, a hardworking, very honest and warm-hearted farmer who hails from the Kitale area of Kenya, an area that has one of the best weather patterns on earth that favors farming. 

Loice is the proud mother of three lovely children whom she really loves and adores and always protects. Loice’s upbringing was very challenging, and because of this, she promised herself that she would work hard to get out of poverty. That is why she started farming eight years ago. 

Through farming, she has been able to earn a decent income. Loice is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard so that her three children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life.

Loice engages in a sewing business to make extra cash. Loice is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming so that she can use the excess space on her land. She dreams of buying more land and increasing her horticulture farming. 

Accessing funds is very difficult for a woman in Africa, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, Loice is optimistic that her dream will be realized and her life will completely change. Through the income from horticulture farming, Loice will assure her children of a bright future and will be able to pay tuition fees for her siblings who depend on her. Through your loan, the promise of supporting small-scale farmers will be achieved.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming

loans.name: Nhóm 13- Thôn  Văn Bắc Đông Văn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phượng has worked in agriculture raising poultry for over 10 years.  She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future because one of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Phượng is 55 years old and she is married with no children.  She is also the leader of a four member group, the Nhóm 13- Thôn  Văn Bắc Đông Văn solidarity group. 

In 2012, Phượng joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Phượng has successfully repaid 5 loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profits, Phượng hopes to help keep her family healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 04- Thôn  Văn Châu Đông Văn Group

texts.en:
Hà, 40, is married with two children. She works in agriculture raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. 

Hà's main business hardship is her lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase chicks to raise and sell in the future.

Hà is the group leader of the Nhóm 04-Thôn Văn Châu Đông Văn solidarity group, which consists of four members. In 2012, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) to improve her business. She has successfully repaid five loans from FPW.

With her business profits, Hà hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain a successful business and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase chicks to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina es una mujer de 56 años de edad, casada, tiene tres hijos de 17, 14 y 9 años, y su negocio es la venta de condimentos.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, responsable, constante y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ el barrio más poblado de la ciudad, un sitio caracterizado por la multiculturalidad de su gente y por el comercio en todas las áreas que lo realizan descendientes de las etnias ‘Ayoreas’ del lugar y descendientes de mineros relocalizados de occidente, ahora como segunda generación de los originales se dedican al comercio y la manufactura, De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura ambiente que varía entre 21º y 35º grados centígrados durante el día y todo el año.
Marcelina es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo trenzado, su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que aparece en la foto y se dedica al transporte independiente como taxi, sus tres hijos estudian en la escuela y viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de condimentos, como; dientes de ajo negro, melocotón deshidratado, hoja triturada de Tila, Azafrán, colorante alimentario, Curry, ajo molido, comino molido, y otros. Su venta la realiza de forma ambulante, en diferentes ferias y mercados, cargada de una canasta donde almacena todos sus productos en oferta. “la demanda de condimentos cada vez es más grande, a la gente le gusta saborear y cocinar con muchos sabores, es por eso que tengo muchos clientes y mi negocio prospera…”. Su sueño es tener un puesto fijo de venta y vender por mayor, y desea realizar la compra de condimentos para cocina por mayor, para aprovechar las ventas de fin de año y generar mejores recursos económicos.
Es por esos motivos que Marcelina solicita un préstamo para la compra de condimentos por mayor para satisfacer a sus clientes de fin de año.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a 56 year old woman. She is married and has three children, aged 17, 14 and 9. Her business is selling seasonings. She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, responsible, reliable and hard working. She does her business in the ‘Plan 3000’ area, the most populated neighborhood in the city. It is characterized by the diversity of its people and by the commerce everywhere done by the descendants of the ‘Ayoreas’ ethnicity and the descendants of the miners who relocated to the west. Now the second generation of the original people work as merchants and in manufacturing. It has a warm, tropical and humid climate with an average temperature of between 21º and 35º centigrade during the day, all year long. 

Marcelina has dark skin, short stature, and long, black, braided hair. Her mother tongue is Aymará and she speaks Spanish for business. She shares her life with her husband who appears in the photo and who works as an independent taxi driver. Their three children go to school and they live in their own house. It is made of brick and has potable water, electricity and plumbing. Her business is selling seasonings such as garlic cloves, dried peaches, ground linden leaves, saffron, food coloring, curry, ground garlic, ground cumin, and more. She sells as a street vendor in different markets and fairs, carrying a basket where she keeps all of the products she offers. “The demand for seasonings grows all the time. People like to taste and cook with a lot of flavors. That is why I have a lot of customers and my business is prospering”. Her dream is to have a fixed spot to sell from and to sell wholesale. She wants to buy cooking seasonings wholesale to take advantage of the end of year sales and generate more financial resources. 

That is why Marcelina is asking for a loan to buy seasonings wholesale to meet her customers' end of the year demands.

loans.use: to buy seasonings wholesale and meet the demand of her customers at the end of the year.

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Khu Phố 4 Ba Đình Bỉm Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lâm has operated a small restaurant selling rice, meat, and fish for 1 year.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more food to cook and sell in her restaurant.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital.

Lâm is 33 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She is also the leader of a three member group, the Nhóm 03 Khu Phố 4 Ba Đình Bỉm Sơn solidarity group. 

This is Lâm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profits, Lâm hopes her business will do well, her family will be healthy and happy, and that her children will do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more food to cook and sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Everlyne operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business. With this 30,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 19-year-old single young man from a village near Jenin city. He lives with his family in a very simple house. His family has agricultural land where they plant different types of crops. It is a very good business, and the whole family cooperates together in the work.

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more seeds and seedlings for the family farm. This will increase the productivity and also the income.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and seedlings for the family farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more seeds and seedlings for the family farm.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Hello, lenders, meet Mary. She is a 29-year-old smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is a small rural town in Kenya. Mary and her husband are blessed to have five children. 

Mary has been a mixed farmer for more than four years. She keeps poultry for eggs, dairy cows and grows maize and vegetables for sale. She also holds a day job and engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path. 

Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Mary is very passionate and optimistic about the future of horticultural farming in Kenya. 

Mary is seeking a loan to expand her horticultural farm. This move is quite a big deal for her. With your loan, Mary seeks to continue growing different varieties of crops but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Kitale and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will negate the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my child.”

loans.use: to grow her horticulture business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, biscuits and snack foods, condiments and others

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to restock high-demand medicine in her pharmacy.

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en: Valerie is 61 years old. She is married with nine children aged between 19 and 41 years. One of them goes to school. She sells honey from bees and has been in business for 25 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more honey to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and buy food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more honey to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy or build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is a 48-year-old woman married to David, who adds additional income. They are blessed with two children. Penina has been selling clothes and jewelry for the past 10 years, earning herself an income of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) at the end of every month.

Penina has been able to pay all her previous loans and is now servicing her fourth loan of 55,000 KES and intends to use the entire amount to buy shirts, skirts, blouses, dresses and trousers to sell to her customers.

Penina plans to use the anticipated income to open a major boutique and hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy shirts, skirts, blouses, dresses and trousers to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, and snack foods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the registration fees to practice law.

loans.name: Clare

texts.en:
Clare is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her children.

Kiva lenders! Meet Clare, one of the most hardworking women on earth. She is 38 years of age, very hardworking and a go-getter. She hails from Kiminini, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin, but Clare has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past three years. Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming.She also gets some income through operating the only diesel posho mill in her village.

Clare passionately loves farming and has even nicknamed one of her cows “Brown”, and whenever she is milking her cow, she feels proud. She is contented with the farming way of life.

Clare is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her children and family of a decent meal. The Kitale area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business.

Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Clare feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. Clare is well disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children.

Please help Claire so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Seliphen

texts.en:
Hello, Lenders, meet Seliphen. She is a 26-year-old smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is a small rural town in the Kitale area of  Kenya. Seliphen and her husband have been blessed with four children. For five years Seliphen has raised dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows maize, among other crops. 

Despite common animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening. In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet the least exclusive, hobby for women. You really don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden; any woman with a homestead and a few square feet of earth is doing her best to make her little corner of the world more gracious and beautiful. 

Seliphen, however, is taking this a step further. She is seeking a loan to start crop farming. This is a big deal for her. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. Income from this venture will cover her current high farming expenses. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To start crop farming

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 43 year old man married to Jane who adds additional income to support their family. Together, they and are blessed with two children. Charles has been operating a wool shearing business for a period of four years earning himself an income of KES. 10,000 at the end of every month.

Charles is now servicing his fourth loan of KES. 20,000 and intends to use this amount to add additional sheep to add to his current stock which seems to be running out.

Charles plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: to buy additional sheep to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 47 years old. She is married with seven children aged between 10 and 25 years; all of them go to school. She has a bar and has been in a business for 20 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more sorghum for making more drinks to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and for her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum for making more drinks to resell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with four children who all attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food .

Irene operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in this business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 34-year-old married father of one child and a Palestinian refugee who has worked for ten years making furniture to cover the needs and expenses of his family. 

Ahmad is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is trying hard to develop his business. He is taking a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy wood to build furniture to satisfy his customers' needs and attract new ones. 

Ahmad hopes to expand his business in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Grace Group

texts.en:
Rana is the featured borrower for Grace Group. She partnered with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Rana is a 30-year-old married mother of two children who has worked as a Tupperware saleswoman for two years to help her husband cover their family's expenses.

Rana is trying desperately to provide her family with better living conditions, thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to renovate her house to make it a better and healthier place for her beloved kids.

Rana is the woman standing in the middle of the photo. With respect to the other group members, Faten is the woman on the right, and Eman is the woman on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
Feliciano tiene 40 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su madre, no tiene hijos a su cargo, vive en casa de familia de material rustico un piso, Feliciano es nacido en caserío Playa Grande; vive en comunión con los miembros de su caserío, vive en la parte rural del caserío Playa Grande; vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Ubicada en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Feliciano es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 3 has. De terreno agrícola, de las cuales 1,5 has tiene plantación Variedad catimor de tres años de edad en segundo año de producción, para campaña 2015 estará en tercer año, actividad la realiza hace 03 años en caserío Playa Grande, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café. Adicionalmente Feliciano se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado vacuno y al cultivo de productos de Pan llevar todo esto lo realiza en terreno propio en caserío Playa Grande. El destino del crédito sera para mantenimiento de 1,5 has. De café en producción, con ello asegurara mayor y mejor producción para campaña 2015 y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Feliciano is 40 years old. He has a stable home along with his mother. He has no children he is responsible for. He lives in the one story rustic house of a family member. Feliciano was born in the village of Playa Grande. He lives in harmony with the members of the community. He lives in the rural section of the Playa Grande village. The community basically works in agriculture, raising cattle and commerce. It is located in the district of Santo Tomás, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the North Andes of Peru.

The work that Feliciano does is grow coffee, currently having 3 hectares of agricultural land of which 1.5 hectares is planted with 3 year old Catimor varietal in it's second year of production. The 2015 season will be his 3rd year. He has 3 years of experience in this business in Playa Grande. Also Feliciano works raising and selling cattle and growing food to eat. All of which he does on his own land in Playa Grande village.

The loan will be used to maintain the 1.5 hectares of coffee production, assuring better and better production for the 2015 season to get higher income to be able to improve his and his family's quality of living.

loans.use: to maintain 1.5 hectares of coffee production to ensure greater production for the 2015 season.

loans.name: Miriam Aguedita

texts.es:
Miriam Aguedita tiene 45 años, es conviviente vive en casa propia junto su esposo e hijos ubicada en el sector de aviación de Cayaltí. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Miriam Aguedita se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales (cerdos y patos). Además ofrece servicio de jornales agrícolas. Su esposo es dependiente de empresa Cayaltí. El destino del crédito es para invertir en compra de cerdos y alimentos. Así, tendrá mayores ingresos y calidad para ofrecer a su publico consumidor. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Miriam Aguedita is 45 years old, married, and lives in her own house with her husband and children in the Avacion area of Cayalti. She lives in a community whose inhabitants work in business, farming, and livestock. It is located in the Cayalti district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru

Mirian Aguedita raises and sells animals (pigs and ducks). In addition she works as a farm day laborer. Her husband works for a business in Cayalti. The loan will be used to buy pigs and feed. In this way she will have greater income and quality to offer her customer. In the short term this will improve her profits, increase her earnings and result in a better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish boxes or styropacks and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 39-year-old married father of two. He is a Palestinian refugee who works hard to improve his family's living standards.

Twenty years ago, Mohamad started to work in a wood factory, where he got very special talents and experience. He opened his own factory in 2002.

He is hard working man, who believes that when there is a will there is a way, and he works upon that principle.

His family's increasing living needs prevent him from expanding his work place properly. Because he is someone who insists on achieving his goals, that's why he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy the necessary tools to increase and expand his factory's production, and his income.

This is Mohamad's third loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. With his previous loans, he proved to be a borrower in good standing borrower, while he developed his business gradually in a well managed way.

As for the future, Mohamad hopes to open a bigger working place and recruit others to help him reply to increasing customers needs.

loans.use: to buy the necessary tools to increase and expand his factory's production, and his income.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 50 years old. He is married with six children aged between eight and 26. Two of them go to school. 

Bernard sells food and has been in business for eight years. With the loan, he would like to buy more potatoes to resell. He works in a marketplace, so it not easy to get a photo when he is alone. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes to resell.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is 30 years old. She is married with four children aged between four and 12; all of them go to school. 

She sells foodstuffs and has been in business for five years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more beans and maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and the pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beans and maize for sale.

loans.name: Telecila

texts.es:
Telecila tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Telecila se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral(patos, conejos, cuyes, pollos, entre otros), desde hace 08 años, negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, Telecila solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo; ella necesita realizar la compra de cerdos, cuyes, patos, gallinas; el préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor inversión, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Telecila is 47 years old. She lives with her husband in district of Oyotún, a community that works in agriculture, commerce and raising cattle. It is located in the Province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the North Coast of Peru.

Telecila has been working raising and selling farm animals (ducks, rabbits, guinea pigs, chickens amongst others) for 8 years. Her business is located at her house. Telecila is requesting a loan to have working capital. She needs to buy pigs, guinea pigs, ducks and chickens. The loan will help her to make a greater investment with the aim of expanding her business and satisfy the needs of her clients. In the short term this will allow her to increase her income and her profits and in the end improve her quality of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to provide working capital. She needs to buy pigs, guinea pigs, ducks, and chickens.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is a married woman with one child, who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expense is food.

For the past year, she has operated a hardware shop selling to the community. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business. With this loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase paint, nails, and water taps. She decided to join Yehu to access loan facilities to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase paint, nails and water taps

loans.name: Halidahan

texts.ru: Халида, 54 года, замужем, есть 3 детей, образование высшее. Халида на протяжении 20 лет занимается торговлей на дому полотенцами и одеялами. Имеет товар в обороте на сумму 200,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота. Доходы от кредита Халида планирует вложить в аренду контейнера.
texts.en:
Halidahan is a married 54-year-old woman with three children and a high school degree. For 20 years she has sold towels and blankets for use in the home. Her business grosses about 200,000KGS annually. 

To expand her business, she took a loan from micro-finance bank, Bai Tushum, for 50,000 to increase her inventory. She plans to use the income to invest in a rental container.

loans.use: buy towels and blankets for resale.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, es casado y tiene un hijo que está en etapa escolar, vive en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa está ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente Juan trabaja por más de diez horas como chofer ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia, porque su esposa gana muy poco como empleada de limpieza en casas particulares.

Juan quiere un credito para renovar partes de su vehiculo, después de una reparación ha decicido seguir el consejo de cambiar partes que no van a tardar en funcionar mal (las llantas por ejemplo)Juan goza de buena salud y espera que puedan ayudarle con el credito
texts.en:
Juan is married and has one school aged son. He lives in his own house, occupying two rooms. The house is located in the city of La Paz. Currently Juan is working more than 10 hours per day as a driver as he has to cover the cost of food, education and basic services for his family. His wife earns very little as a cleaner in private homes.

Juan wants a loan to renovate parts of his vehicle. After having some repairs done he decide to follow the advise to replace some parts that will soon not be good (the tires for example). Juan has good health and hopes that you can help him with this loan.

loans.use: to repair parts of his car.

loans.name: Nuevo Día Group

texts.es:
María Luisa es una madre mexicana entregada a su familia, en su comunidad la conocen como Mary, tiene 33 años de edad y desde hace 14 años vive en unión libre con Jaime quien trabaja en la cuidad de México como ayudante en un puesto de verduras. Juntos han formado una familia con dos niños los cuales se encuentran estudiando su educación primaria.

Desde hace 6 años Jaime y Mary iniciaron con su pequeña tienda de abarrotes juntos realizaron un gran esfuerzo para ahorrar algo de dinero y así poder comprar algunos dulces, el negocio fue creciendo poco a poco y cada vez venden más productos de abarrotes. 

Hace dos años que conocieron a VisionFund por lo que están muy agradecidos ya que siguen viendo mejoras en la tienda. Recientemente Doña Mary comenzó a vneder verduras en el mismo local por recomendación de sus clientes así, ella tiene más ganancias y las personas que viven cerca pueden adquirir fácilmente todo lo que necesitan sin tener que gastar en transporte para viajar hasta el municipio. Doña Mary siempre trata de buscar los mejores precios para beneficiar también a sus clientes, “me encanta atenderlos y más porque son mis vecinos, los conozco desde hace mucho tiempo”. 

Por el momento, Mary quisiera tener un refrigerador pero sabe que el consumo de energía eléctrica se elevaría demasiado y esto le impide vender productos lácteos, carnes frías, refrescos fríos, etc. pero esto no detiene a Mary para seguir creciendo. La tienda se ubica cerca de una primaria y muchas madres compran el lunch de sus niños o cualquier otro producto necesario para preparar el almuerzo. 

Mary necesita comprar más mercancía para abastecer su tienda y estar preparada para la época de fin de año que son una buena oportunidad para incrementar las ganancias. Mary comprará cajas de leche, refrescos, carnes frías, productos lácteos, productos enlatados y un poco de verdura.

El sueño de Doña Mary es poder llegar a tener una papelería para ella también sería un muy buen negocio por la escuela que tiene muy cerca de su casa, con sus rendimientos podría solventar los gastos de sus hijas que están estudiando porque quiere verlas realizadas profesionalmente.

Así como Doña Mary tiene metas en la vida también las integrantes del grupo ellas son madres muy emprendedoras siempre harán lo posible para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos, cada una de ellas tiene un negocio pero necesita de su préstamo para invertir ejemplo Doña María Elena y Magdalena también invertirán en sus tiendas de abarrotes mientras que Doña Constantina, María Juana y Angelina invertirán en la cría de sus borreguitos. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín del municipio, Doña Mary viste un chaleco negro.
texts.en:
María Luisa is a Mexican mother who's devoted to her family.  She's known as Mary in her community.  She's 33 years old and has lived in a common-law relationship with Jaime, who works in Mexico City as a helper in a vegetable stall.  Together they have formed a family with two children, who are currently in elementary school.

Jaime and Mary opened a small grocery store together six years ago.  They worked hard to save money to buy some sweets.  The business grew little by little, and they're selling more groceries all the time.

Two years ago they became familiar with VisionFund, for which they're very grateful because they continue to see improvements in the store.  Recently Mary started selling vegetables on the recommendation of her customers.  That way she earns more, and people who live nearby can get everything they need easily without having to spend money on transportation into town.  Mary always tries to find the best prices to benefit her customers as well: "I love to serve them, and even more so because they're my neighbors and I've known them for a long time."

At the moment, Mary would like to have a refrigerator, but she knows her consumption of electricity would go up too much.  Although this prevents Mary from selling dairy products, cold cuts, cold soft drinks, and so on, it doesn't keep her from continuing to grow.  Her store is located near an elementary school and a lot of mothers buy their children's lunches or other products they need to make lunch.

Mary needs to buy more merchandise to stock her store so she can be prepared for the end-of-year season, which is a good opportunity to increase her profits.  She's going to buy boxes of milk, soft drinks, cold cuts, dairy products, canned goods, and a few vegetables.

Mary's dream is to be able to have a stationery store.  It would be a good business for her because there's a school very close to her house.  With her profits she would be able to pay for her daughters' school expenses, because she wants to see them become professionals.

Just as Mary has goals in life, so do the member of the group.  They're enterprising mothers who always do what they can to improve their children's quality of life.  Each one of them has a business and also needs a loan to invest.  María Elena and Magdalena, for example, will also invest in their grocery stores, while Constantina, María Juana, and Angelina with invest in raising their sheep.

The photograph was taken in the municipal garden.  Mary's wearing a black vest.

loans.use: to buy boxes of milk, soft drinks, cold cuts, dairy products, canned goods, and a few vegetables

loans.name: Las Naves Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad del Estado de México se formó un grupo llamado “Las Naves” los integrantes son personas muy alegres, la mayoría de ellos se dedica a trabajar en el campo. En dicha localidad hay muchos invernaderos que también son conocidos como "naves", donde las familias cultivan una gran variedad de verduras y legumbres para su autoconsumo. Para llegar a la comunidad se debe caminar varios Kilómetros ya que el transporte es muy escaso.

Los integrantes del grupo son Elsa, Gregoria, Pascuala ellas invertirán en la cría de cerdos, Alfredo en borregos, Cirilo en dulces y Juan Carlos en tienda de abarrotes ellos están muy contentos y agradecidos con VisionFund y KIVA porque su préstamo les ayudara a invertir en sus actividades.

Berenice también es integrante del grupo, tiene 21 años de edad es muy joven pero muy entusiasta, platicadora, y amable; en su comunidad la conocen como Bere y es mamá de dos niños de los cuales sólo uno va a la escuela.

Bere y Valentín, su pareja, comenzaron a sembrar en pequeña hortaliza desde hace cuatro años donde trabajan largas jornadas. La pareja comienza a trabajar cuando los primeros rayos del sol iluminan su huerto, ellos prefieren aprovechar el día para avanzar en el cultivo de sus verduras. “Mi invernadero fue posible gracias a un proyecto del gobierno". Bere ha aprovechado muy bien el recurso, se esmera demasiado para mantener su hortaliza a pesar de que no recibió ningún tipo de capacitación, pero con el tiempo ellos mismos han encontrado las mejores técnicas para obtener mejores resultados.

Comenta que para tener productos de mejor calidad, la tierra debe estar bien removida y conocer el momento adecuado para abonar las plantas. Justamente en su hortaliza Bere ya tiene algunas verduras que necesita abonar para este mes y necesita un préstamos para comprar bultos de fertilizante.

Bere es muy feliz cultivando sus verduras pero lo que mas le encanta es salir a venderlas entre sus vecinas. Todas las tardes en su carretilla lleva zanahorias, cilantro, brócoli, col, coliflor, betabel, acelga, cebolla, rábanos, espinacas, etc. y afortunadamente las personas siempre compran en buenas cantidades porque les encanta el sabor y calidad de la verdura que cultiva. Bere está muy emocionada con su actividad y está ahorrando todo cuanto puede para terminar de mejorar su vivienda siempre pensando en que a sus niños no les falte nada.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín del municipio donde viven los integrantes,Bere viste un suéter de color azul y su niña posa junto a ella.
texts.en:
In a community in Mexico state a group called "Las Naves" formed. The members are very happy people and the majority of its members work in farming. In that area there are many greenhouses known as "naves" where families grow a lot of vegetables and legumes. In order to arrive at the community one has to walk kilometers because public transportation is sparse. The members of the group are Elsa, Gregoria, Pascuala who will invest in raising pigs, Alfredo in sheep, Cirilio in candy, Juan Carlos in a grocery store. They are very content and thankful to VisionFund and Kiva for the loan to invest in their businesses.

Berenice is also a member. She is an enthusiastic, friendly 21 year old mother of two children , one of whom attends school. She is known as Bere in her community. Bere and her husband Valentín began to plant crops 4 years ago, and they work long hours on their farm. They begin to work when the first rays of the sun lights their land. They prefer to take advantage of the day to tend to their vegetables. "My greenhouse was made possible thanks to a government project". Bere has taken advantage of this resource, and works to maintain her crops in spite of not having received any training with regard to the work. But with time they have found better techniques to obtain better results. She shares that in order to have better quality products, the land should be worked and one needs to known the right moment to fertilize the plants. Bere has a variety of vegetables that need fertilizer this month and she needs a loan to buy bundles of fertilizer. Bere is very happy growing her vegetables but what she enjoys the most is going out and selling to her neighbors. Every afternoon in her little cart she takes carrots, cilantro, broccoli, cabbage, cauliflower, onions, radishes, spinach, etc. and fortunately the people always buy in good quantities because they enjoy the flavor and quality of her vegetables.

Bere is very excited with her business and she is saving her money so that she can finish improving her home as she is always thinking of her children so that they have what they need. The photograph was taken in the municipal garden where the members live. Bere is dressed in a blue sweater and her daughter is with her.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

location.town: Ejido de San Pedro El Alto, San Felipe del Progres

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su hijo el cual estudia en el colegio de la zona, en el Caserío de Chiple, una zona rural del distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad de clima frío, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella tiene un restaurant donde vende comida preparada por ella misma, cuenta con clientela considerable por el buen sabor de sus comidas que ofrece, desde hace 5 años. Desea crédito para compra de insumos (arroz, menestras, carnes, etc.)para la preparación de sus potajes; para poder satisfacer todas las necesidades y preferencias de sus clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maribel is 37 years old. She lives with her son who attends school in the area. She lives in Caserio del Chiple, a rural area in Callayuc district, a community where there is a cold climate and the population works in farming, business and livestock. It si located in Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

She has a restaurant where she sells prepared food that she makes. She has had her business for 5 years and has a considerable customer base. She wants a loan to buy ingredients (rice, vegetables, meats, etc.) to make her stew in order to be able to satisfy all the needs and preferences of her customers. In the short term she will improve her profits, increase her earnings, and in the long term improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make her stew in order to be able to satisfy all the needs and preferences of her customers.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 49 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y tres menores hijos, vive en casa propia de material rustico de un piso ubicada en caserio Santa Rosa, Jaime es nacido en diho caserio, él se lleva bien los mienbros de su sector, caserio; Jaime cuenta con buenas referencias personales y comerciales en la zona, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua, está ubicada en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Jaime es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 2 has. Variedad catimor resistente a enfermedades, plantación esta en su tercer año de producción tiene 4 años de edad, cultiva café en caserio El Arenal del distrito de Santo Tomas, actividad la realiza desde hace 20 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de cafe. Adicionalmente cria animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar y ganado vacuno. El destino del crédito sera para mantenimiento y cultivo de 2 has. De café en fase de brote floral, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2015, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendra mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime is 49 years old and lives in a stable home with his wife and three younger children. They live in their own home, which is one-story, has running water, and is built of basic materials. Their house is located in a community called Santa Rosa, where Jaime was also born. Santa Rosa is located in the Santo Tomas district of Cutervo province, in the Cajamarca region of northern Peru. Most people in this area make their living in agriculture, cattle raising, and trade. Jaime gets along well with his neighbors and has a good reputation, both personally and commercially, in the area. 

Jaime has been growing coffee for 20 years and now makes his living with a coffee crop planted on 2 hectares [about 5 acres]. He has a lot of experience in coffee growing and grows a variety of coffee called Catimor that is disease-resistant. His current crop is 4 years old and in its 3rd year of production. Jaime's fields are located in the El Arenal community, also in Santo Tomas district. In addition to coffee, Jaime also grows other basic food crops and raises small animals like pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs, as well as cattle. 

This loan will be invested in maintaining and taking care of Jaime's coffee crop, which is currently in the flowering stage [the stage before the coffee "cherries" or beans are formed]. This will help him assure a good production for the 2015 season, which will in turn produce greater sales for him and bring in extra income that he can use to improve life for himself and his family.

loans.use: maintain and take care of his coffee crop, currently in the flowering stage, to assure good production for the 2015 season.

loans.name: Uulbubu

texts.ru: Уулбубу, 46 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. На протяжении многих лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, мастер в своем деле. У Уулбубу среднее образование. По хозяйству активно помогает вся семья. У Уулбубу есть земельный надел, 1,40 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает горох для реализации. Всю прибыль от бизнеса она старается вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса. Но в этом году Уулбубу решила улучшить жилищные условия сделать пристройку к дому. Поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов, окон, двери. Улучшение жидищных условий позволит Уулбубу обеспечить ее детей достойным жильем.
texts.en:
Uulbubu is a 46-year-old married woman with five children. She has a high school degree. For many years, she has been a farmer and raised livestock and is quite experienced. Her whole family helps her. 

Uulbubu has a plot of land 1.40 hectares in size, where she grows peas to sell. She tries to save all of her profits to grow the business. But this year Uulbubu decided to improve their living conditions by building an extension on her home. So she took a loan of 50,000 KGS from Bai Tushum to buy building materials, windows and doors. This will enable her to provide her children with decent housing.

loans.use: to purchase windows, doors and construction materials to build an extension of her house.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman. She has six children, all of whom attend school. Dama owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Dama operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business. With this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Righad

texts.en:
Righad is a 24-year-old single man, the sole earner of his family, with three other members to take care of. A hard-working man, Righad learned to be an electrician from his father. Righad acquired wide experience in this domain and started his own business a year ago, to make sure he could cover his family's living expenses and at the same time cover his university tuition fees.

His family's needs are increasing, and he is afraid that this might affect his ability to pay for his education. That's why Righad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his university's increasing tuition fees, to make his dream of graduating come true.

He hopes that in the future he can make his dream of graduating come true and establish his wider business.

loans.use: to pay for his university's increasing tuition fees to make his dream of graduating come true.

loans.name: Segundo Exequiel

texts.es:
Segundo Exequiel tiene 27 años de edad. Su estado civil es conviviente, vive en casa propia, junto a su esposa y suegra en el sector San Nicolás desde hace 08 años. Segundo Exequiel es una persona con buenas referencias personales, económicas y laborales. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad rural dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia. Ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Segundo Exequiel cuenta con ingresos del servicio de chofer y además, percibe ingresos de crianza y venta de patos y pavos. Además sembra caña de azucar. El destino del crédito para invertir en acabados de vivienda para poder ofrecer mayor comodidad a su familia, con ello vivrá en una casa segura y comoda para toda su familia y generará una mejora de calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Exequiel is 27 years old. He is in a common-law relationship and has lived in his own house along with his spouse and mother-in-law in an area of San Nicolás for 8 years. Segundo Exequiel is a person with excellent personal, economic and employment references. He has a close family. He lives in a rural community where the people work in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock. It is located in the district of Saña, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru.

Segundo Exequiel has income from being a driver and also gets income from raising and selling ducks and turkeys. He also grows sugar cane. The loan will be used to finish his house to offer greater comfort for his family, so that they can live in a safe and comfortable house. This will generate a higher quality of living for his whole family.

loans.use: to invest in finishing his house.

loans.name: Risolatkhon

texts.ru: Рисолатхон, 53 года, замужем, есть 6 детей. Рисолатхон в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1995 году. Благодаря упорному труду Рисолатхон, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 7 коров, также она выращивает на собственном участке мерою 0,59 ГА картофель, кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита Рисолатхон планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Risolatkhon is a 53-year-old married woman with six children. Her main income to support her family comes from farming and raising livestock. She has been in this business since 1995. 

Through hard work, she now has seven cows, and grows potatoes and corn on her .59 hectare plot of land. Her monthly income averages 10,000 KGS. In order to grow her business, she took a loan from Bai Tushum for 100,000 KGS to buy a male calf. 

Risolatkhon plans to invest the additional income in her business.

loans.use: buy additional male calves for fattening and subsequent resale.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 42 year old man married to Esther who adds additional income to support his family.  They are blessed with five children.  Francis has been operating an animal sales business and wool shearing business as a secondary business for the past five years, earning himself an income of KES. 10,000 at the end of every month.

Francis is now servicing his sixth loan of KES. 70,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to buy additional sheep to sell to his customers.

Francis plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy additional sheep to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Dzendera

texts.en:
Kahaso is a married woman. She has seven children, four of whom attend school. Kahaso owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Kahaso has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Delmis

texts.es:
La señora Delmis de 32  años de edad, vive con su mama  e hijos en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 10  años al negocio de venta de mariscos vende productos como camarones, pescado robalo, pargo rojo, lisa, ruco, palometa y otros mas, vive en una ciudad  de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Doña Delmis  es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de producto como camarones, pescado rojo, robalo, lisa, ruco, etc.  Con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente que ha tenido préstamos con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y bien surtido, al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Señora Delmis is a 32-year-old mother and entrepreneur who lives with her mother and her children in the family's own home in the city of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. She has for the past 10 years sold seafood such as shrimp, sea bass, red snapper, mullet, palometa, and other types of fish. Señora Delmis is a hardworking woman with great ambitions and great motivation to improve her life and her family's situation.  

Señora Delmis has borrowed from Prisma before, and is applying for a new loan for the purchase of seafood so that she can boost her income and her quality of life. She hopes to keep her business well-stocked and prosperous while she providing a better future for her family. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – November 2014.

loans.use: to purchase shrimp, redfish, sea bass, mullet, and other types of fish for her business.

loans.name: Peruth

texts.en: Peruth, 34 years old, is married and has 5 children aged between 5 and 14 years, all going to school. She has operated a business selling clothes for 9 years. Peruth would like to use this loan to buy more bed sheets for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more bed sheets for sale.

loans.name: Godelive

texts.en: Godelive, 40 years old, is married and has 6 children aged between 5 and 16 years, all going to school. She has run a business selling clothes for 9 years. Godelive would like to use this loan to buy more shirts and trousers to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more shirts and trousers to sell

loans.name: Cathia Elizabeth

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 20 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de medicina popular su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, la joven vive en casa propia con sus padres y su hermano, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de medicinas popular por mayor par continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The face of our member is obscured because she lives in a high-risk part of the country.  She is 20-years old and owns a herbal medicines business.  She operates the business from a space in the house she shares with her parents and brother.  The area is well-trafficked.  Our member is applying for a loan that she will use to carry on her herbal medicines business.

loans.use: to stock her herbal medicines business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 53-year-old Palestinian divorced mother of seven children. She worked hard in making and selling "Mouneh" from her house for thirteen years to satisfy her children's needs, for she is the sole earner of her family. 

Fatima succeeded with her ambitions to start selling her "Mouneh" in the market. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with raw materials in order to increase her production and satisfy her customers' needs.  Fatima hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with raw materials

loans.name: Xalida

texts.en:
Xalida is married and has three children. Her children go to secondary school.  She always cares for her children and wants them to study at the university. 

Her husband actively helps Xalida with her business. Xalida has been an IDP(Internally Displaced Person), a native of Fizuli city, over 22 years. Now she lives with her lovely family in Fuzuli region. Xalida is a farmer.  She has an area where she grows seasonal vegetables.  She needs a loan of 2350 AZN to repair the water system of the area. Xalida says she is thankful to the Kiva organization for all its support and for improving her business.

loans.use: to repair water system.

loans.name: Elidora

texts.es:
La señora  Elidora   de 54  años  de edad es casada,  vive con su esposo y sus hijos   en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 02 años al negocio de venta de frescos, churros, granos básicos y también se dedica a la cría y destazo de cerdos,   tiene su negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación y vive en una comunidad  de San Lorenzo  al sur de Honduras.
Doña  Elidora es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de frescos, churros, detergentes, jugos, arroz, frijoles, café, etc. espera contar con suficiente mercadería porque viene la época de navidad y desea tener bastante surtido está muy contenta de salir adelante con su negocio,  además en su comunidad esta próxima un feria y espera también que sus ventas aumenten.
Doña Elidora uno de sus sueño es mejorar su negocio para esta época de navidad.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Sra. Elidora, 54, and her husband have a house where they live with their children.  Doña  Elidora has operated a grocery business for 2 years.  She sells soft drinks and other products that her customers want.  She has a separate business raising and butchering pigs.  She lives in the town of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras and operates the grocery business from a space in her house.
Doña  Elidora is working hard to improve her standard of living.  She is applying for a loan that she will to buy the products she needs--soft drinks, churros, detergents, juices, rice, beans, coffee, etc.--to carry on her business.  Christmas is coming, she says, and she wants to be ready to meet the demand for the products she sells.  This investment will allow her to improve her business and, in turn, increase her sales.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2014

loans.use: to stock her grocery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Irene
