texts.en: Irene is 42 years old. She is married and has five children aged between 3 and 16 years.  All of them go to school. She sells bags and has been in a business for nine years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bags for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more bags for sale.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 22-year-old, single man. He established his own café in April 2013. It is where he serves specially requested Hookahs and drinks to his loyal customers.

Omar is a hard working ambitious man. He puts a lot of effort into developing his business in a well managed way. His acquired income is good but not enough to develop or expand his business. It is for this reason he is requesting a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with special café goods, especially tasty hot drinks for the coming Autumn and Winter seasons.

He hopes to keep on developing and increasing his business merchandise to open a bigger café in the future.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special café goods particularly tasty hot drinks for the coming Autumn and Winter seasons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more products (disposables decorations, clothing, toys, etc.) at wholesale.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 29 years old. She is married and has three children aged between three and eight years.  All of them go to school. She sells local drinks and has been running in a business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum for making more drinks for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for making more drinks

loans.name: Elphas

texts.en:
Elphas is a 50 year old man, married to Florah, who adds additional income to support his family.  They are blessed with three children.  Elphas has been operating a clothing sales business for a period of ten years, earning himself an income of KES. 15,000 at the end of every month.

Elphas was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES, 100,000 and intends to use this amount to buy shirts, skirts, dresses and trousers to sell to his customers on a daily basis.  

Elphas plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children and hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy shirts, trousers, dresses and skirts to sell to his customers.

loans.name: La Casa Azul Group

texts.es:
“Este es nuestro primer préstamo en VisionFund por lo que estamos muy contentos y agradecidos porque nos ayudará para invertir en nuestros negocios”.
El  grupo lo integran tres personas que viven en una comunidad donde el 13 de junio celebran a San Antonio de Pauda con una procesión muy especial, carreras de caballo, fuegos artificiales y la comida típica: tacos, mole, tamales y el tradicional pulque raspado de maguey.

María Teresa, de cariño le llaman Tere, tiene 23 años de edad, vive en unión libre con Adrián desde hace un año y son padres de una pequeña que aún no asiste a la escuela. Ella cuenta que antes de formar una familia con Adrian, ambos ya se dedicaba a la compra y venta de verduras, pero cuando comenzaron a vivir juntos ella pensó que si sembraban las verduras, sus ganancias serían mayores. Ahora tienen un pequeño invernadero donde cultivan nopal, cilantro, zanahorias, rábanos, espinacas, epazote, ect. y por lo general, todo el año tiene verduras y legumbres, los momentos en que no llegan a tener cosecha, se ven obligados a comprar. La pareja trabaja los domingos, lunes y martes, días en los que salen de casa a las 4 am para llegar a la central de abastos con su mercancía, para vender a las personas que buscan la verdura más fresca. En el mismo lugar es donde suelen comprar verduras en mayores cantidades a otras personas para poder revender. “Mientras mi esposo está en el puesto a mí me gusta caminar entre la gente porque así vendo más”. Finalmente la jornada en la central de abastos termina a las 6 pm, pero los días que llega a sobrar un poco de verdura, recorren las calles de su comunidad para regresar a su casa sin mercancía para que no pierda su frescura. 

El sueño de Tere es tener más espacio para sembrar más y dejar de comprar a otras personas en especial en las temporadas más importantes en las que sabe que puede mejorar sus ganancias, como el fin de año. Ahora precisamente necesita un préstamo para comprar las legumbres que le faltan, aprovechar la buena temporada y así poder terminar su casa de dos pisos. Poco a poco comenzará a ahorrar para pagar un terreno cerca de su casa e incrementar la cosecha.

Tere y los integrantes del grupo están muy agradecidos con VisionFund Y KIVA porque podrán invertir en sus negocios. Santos en adornos navideños, Juana en Bisuteria, Antonio en ropa.

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del kiosko del municipio donde viven los integrantes.
texts.en:
“This is our first loan with Vision Fund so we are very happy and grateful. The money will help us with our businesses,” says this group that is made up of three people who live in a community that celebrates San Antonio de Pauda on June 13th. There is a very special procession, horse races, fireworks, and traditional food such as tacos, mole, tamale, and the local drink called pulque made from the agave plant.

One group member is 23-year old María Teresa whose nickname is Tere. She has lived with her partner Adrián for a year, and they have a young daughter who does not yet attend school. Even before getting together, María and Adrián were buying and selling vegetables. Then when they began living together, María thought that if they grew the vegetables themselves, their income would be greater.

Now they have a small greenhouse where they grow prickly pear, cilantro, carrots, radishes, spinach, herb tea etc. Generally they have vegetables to sell throughout the year, but when they have no produce they are obliged to buy it.

The couple works on Sundays, Mondays, and Tuesdays leaving the house at 4am to get to the central market with their produce. They then sell it to people who seek the freshest vegetables.  In the same place they can buy produce in large quantities and resell it.
While Adrián stays at their stall, María walks around amongst the people so she can sell more.

The day’s work ends at 6pm but when they have vegetables left over, they sell the produce in the streets of their community so they don’t return home with vegetables that have lost their freshness.

Tere’s dream is to have more land on which to grow more vegetables so they can stop buying them from other people, especially at busy times, like the end of the year, when they can earn more money. Now she needs a loan to buy the vegetables they need, take advantage of the season, and finish building their two-storey home. Gradually she will start to saving up to buy some land near their home and grow more vegetables.

Tere and the other members of the group are very grateful to VisionFund and Kiva for financial help with their businesses. Santos sells Christmas ornaments, Juana jewellery, and Antonio clothing.

*The photo was taken on the steps of the local municipal bandstand.

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a fifty-four-year-old married man with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He operates a retail shop selling general merchandise in Bundibugyo. He has been in this business for one year, but his hard work has made him get enough profits.

He pays school fees for all his children and manages to get other basic necessities of life. He hopes to expand his business into wholesale to generate more income.

Julius is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as biscuits, toilet paper, and soap for selling.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as biscuits, toilet paper, and soap for selling.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 38-year-old married woman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has seven children and all of them are school-going. She has a retail shop as her major business, but she also has a cocoa garden. She has the responsibility of looking after her children and therefore works hard to meet their needs. She hopes to expand her business in the near future so as to earn more income despite the hardship of price fluctuations. Grace needs a loan to buy general merchandise such as cooking oil, bread and balloons to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as cooking oil, bread and balloons to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 34 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 8 and 16 years, all of them go to school.

Jacqueline sells local drinks and has been running a business for 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum for making more drinks for sale.

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum for making more drinks for sale.

loans.name: Al Ahlam 1 Group

texts.en:
Al Ahlam 1 group consists of four loyal hard working women, who put as much effort in developing their business and families' living as they can.

These ladies decided to hold hands together and acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Abir is the group's featured borrower, she is a 40-year-old, married, mother of five children, who works in selling clothes to support her beloved husband in covering their family's increasing living needs. Her acquired loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with the new Autumn and Winter collection especially before the coming Christmas season.

Abir is the first lady at the far left side of the picture. As for the other group members, Jihan is the second from the left, Sokaina is the second from the right, while Intisar is the first from the right.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with the new autumn and winter collections before the upcoming Christmas season.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is thirty three years old and divorced with six children. She lives in Kasese Uganda.

Rose is a fishmonger. She has been in business for six years and she has managed to provide for the basic needs of her children from that business.

Rose has a dream of educating her children and a business plan of expanding her business but she is challenged by the lack of preservative containers or a refrigerator to preserve the fish. She also faces the challenge of market competition.

Rose will use the loan to buy dry fish for selling.

loans.use: to buy dry fish for selling.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 28 years old. She is married with one child who is four years old, not yet old enough to go to school. She is a tailor and has been in this business for four years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more cloth for tailoring. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and welfare.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for tailoring.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland is a current client and is married with five children, four attend school.

He has operated a coffee trade for over 15 years. He is challenged by limited capital which affects his operations. He joined Ugafode for financial assistance to expand his business and will use the loan to meet his financial needs like paying school fees. 

He has applied for 5,000,000 UGX to buy more coffee and increase his profitability. Roland thanks Ugafode for the financial assistance which has enabled him to educate his children, start  a restaurant for his wife,and meet his financial obligations.

loans.use: to buy coffee.

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en: Consolee is 43 years old. She is married with 7 children between the ages of 3 and 20 years. Six of them go to school. Consolee sells food stuffs and has been in business for 16 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is a 30-year-old married woman with 2 children who are  2 and 4 years old, one attends school. 

She has sold charcoal for 6 years. She will use the loan to buy more charcoal to sell. The profits will be used to reinvest in her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 35 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 2 and 10 years; 2 of them go to school.

Epiphanie sells food stuff and has been in business for 7 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas to resell. In the photo, she is in the market. it is not easy to get a photo when she is alone.

The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to resell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 27-year-old married woman with 2 children who are 2 and 5 years old, one attends school. 

She has sold construction material for 5 years. She will use the loan to buy  cement and iron sheets. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and welfare.

loans.use: to buy  cement and iron sheets.

loans.name: Jessel

texts.en:
From her desire to help her parents raise their family, Jessel, 21 and single, is engaged in a snack vending business from which she earns adequate income in support their family's needs. She also wants her family to have  a safe and comfortable living space. 

Jessel applied for her membership in PMPC to gain access to financial assistance. She is seeking a PHP 7,000 loan to purchase sticks, nails, and nipa thatch for her house. She hopes to become member in good standing with a good repayment record. 

Jessel is very thankful when her financing need are supported by PMPC. Someday, she deeply wishes to live a happy and comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase sticks, nails, and nipa (palm frond) thatch for her house

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is a Mexican farmer who lives from raising cows and selling their milk and meat. He also cultivates corn on a relatively large field and sells it on the local markets. He shares his home with several generations of his family, which implies big energy needs to cook and heat water - and above all, high expenses due to the increasing price of LP gas.

 By investing in a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, Gregorio decided to produce the energy needed in his household himself, taking advantage of a free resource: his animals' waste. Through the natural bacteria and methanization process taking place inside his large biodigester, Gregorio will be able to supply his family in biogas for the kitchen and to heat water in the bathroom, as well as producing a nutrient-rich organic fertilizer to increase the yield of his crops in a natural way. 

The operating costs on his farm will decline through the displacement of expensive LP gas and chemical fertilizers, also reducing Gregorio's family's impact on the environment. Gregorio is pictured with his biodigester on the day it was installed. 

The loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 25 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en:
Rogers is a new client to the organization and has applied for 5,000.000 UGX. He has sold poultry and charcoal to earn an income for  six years. He will use the loan to buy more charcoal and poultry to increase his earnings.  He plans to  raise money to maintain his family, pay school fees for his children, and develop himself. 

Rogers is an honest and hardworking man but is limited by capital. He faces many challenges like fluctuating prices and competition from other traders. However, his major problem is limited capital which hinders him from stocking enough for his customers. With this loan from UGAFODE, Rogers is hopeful that the situation will gradually improve.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Severiano

texts.en:
Severiano is a small dairy farmer who lives in the Mexican countryside. His cows and sheep give him enough milk to supply his family, although increasing LP gas prices, expensive chemical fertilizers and the large amounts of wood he and his family collect to cook and heat water can sometimes lead him to tight financial situations. 

By investing in a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, Severiano is becoming more self-sufficient, since he is producing his own renewable energy (biogas) and a nutrient-rich, natural fertilizer with his animals’ waste. He is closing a natural cycle on his farm and is able to displace the expensive LP gas and chemical fertilizers. 

His wife, who spent several hours per week collecting wood, can now cook with biogas, thereby also improving her health condition, since she does not inhale the toxic smoke anymore. The piles of waste will not contaminate watersheds anymore nor attract flies, so the farm will be cleaner and the whole family will have more money available to fulfill its needs. 

Severiano is pictured with his biodigester on the day of its installation. This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part is covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel dedicates himself to seeding and harvesting corn on his plot of land, while his wife takes care of their cow and calves, selling the milk and cleaning the stable. Prior to purchasing their biodigester, they used to buy wood on a daily basis to cook, and also needed LP gas to heat water. From now on, they can use their cow’s waste to produce their own biogas and biofertilizer through the biodigester, significantly reducing their operating costs. Indeed, they will not need to buy the expensive LP gas anymore, nor wood and chemical fertilizers. Samuel will spread the organic fertilizer on his fields to increase their yield in a natural way, while his wife will cook using biogas, thus not having to inhale toxic smoke anymore. Their farm will become a cleaner place to live since the piles of waste will be input in the biodigester, reducing the presence of flies and contamination of watersheds.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester; the remaining part is covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Barrio 3 Group

texts.en:
Poverty in Guatemala is widespread and deeply entrenched. About half of the population lives in rural areas of the country that accounts for a large majority of the country’s economically impoverished. Eight women, who live in the western highland town of San Marcos La Laguna, on the shores of Lake Atitlan, are committed to eliminating poverty and empowering themselves. They joined together this past March to form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Barrio 3” meaning “Neighborhood 3”. The ladies have already received a loan from Friendship Bridge funded by KIVA investors and have successfully paid back the entire loan. The eight women and a new member of the Trust Bank are requesting a new loan from Friendship Bridge that they hope will be funded by KIVA investors.

We previously reported on Juana who used her loan to purchase materials to sustain her backpack business. She makes these backpacks in various sizes and colors. She has just begun her second loan cycle. Another member of the Trust Bank, Maria Guadalupe, was elected Treasurer for this loan cycle. She is a  31-year-old single woman who works hard to meet the needs of her family. Maria Guadalupe is a weaver and embroiderer and creates beautiful traditional blouses called “huipiles”, and hand-made napkins. She wants to take advantage of special events like graduations and holiday events as business will increase. Maria Guadalupe requests a new loan to purchase a quantity of thread in various colors and textures, needles, and other necessary supplies. She wants KIVA investors to know that she is very appreciative of their support. As a single business woman, she would have great difficulty securing a loan else where.

Thank you, KIVA investors, for your kindness and generosity. We shall provide a follow-up in the very near future of the nine women in the “Barrio 3” Trust Bank.

loans.use: to purchase a quantity of thread in various colors and textures, needles, and other necessary supplies.

loans.name: Mpunga Group

texts.en:
Mathias is married man in his mid 30s.  He has one daughter who attends school. He has  run a transportation business for one and a half months and works from 6am to 10pm daily to make a good monthly income.  

He used the previous loans to pay for motorcycle  maintenance and has successfully repaid the loans.  He used the profit to buy a plot of land, built his house, pay school fees, and cover household expenses.  He is pleased with the loan and appreciates Kiva's support.  He will use this loan to open a retail shop for his wife.  He dreams of being successful in his business. 

Mathias will share this loan with his loan group  "MPUNGA" which consist of two members who will hold each other accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to open a retail shop for his wife.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is aged 46 and is charged with the responsibility of taking care of six children aged between 6 and 18.

She deals in cattle rearing and gets additional income from outside catering. She hopes to develop and expand her farm despite the challenge of unpredictable weather changes.

She will use the loan facility to buy more cows for rearing.

loans.use: to buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo decided to purchase a 20 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester in order to reduce the operating costs on his farm by taking advantage of a simple resource: his cows’ manure. Instead of piling it up outside his farm, he will now be able to put it into his biodigester and let the methanisation process and bacteria transform the waste into biogas and a potent, nutrient-rich natural fertilizer to increase the yield of his corn fields in a natural way. He will use the biogas to cook and heat water in the house. 

Soils and watersheds will not be contaminated anymore, and the farm will be cleaner. He will be able to displace the fossil fuel-based LP gas, as well as the wood he used to purchase, reducing his carbon footprint while saving money. His wife will cook using biogas, eliminating smoke from her kitchen, which damaged her health. 

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 20 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as flour, sugar, milk, etc. for her food vending business.

Emilia has been in this business for eight years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Emilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as flour, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Augusto Cesar

texts.es: EL SEÑOR AUGUSTO CUENTA CON UNA IMPRENTA ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE UNA  NIÑA EN EDAD ESCOLAR EL TRABAJA DE LUNES A SABADO DE LAS 7 AM A LAS 5PM EL SEÑOR SOLICITA FINANCIAMIENTO CADA 8 MESES PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES PARA LA IMPRENTA COMO ES PAPEL, TINTA Y OTROS ARTICULOS EL CLIENTE ES UN HOMBRE QUE HA LUCHADO POR HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO POR LA ALTA DEMANDA QUE TIENE.
texts.en: Augusto has a printing business. He is the father of one daughter who studies in school. He works Monday through Saturday from 7 AM to 5 PM. Augusto seeks a loan every 8 months to buy materials for the business such as paper, ink and other items. He is a man who has fought to grow his business and he has a good customer demand.

loans.use: to buy printing materials, bond paper, printer ribbons, toner, and paper for cards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies of fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 30 years old, married, and has a snack vending business in Lopez Jaena. This is how she supports her husband in sustaining their family’s needs. She earns a meager income of PHP 5,000 per month.

Recently, Maricel accessed a loan to purchase nails, sticks, and nipa thatch for roofing. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase nails, sticks, and nipa thatch for roofing.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fabric, thread, and needles for making bags.

Jasmin has been in this business for ten years now.

In the future, Jasmin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and needles for making bags.

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Hello, lenders, meet Nita. She is a 38-year-old smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is a small rural town in Kenya. Nita and her husband are blessed to have a child. Nita has been a mixed farmer for more than 14 years. She keeps poultry for eggs, grows maize and vegetables, and sells milk. She also holds a day job and engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path. 

Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Nita is very passionate and optimistic about the future of horticultural farming in Kenya. Nita is seeking a loan to expand her horticultural farm. This move is quite a big deal for her. With your loan, Nita seeks to continue growing different varieties of crops but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Kerugoya and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will negate the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She states, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my child.” Nita has only one objective: to sell more horticulture so that her life will be more peaceful.

loans.use: To grow her horticulture business

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en: Nelida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling herbal medicine in the Philippines. Nelida has been in this business for 15 years now. She requested an 8,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase more stock of herbal medicine to sell. In the future, Nelida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Armando Fabiel

texts.es: Don Armando, tiene 56 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive con su familia en el municipio de Victoria, Yoro. El ha trabajado la agricultura desde cuando era niño junto a su padre ya tiene mas de 35 años de hacer sus propios cultivos, actualmente tiene un cultivo de maíz, pero también cultiva café y frijoles. Esta producción la vende en los mercados locales o llegan a comprarle a su casa.  El ha solicitado un préstamo de 12,000 Lempiras para mejorar sus cultivos, ya que necesita abonar y limpiar el cultivo de maíz y preparar el terreno para resiembra.Para don Armando, los préstamos son una gran oportunidad para sacar buenas cosechas y obtener más ganancias. Su meta es mejorar los cultivos para asegurar los ingresos de la familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Armando is 56 years old, married, and has 3 children. He lives with his family in Victoria municipality. He has worked in agriculture since he was a child along side his father. Now he has more than 35 years of experience growing his own crops. Today he has corn crops, but he also grows coffee and beans. He sells his production at local markets or customers come to buy from him at his home. He seeks a loan for 12,000 Lempiras to improve his crops, as he needs to fertilize and prepare the corn havest and prepare the ground for replanting. For Armando, the loans are a great opportunity to have a good harvest and obtain greater earnings. His goal is to improve his crops to ensure income for his family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers to apply to his corn crop and prepare the land for replanting.

loans.name: Maria Gloria Alicia

texts.en:
Maria Gloria Alicia is a  farmer who raises  sheep. She also grows corn in the field behind her home. 

She decided to invest in a biodigester in order to save money and take advantage of her animals' manure.  A biodigester is like a mechanical stomach. It is fed with organic material, which is decomposed by bacteria in an oxygen-free environment.  The purpose is to produce a renewable energy called biogas (methane and carbon dioxide) and other material that is mainly used as fertilizer.

She used to spend a large part of her income on wood and LP gas to supply her home and farm with energy. The biodigester will enable her to use sheep's waste  to produce her own biogas.  This will allow her to cook and heat water with renewable energy. 

The biodigester also produces a nutrient-rich fertilizer, which will increase the yield of Maria's corn in a natural way. In addition to reducing her operating costs, Maria will reduce her carbon footprint and improve hygiene on her farm, since waste will be put into the system instead of accumulating outside the farm.


This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part will be  covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en:
Batbold is a 26-year-old man who  lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has run a photography studio since 2009. 

His wife is unemployed and takes care of household chores. He used a previous loan to purchase a printer, computer, and camera.  He needs 2,650 USD to open a new photography studio. The loan will be used to pay an employee, buy equipment, and pay rent. If his new studio succeeds like his current studio, his family's standard of living will  improve.

loans.use: to open a new photography studio.

loans.name: Jessica Yadira

texts.es:
La señora  Jessica  de  28  años  de edad es casada,  vive con esposo y sus hijos   en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 02 años al negocio de venta de ropa nueva   ubicado en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Doña Jessica sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos de su comunidad y personas de aldeas aledañas, es una mujer emprendedora que tiene ganas de salir adelante.
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de ropa como pantalones, camisas, blusas, calzonetas, vestidos, etc. ya que viene la época de navidad y desea tener bastante surtido, está muy contenta de poder trabajar con Prisma y uno de sus sueños es salir adelante con su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Sra. Jessica, 28, and her husband have a house where they live with their children.  Doña Jessica lives in San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras, and has operated a clothing sales business for 2 years.  She draws her customers from friends, neighbors and buyers in surrounding towns.  She is an enterprising woman, ambitious to move up in the world.  
Doña Jessica is applying for a loan that she will use to buy the merchandise she needs--pants, shirts, blouses, dresses, etc.--to meet the demand from her customers that she expects over the coming holidays.  She adds that she is very grateful to Prisma for its support and says that she hopes to carry on growing her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2014.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 51 years old and married with thee children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nancy has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. Nancy requested a 12,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase more fish to make dried fish. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en:
Hilario used to spend a large portion of his annual income in chemical fertilizers to increase the yield of corn and oats.  He sells half of his harvest in the local market. His wife used wood to cook and heat water.  Wood burning contributes to deforestation and damages her health by inhaling the toxic smoke. 

The investment in a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester will allow Hilario and his family to save money and protect the environment while improving their quality of life. They will replace the  LP gas and unsustainable wood purchases by producing their own biogas, which uses cows' and sheep's waste in the biodigester. Hilario's wife will cook and heat water with renewable energy, eliminate the accumulated waste outside the house. The nutrient-rich and organic fertilizer produced by the biodigester will enhancing the soil. They plan to use the savings to expand their milk selling business.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining pat being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Nhóm 02 - Khu Phố 3 - Ba Đình - Bỉm Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiền operates a small restaurant selling rice, meat, and fish. She has been involved in this business for two years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food to cook and sell.

Hiền is 31 years old, and she is married with one child.

She is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 - Khu Phố 3 - Ba Đình - Bỉm Sơn solidarity group, which consists of five members. This is Hiền’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main hardship that Hiền faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hiền hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more food to cook and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy slippers, sandals, ready to wear clothes, under garments,fashion accessories, and other items.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a rice  business for 2 years. Lea earns additional income from  fishing.

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy rice to sell.

Lea has sustained her business through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She plans to save enough money  to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 24 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as soft drinks, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

Mary Ann has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as soft drinks, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Davaasambuu

texts.en:
Davaasambuu, 52 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife have sold second-hand furniture  since 2012. He used his previous loan to buy an delivery vehicle which helped him to expand his business. He requests 4,000,000 MNT to buy large quantities of old furniture  to increase his working capital. 

Davaasambuu is a very hardworking individual who knows the value of micro loans.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of old furniture.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena thought of good fortune when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She decided to give it a try after she learned she could request financial assistance for her chosen business. Magdalena has maintained her membership in good standing without a record of defaults up to this day. She has taken out several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner. 

Recently, Magdalena requested a loan to purchase additional piglets for commercial sale and bags of feed for her growing hog. Magdalena wishes to continue to manage her business effectively with the support of her family. Someday, she hopes to repair her house to provide her family with a safe and decent living.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets for commercial sale and bags of feed for her growing hog

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Rony Omar

texts.es: Rony, tiene 26 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene dos hijos, y reside en la aldea del Negrito, Yoro. Rony desde pequeño a ayudado a su padre en actividades agrícolas en cultivo de maíz y arroz. Lleva 8 años de cultivar su propia parcela de arroz, siendo esta actividad su fuente de ingresos. La producción de arroz es de calidad y la vende a los beneficios de arroz. Ha mantenido la producción asistida mediante la inversión de dos prestamos anteriores, actualmente solicita otro por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar formulas, preparación del terreno y pago de mano de obra para trasplantar el cultivo de arroz. Su meta es incrementar el área de producción y con los ingresos darle el estudio a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rony is 26 years old, he is in a civil partnership with his wife, with whom he has two children, and he lives in the small town of Negrito, Yoro. 

Since Rony was little, he has helped his father with farming, growing corn and rice. He has been growing his own area of rice for eight years, this work being his main source of income. It is quality rice production and he sells it for a profit. 

He has maintained the production with the help of the investment of two previous loans, now he is requesting another loan for 10,000 lempiras to buy formula, preparation of the land and labor costs to replant the rice crop. His goal is to increase the production area and with the income he will give his children an education and improve their home.

loans.use: to buy formula, preparation of the land, and labor costs to replant the rice crop.

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.en: Sabrina has mastered her hog raising business in Tipolo, Plaridel. This is how she makes a living and is able to help her husband for their family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail herself of credit to fully support her business. Just as she takes care of her hog raising business and so it is with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always run for any financing needs. Now, the loan of PHHP 5,000 will help her build a concrete pig pen that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: build a concrete pig pen.

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es:
La señora Deisy  de 46  años de edad , vive con su esposo tiene un  hijo  y vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 06 años  a la venta de abarrotería, frescos y verduras, también vende cosméticos, su esposo se dedica a la actividad de pesca y le apoya económicamente.
Doña Deisy  sus clientes son los amigos y personas que a diario le visitan y también los miembros de su iglesia son sus clientes, es una mujer trabajadora y bien humilde tiene muchas ganas de sacar adelante  a su familia.
Está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra  de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, plátanos, papas,  refrescos, etc.  Con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos porque a mayor producto en su negocio vende más y por ende sus ganancias son buenas, es su noveno préstamo que solicita a Prisma.
Su sueño es mejorar su casa y su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Deysi, 46 years old, lives with her husband and she has a son. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in southern Honduras.

She has her own home, and for the past six years she has been selling groceries, fresh food, and vegetables. She also sells cosmetics. 

Her husband is a fisherman and he helps her financially. 

Her customers are friends and people who visit her daily, as well as members of her church. Deysi is a hardworking, very humble lady with a great desire to get her family ahead. 

She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, bananas, potatoes, drinks, etc. She will improve her income with the help of this loan, because with better stocking she sells more, thus getting good profits.

This is Deysi's ninth loan through Prisma. She dreams of improving her house and her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, bananas, potatoes, drinks, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en: Bayarsaikhan, 36 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as an engineer at a copper mining company since 2003. His wife works at a power plant. Their two children go to school and kindergarten respectively. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy two cows in order to create his own farm. In the future, he wants to sell dairy products and beef to local people.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is from Bato, Plaridel. She is 57 years old and is single. Elma owns and operates a small sari-sari (convenience) store. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Unfortunately, she almost lost her capital when her mother passed away. PMPC came as a rescue to Elma as she gained access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. 

Elma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase store inventory and as working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the revenue generated from the business to improve their living conditions and support her father's health needs.

loans.use: to purchase store inventory and to use as working capital to improve their living conditions and support her father's health needs

loans.name: Arismel

texts.es: Arismel emprendió su negocio en el año 2013, cuando su hermano quien anteriormente era el propietario de este negocio decidió cedérselo.  Con seis años de experiencia en el negocio de tratamiento y embotellamiento de agua,  su portafolio de productos es diverso; botellas de agua en distintas presentaciones, hielo, agua saborizada y boli (agua saborizada congelada).  Arismel continúo ofreciendo los productos a los distribuidores que habían cultivado y  toda la semana  en el horario de 6 a.m. a  5 p.m. pueden acceder a la compra de contado de sus productos para su posterior distribución. Así mismo él ofrece sus productos  de contado puerta a puerta en el barrio donde reside en el municipio de Soledad. En la actualidad Arismel está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual comprará insumos para su negocio como plásticos 3lt, plásticos de hielo, plásticos para agua saborizada entre otros, que aumentara su stock de producto lo cual es muy beneficioso para el cumplimiento oportuno a sus clientes.  Arismel tiene 49 años de edad y es padre de dos hijos de 7 y 24 años y una hija de 20 años, a quienes desea continuar ayudando para que puedan tener un mejor futuro.  Su meta familiar es capacitarse para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Arismel started his business in 2013, when his brother, who previously owned the business, decided to give it to him. With six years of experience in the water treatment and bottling business, his portfolio of products is diverse: water bottles in various presentations, ice, flavored water, and boli (frozen flavored water). Arismel continued offering the products to the distributors that they had cultivated. All week, from 6 A.M. to 5 P.M., they can buy their products for cash for subsequent distribution. In the same way, he offers his products door-to-door for cash in the neighborhood where he lives in the Soledad municipality. 

Currently, Arismel is applying for a Kiva loan – the first loan that he requests from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo – with which he will buy supplies for his business such as 3 liter plastic bottles, plastic for ice, plastic bottles for flavored water, and others, which will expand his stock of products. This is very beneficial for the timely fulfillment of his customers’ needs.

Arismel is 49 years old and is the father of two sons, of ages 7 and 24, and one daughter, of age 20. He wants to keep helping them so that they can have a better future. His family goal is to prepare himself to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy 3 liter plastic bottles, plastic for ice, and plastic bottles for flavored water.

loans.name: Meleta

texts.en: Retailing has helped Meleta survive for the family. She has improved their living conditions and has renovated their house roof and walls. She retails charcoal and brings a meager income of PHP 6,000 per month. She found the business of buying and selling charcoal easy and simple because all she needed to do is to weigh and repack the charcoal for her buyers. Meleta plans to expand her retailing business. She applied for a loan to PMPC for the needed capital. She wants to purchase inventory of charcoal for retail. Meleta smiles at the fact to see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of charcoal for retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and condiments, and ingredients for cooking such as meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Chanthach

texts.en:
Chanthach is a 30-year-old married rice farmer with a 2-year-old child and a grown-up nephew in her care. She lives in Takeo province, Cambodia. Chanthach has been farming rice for over 13 years. Her husband is 34 and he is a professional cook. Together, they earn approximately $7 a day. 

Chanthach's nephew is majoring in engineering at university and he needs a computer. Chanthach would like to request a loan to buy a computer for him to use in his studies. In the future, to earn more income, Chanthach wants to fatten animals and then save money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her nephew's university studies

loans.name: Nyambat

texts.en: Mr. Nyambat, 36 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi services to local people since 2007. His wife is a nurse at a hospital. Their eldest child goes to school, and the younger two children are in kindergarten. He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy spare parts such as tires, brakes, and fog lights in order to replace damaged parts of his car. The income from the taxi service is the main source of income for his family, so repairing his car as soon as possible is crucial to his family's living.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Merna

texts.en:
Merna is married and has five children, and the family lives in Calaca-an, Plaridel, Philippines. She is a diligent and persevering mother when it comes to the welfare of her family, and she has always been known to provide the best for them. 

Merna earns a living by making snacks that she sells on consignment in shops, canteens, and cafes. She decided to expand her business after learning that she could obtain financial assistance through PMPC. Consequently, she has requested a 4,000 PHP loan to buy additional ingredients to increase production. Her goal is to be able to display her snacks in every shop and place to eat in the area. With the help and support of her husband, Merna smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for the snacks she makes and sells

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, biscuits, and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, re-bar, sand and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 1000 pounds of fish, shrimp, conch, and lobsters.

loans.name: Maximianito

texts.en:
Maximianito is a hardworking and industrious father who is known in their neighborhood as a "tuba" (coconut wine) gatherer. Everyday he sells and delivers his "tuba" in the public market, earning PHP 400 from it daily. This business has enabled him to support his seven children in their education for 25 years. 

Maximianito became a member of PMPC and appreciates the various programs and services that the coop offers. He hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house. He has applied for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase plywood, nails, and wood to make his home safe and comfortable. He hopes to maintain his membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters to him that he has been given priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what he is thankful for, when all his financing needs are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails and wood to make his home safe and comfortable

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Delia Eugenia

texts.es:
Delia  vive en Ventanas provincia de los Rios, tiene 36 años de edad vive con sus dos hijos y se dedica a la agricultura ya que no tiene otra fuente de trabajo, solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas de maíz e insumos para luego sembrar y obtener una buena producción para así solventar los gastos de su familia . Realiza las compras en Ventanas. Su sueño es comprarse un terreno y una maquina para la agricultura. 
En su tiempo libre le gusta le gusta leer y hacer deporte.
texts.en: Delia lives in Ventanas, located in the Rios province.  She is 36 years old, lives with her two children, and makes a living farming, since there is no other source of work now.  She is requesting this loan in order to purchase seeds for corn and supplies to then sow and obtain good crops and cover her family’s expenses.  She makes purchases in Ventanas.  Her dream is to purchase a plot of land and an agricultural machine.  In her free time, she likes to read and play sports.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his rickshaw and buy new brake lines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chickens and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Santos Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Santos de  66  años de edad, vive con su esposo no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 08 años  a la venta de frescos y galletas etc. es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Santos está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de más productos como refrescos, galletas y churros, etc. para su negocio ya que desea surtirlo porque la demanda es bastante fuerte para esta época de navidad.  Con el apoyo del préstamo espera mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida, su sueño es tener un buen negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras-  Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Santos is 66 years old.  She lives with her spouse in her own house and has no dependent children.  She lives in the San Lorenzo community, located in the department of Valle.  For eight years, she has made a living selling sodas, cookies, etc.  She is a hardworking woman and wishes to move forward.

Santos is requesting this loan to buy more products like sodas, cookies, chips, etc. for her business, since she wants to supply it because there is a high demand during the Christmas season.  With the support of this loan, she hopes to improve her business and as a result, her quality of life.  Her dream is to have a good business.

loans.use: to buy sodas, cookies, chips, etc. for her business

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La señora  Faustina  de 55  años de edad, vive con su esposo no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 30 años  a la actividad de costura,  elabora vestidos, trajes, arreglos de prendas de vestir. etc.
Doña Faustina está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de materia prima como hilos, botones, telas, etc.  Con el apoyo del préstamo espera mejore su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida. 
Doña Faustina su sueño es tener un buen negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Faustina, 55 years old, lives with her husband. She does not have children who depend on her. She lives in a community in San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras. She has her own home and has made a living for 30 years from dressmaking: she creates dresses, suits, and repairs pieces of clothing, etc.

Faustina is requesting the loan for the purchase of primary materials, such as thread, buttons, cloth, etc. With the support of the loan, she hopes to improve her business and as a result her quality of life.

Faustina’s dream is to have a good business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- November, 2014

loans.use: to purchase thread, buttons, cloth, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Aracely

texts.es:
La señora  Rosa de 40  años de edad, vive con su esposo tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 18 años  a la venta de frescos naturales, mariscos, sándwich, taquitos, etc., ella es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Rosa está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de una refrigeradora para su negocio ya que no tiene y desea mejorar  para esta época de navidad.  Con el apoyo del préstamo espera mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida, su sueño es tener un buen negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras-  Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Rosa is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two children who are dependent on her. She lives in San Lorenzo in Valle department in the south of Honduras. She has her own house and for the past 18 years has been working selling fruit drinks, seafood, sandwiches, tacos, etc. She is a hard-working woman who wants to get ahead.

Rosa is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator for her business as she does not have one and she wants to improve for the Christmas season. With the help of the loan she hopes to improve her business and in the end her quality of living. Her dream is to have a good business.
San Lorenzo, Honduras- November 2014.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her business.

loans.name: Sonia Aracely

texts.es:
La señora Aracely de 41  años de edad, vive con sus hijos y su esposo  en su casa  propia, se dedica desde hace 10   años al negocio de venta de tortillas y carne de cerdo, sus clientes son todos sus vecinos y también personas de las comunidades vecinas,  que tienen muchos años de comprarle sus productos.
Doña Aracely  vive en una comunidad  al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida.  
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de 3 Cerdos grandes ya que se acerca la temporada buena de diciembre y quiere prepararse bien,  con el apoyo de este préstamo  pretende comprar los cerdos a buen precio,  al mismo tiempo  mejorara sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es crecer su negocio tener más clientela para poder mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Noviembre del  2014.
texts.en:
Aracely is 41 years old and lives with her husband and children in her own home. For 10 years she has been selling tortillas and pork. Her customers are her neighbors and other people from neighboring communities that have been buying her products for years. Aracely lives in a community in southern Honduras. She is an enterprising woman with the desire to be successful and she fights every day to improve her quality of life.

She is seeking a loan to buy 3 large pigs as the good season is approaching in December and she wants to be prepared. With the help of this loan she can buy pigs at a good price while at the same time improving her profits and her quality of life. She is a new client with the desire to work with Prisma. Her dream is to grow her business and have more customers in order to be able to improve her income and quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2014.

loans.use: to buy pigs for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more processed meat such as sausages, hot dogs, chicken and others

loans.name: Sophap

texts.en: Sophap, 22 years old and single, lives in Battambang province. She earns an income to support her studies through rice cropping and raising ducks. This is Sophap's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her loan to pay her university tuition fees for her major in Marketing. She hopes that she can get a good job to improve her living conditions after she graduates.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees for her major in Marketing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as flour, baking soda, cheese and sugar and more fish to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a dried fish vendor from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is 39 years old, married, and has three children. Cecilia has sold dried fish for more than eight years now. This is the source of her income.

Cecilia is requesting to take a loan to buy more fish to dry. With a loan, she will be able to stock up more dried fish, which she can sell to her customers for a good price.

In the future, Cecilia hopes to make her business profitable and stable.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal, con lo que gana logra solventar los gastos del hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero no tiene de suficiente capital por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos.
texts.en: Guadalupe, 43 years old, lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. She works selling fruit and vegetables in the town market. With what she earns she is able to cover the expenses of the home. She wants to improve her home, building a room in the place shown in the photo, but she does not have enough capital. That is why she requests a loan from INTEGRAL to buy cement, sand, brick, iron, and to pay labor costs so that she and her family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, brick, iron, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Chanthu

texts.en: Chanthu, a local farmer from Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, is 41 years old and a mother of four children. To secure the needs of her family, she grows cassava as a single source of her income. This is the first time for Chanthu to take out a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan to pay tuition for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree in midwifery. She hopes her daughter can get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree in midwifery.

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en: Sorn, 33, is a mother of three children living in Kampong Speu province. She grows rice as the single source of her income, earning about 20,000 KHR per day to keep up her lifestyle. This is Sorn's first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is the leader of her four-member loan group. Sorn will spend her entire loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family has clean water to drink.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Maria de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cinco hijos, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza de cerdos, comercializa los cerdos en los diferentes mercados, adicional a eso tambien vende tamales, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, Maria está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas cerdos y así poder continuar con la crianza de los mismo y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Maria, 45 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and her five children.  For many years, she has made a living raising pigs and selling them in different markets.  In addition to this, she sells tamales.  With the sales that she makes, she is able to move forward with her household expenses.  Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy more pigs and therefore be able to continue raising them and to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy more pigs

loans.name: Vilma Estela

texts.es: Vilma de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica al cultivo de plátanos desde hace 11 años, comercializa los productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y si continuar con sus cultivos para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Vilma is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She has been growing bananas for 11 years. She sells the products in different markets located near her home. She is seeking a loan to buy fertilizers, manure, pesticide, etc. and be able to continue with her crops in order to have better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, pesticide, etc.

loans.name: Sethan

texts.en:
Sethan, 45, is a resident in Kampong Cham province and a mother of five children. Rice farming is the sole source of income for her entire family, and she has occupied this business for several years. Moreover, she earns extra income via pig-raising.

For Sethan, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to pay the tuition fee for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor’s degree, majoring in agriculture. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in agriculture.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Vun

texts.en: Vun is 57 years old, a mother of three children, and lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. To support her family, she grows rice on three hectares. She earns additional income raising mangoes and pigs. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns her about 31,300 KHR per day. This is her first time to take out a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan to buy a solar panel for her house. She wants her family to have electricity in their home.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel her house.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Martín

texts.es: Don Martín es un señor trabajador, el toda su vida de ha dedicado a la crianza de ganado. Con esto le ha podido dar el sustento a su familia. Él necesita ahora un préstamo de un millón de colones para comprar 2 vacas para poder reproducirlas y así generar mas ganado. Con esto el podrá mejorar su calidad de vida al mejorar sus ingresos y poder seguir dando el sustento día tras día a su familia
texts.en: Don Martín is a hardworking man. He has worked his entire life raising cattle. With this he has been able to support his family. Now he needs a loan of one million colones to buy two cows in order to reproduce them and in that way create more cattle. With this he will be able to improve his quality of life by improving his income and be able to continue giving support to his family day after day.

loans.use: to buy cows for breeding.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson desea comprar un pequeño sistema solar para su hogar, el habita en una comunidad rural llamada El Tule donde no hay acceso a la red electrica. Desde pequeño el se dedicó a trabajar en la agricultura y ganadería con su padre. En sus estudio logró alcanzar hasta quinto grado de primaria. Con mucho esfuerzo y ahorros ha logrado adquirir una humilde vivienda y 6 vacas que son su principal fuente de ingresos para el y su familia. Nelson dice que desde hace dos años ha ido construyendo su casa, primero la hizo de lata y poco ha poco la ha ido haciendo de concreto. El estaría muy agradecido de obtener un prestamo para comprar un sistema solar y brindarle a su familia por primera vez electricidad para iluminarse por las noches, escuchar la radio y cargar celular. Este año ha sembrado ajonjolí con la esperanza de que el precio se mantenga y poder pagar el préstamo lo mas pronto posible.
texts.en:
Nelson wishes to purchase a small solar panel for his home.  He lives in a rural community called El Tule, where there is no access to the electrical grid.  Since he was little, he has made a living farming and raising livestock with his father.  He was able to reach the fifth grade in elementary school.

With much effort and saving, he has managed to obtain a modest house and six cows which are his main source of income for himself and his family.  Nelson says that he has been constructing his house for two years.  First, he made it out of tin, and little by little has been making it concrete.  He would be very grateful to obtain a loan to purchase a solar panel and to provide his family with electricity for the first time to illuminate their home at night, listen to the radio, and charge his cell phone.  This year, he has sown sesame seeds with the hope that the price remains consistent and that he is able to pay off the loan as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a solar panel

loans.name: Joel Santiago

texts.es: Joel tiene 25 años de edad el trabaja como cajero en una tienda de viveres en la ciudad de Ventanas en la provincia de los Rios. solicita el credito para la compra de bienes como muebles para amueblar su departamento y lo mecesario para vivir comodo, Su sueño es comprarse una casa y formar una familia. los desafios  a los que se enfrenta es las enfermedades y en su tiempo libre de gusta hacer deporte y divertirse con sus amigos los fines de semana.
texts.en: Joel is 25 years old.  He works as a cashier in a convenience store in the city of Ventanas in the province Los Rios.  He is requesting this loan to purchase products like furniture in order to furnish his apartment and to have what is necessary to live comfortably.  His dream is to buy himself a house and start a family.  The challenges that he faces are illnesses.  In his free time, he likes to play sports and have fun with his friends on the weekends.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his house

loans.name: Roeum's Group

texts.en: A local farmer living in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, Roeum is 51 years old and a mother of three children. For her living, she earns income by raising rice and pigs. She can earn about 31,700 KHR per day. This is the second loan for Roeum with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan. The new loan is a group loan (2 members in the group), and Roeum is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy a solar panel for her house. She hopes her family will have electricity from the solar panel,which will reduce her expense of paying for battery charging.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel for home electricity.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Santa Isabel Group

texts.es:
La Socia pertenece al banco comunal SANTA ISABEL, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate,provincia La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Angélica tiene 54 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para  la compra de semillas y abono.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecida.
Los demás socios se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales menores.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank SANTA ISABEL. The bank is located in the district of Echarate, province of La Convención, and department of Cusco.

The member, Angélica, is 54 years old. She has three children and is married. Angélica alternates her daily activities. She works in agriculture, and has been in this business for a long time, which is going well thanks to the determination that she puts into her business each day. At the same time she works raising small animals. Angélica wants to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family. 

She requests the loan to buy seed and fertilizer. She feels grateful for the granted loan and she is committed to fulfilling the established payments. 

The other members work in agriculture and raising small animals.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: María Elizabeth: Es una joven de 24 años, luchadora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, casada, tiene un pequeño hijo de un año de edad.  Con el propósito de  acceder a financiamiento, formo parte de un grupo solidario. Desde hace 5 años estableció su negocio de venta de ropa nueva y calzado. Solicita su primer financiamiento en la modalidad de crédito individual, con el objetivo de mejorar sus ingresos y comprar en Managua mercadería: pantalones y camisas para damas, caballeros y en el mercado de Masaya comprar zapatos para niños, niñas, damas y venderlos a precios accesibles en el municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero y diversificar sus productos.
texts.en: Maria Elizabeth is a young woman, 24 years old, a fighter, originating from Puerto Cabezas.  She is married and has a little one-year-old son.  With the purpose of gaining access to financing, she is part of a solidarity group.  For 5 years she has established her business of selling new clothing and shoes.  She is requesting her first funding in the form of an individual loan to buy merchandise in Managua: pants and shirts for women and men and in the Masaya market to buy shoes for girls, boys and women to sell at affordable prices in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas with the objective of improving her income.  Her dream is to have a prosperous business and to diversify her products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in Managua: pants and shirts for women and men, and in the Masaya market to buy shoes for boys, girls and women.

loans.name: Verde Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras, que se organizaron hace 9 meses con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias al disponer de mayores ingresos con la compra de mercadería para sus negocios.

MYLING YELENKA: Es una joven de 21 años de edad, madre soltera de un pequeño de 4 años de edad. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su hijo y tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de marisco de manera ambulante. Solicita financiamiento para comprar pescado en la comunidad de Lamlaya y venderlo a precio accesible en la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Su sueño es establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 3 three enterprising and tenacious women. The group was formed 9 months ago with the aim of accessing a loan to buy more merchandise, improving their incomes and therefore also improving the quality of life of their families.

MYLING YELENKA: is a young 21 year-old woman and a single mother to a small 4 year-old child. A year ago she started making a living selling seafood at street markets with the aims of helping her son to get ahead and having her own income. She is asking for a loan to buy fish in the Lamlaya community and sell it at an affordable price in the city of Bilwi in Puerto Cabezas. Her dream is to set up a local convenience store.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Sergelen

texts.en:
Mr. Sergelen, 48 years old, lives with his wife and three daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi services to local people since 2005. His wife works as a tailor at home.

Using his previous loan, he has bought a car for his best friend, who at that time was unemployed. Now his best friend is supporting his family, thanks to him and Kivans.

He is requesting a loan of 2,300,000 MNT to buy furniture such as a table, chairs, and a closet for his home, so that his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where his wife and children will work and study enthusiastically.

loans.use: to buy furniture such as a table, chairs, and a closet.

loans.name: Seng's Group

texts.en:
An old woman living in Kampong Speu province, Seng is 56 years old and the mother of four children. Rice farming is the sole source of income for her entire family, and she has been occupied in this business for several years. She can earn income of about 20,000 KHR per day.

This is the first time for Seng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family will have clean water to use and that her family can live in healthy conditions.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen del Carmen  está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para conocer la situación de vida de cada una de ellas. Son mujeres que a través de su esfuerzo quieren trabajar de manera unida y luchadora.
Una de ellas es la señora Silvia, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir, se encuentra en un nivel muy bajo que debe mejorar. Silvia vende prendas variadas, y por medio de este humilde trabajo lucha para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas de todo tipo para la venta, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group named “Virgen del Carmen” is taking the poverty elimination survey so that each member can become familiar with her life situation. Through their efforts, these women want to work in a unified and determined manner.

One of these women is Sra. Silvia. Her survey indicated that she is at a Stage 1 poverty level. This means that she is at an extremely low level from which she should improve. Silvia sells various types of clothes. Through her humble work, she strives to give her loved ones everything that she was not able to have.

Silvia is requesting this loan so that she can buy clothing of all types for resale. As a result, she will be able to continue her sales just as before.

loans.use: to buy clothing of all types for resale.

loans.name: Nueva Creación Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA CREACIÓN” iniciará el décimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Wilma es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de vestidos, venta de chompas, venta de ropa, venta de busos, venta de fruta,  venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Wilma es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una familiar que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio trenzado de mantas y macrame; da a conocer que esta técnica de tejido la aprendio de su madre y por iniciativa propia decide emplearlo como negocio para la generación de recursos. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de máquina de costura) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de trabajo para mejorar la calidad de sus productos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros y el salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community bank “NUEVA CREACIÓN” will begin its 10th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal of Alto Lima. There are 8 members and it is directed by an executive board where Wilma is the President. The members' businesses include: selling dresses, selling sweaters, selling clothing, selling fruit, selling vegetables. The loan will be used to benefit their small businesses.

Wilma joined Pro Mujer 5 years ago at the invitation of a friend who was already a member. Today she has a business braiding tablecloths and macrame. She came to know how to weave from her mother and by her own initiative she decided to make it a business to generate income. The loan is to increase capital (enabling the purchase of a sewing machine) that she will acquire from wholesalers in La Paz City and then install in her workspace in order to improve the quality of her products. This form of work will enable her to generate income to support her family, as she has a life partner. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings and the health services the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
