Residing in Kampong Speu province, Sopheap is 35 years old. She is the mother of five children, three of whom are in school, while the other two are too young for school. Struggling to make her living, she grows rice as her single source of income. She earns income of about 20,000 KHR per day.

This is the first time for Sopheap with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of four, she is a group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that she can improve her family's ability to have clean water to drink.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom, 32, is a farmer living in Kampong Speu province. She is the mother of three children. To provide for her family, she grows rice, which earns her about 20,000 KHR per day to update her lifestyle.

This is Sokhom's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of five members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family will have clean water to drink as other families do.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Nhóm 08 Thôn Lớp Nghề Xã Công Liêm Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Toàn has operated a manufacturing business making stone furniture for 4 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials such as tools and stones to make stone furniture for sale.

Toàn, 30 years old, is married and has 2 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 08 Thôn Lớp Nghề xã Công liêm solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

In 2012, Toàn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Toàn has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Toàn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as tools and stones to make stone furniture for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for his son who wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree, majoring in civil engineering.

loans.name: Chuon's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Speu province, Chuon is 38 years old. He is a father of four children, three of whom are in school and one is too young. He struggles for a living via rice cropping. He works for others for a fee to earn extra income. Nowadays, he can earn an income of about 23,000 KHR per day.

For Chuon, this is his first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to build a decent latrine.

He hopes that he can improve his family's living by providing healthier conditions than before.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Battambang province, Thon is 26 years old and a mother of one kid. Her main sources of income are from rice farming and pineapple planting.

This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully.

She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for ploughing fees. She hopes that she can update her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay ploughing fees.

loans.name: Isima

texts.es: Isima: Es una mujer luchadora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, casada con 11 hijos mayores de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 10 años se dedica a la comercialización de madera. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar madera de diversas variedades: Pino, roble, caoba, entre otras y venderlas a precios accesibles. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en: Isima is a fighter. She is from Puerto Cabezas and is married with 11 grown-up children. She has made a living selling wood for ten years with the aim of having her won source of income. She is requesting her first loan to buy various types of wood, including pine, oak and mahogany, and sell them at affordable prices. Her dream is to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy various types of wood including pine, oak,and mahogany.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
A local resident living in Battambang province, Kim is 37 years old. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is in school and the other two are too young.

To tackle her family’s hardship, she grows rice on a two hectares area of land. She can earn an income of about 27,200 KHR per day.

For Kim, this is her sixth cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her previous loans. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm.

She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family's living and provide better conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Baustistina

texts.es: Baustistina, tiene 62 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, reside en una aldea del municipio de Victoria, Yoro junto a su esposo, su madre e hijo. Ella siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura lleva 20 años de tener el cultivo de maíz el cual vende en grano en el mercado local. Esta actividad ha sido su fuente de ingresos para la familia, además recibe otros ingresos por venta de leche de vaca. Y ha mantenido estable la producción mediante varios prestamos, actualmente solicita otro por 20,000 lempiras para comprar abonos, y darle asistencia al cultivo, preparación de tierra para resiembra y pago de mano de obra. Su propósito es seguir dándole buena asistencia al cultivo y mantener estable la producción para asegurar una fuente de ingresos de la familia.
texts.en: Baustistina is 62 years old and lives in an civil union with her husband in a village in the Victoria municipality. Yoro and her husband have a son. She has been farming for 20 years, growing corn to sell in the local market. This has been her source of income for her family. In addition she receives income by selling cow's milk. She has maintained stable production through various loans. Today she seeks another 20,000 Lempiras to buy manure and provide crop assistance, prepare the land for replanting and pay labor. Her goal is to continue taking care of her crops and maintaining a stable production in order to ensure a source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy manure and provide crop assistance, prepare the land for replanting and pay labor.

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en:
Haseena, 32 years old, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her son. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years and is responsible for fulfilling the family's needs. Haseena  provides sewing services and earns an income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.
 
Haseena needs different types of goods, such as needles, threads, cloth, machine oil, etc for her business but, due to insufficient financial means, is unable to purchase these accessories. She has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to enable her to purchase these accessories. This will be helpful for her to increase her monthly sales and to profit by providing better sewing services. Haseena is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase accessories such as needles, threads, cloth, machine oil, etc.

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
Benjie is a 35-year-old married man and the father of two children, living in Concepcion, Iloilo. He has been engaged in a hog raising business for several years now. This is the source of his income.

Benjie is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. This loan will help him improve his hog raising business, thus augmenting his income and profit. In the future, Benjie hopes to make his business more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 41-year-old woman and the mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He sells fruits like apples, bananas, grapes, etc. He is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Jamila's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits to resell so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn the maximum profit possible. But due to his unfavorable financial position, he is not in a condition to purchase fruits for his business.

Therefore, Jamila has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes.
 
She is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enable her husband to expand his fruit business

loans.name: Sreyny's Group

texts.en:
A mother of two dependent children living in Battambang province, Sreyny is 23 years old. Because of her living, she grows rice as her main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income.

This is the first cycle for Sreyny with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees.

She hopes that she can improve her family conditions to be better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Yorn, 47, lives with her family members in a rural village of the Battambang province. She is a mother of one child. To support her family, she grows rice as her single source of income.

For Yorn, this is her tenth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans wisely to improve her living conditions at a gradual pace.

As a leader of a group of three, she will spend her loan to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees to support her rice farm.

She hopes that she can improve her family's living standards to better conditions than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is a forty-three-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Concepcion, Iloilo in the Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than three years now. This is the source of their income. 

Ligaya is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets. A loan will help them improve their catch and thus give them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Ligaya hopes to expand their fishing business so that it will generate more income to cover the needs of the family and in particular the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is sixty years old and widowed with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs and engaging in a frozen food retail business in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a loan of PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalinda has been raising pigs for sixteen years now. She has borrowed twenty-four times in the past from NWTF and more recently from Kiva to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her daughter who wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree, majoring in banking.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a fifty-four year old married woman and a mother of five grown up children from Concepcion, Iloilo in the Philippines. She has been engaged in food sales for more than eight years now. Cecilia cooks and sells food to her customers. This is the source of her income.

Cecilia is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as vegetables, meat, rice, noodles, cooking oil and condiments. With this loan, Cecilia will be able to cook more and sell more to her customers.

In the future, Cecilia hopes to expand her small restaurant so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as vegetables, meat, rice, noodles, cooking oil and condiments

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a garage where he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in an area that is good for business and his primary customers are vehicle owners. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy spare parts for servicing vehicles. His business goal is to own a big garage within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy spare parts for servicing vehicles

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en: Hamisi is a married man. He has four children with ages ranging from nine years to twelve years. He describes himself to be creative. He operates a transport business where he owns motorcycles for transporting customers. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are students. He describes his biggest business challenge to be rain, as it affects transport. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to buy more motorcycles within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will provide reliable transport. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, wood, salt, sugar, baking soda etc. for her business

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto es un hombre de 29 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es el servicio de limpieza.
El es emprendedor, activo, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la ciudad, un área caracterizada por agrupar a edificios residenciales y oficinas de todos los rubros. De clima templado durante todo el año.
Roberto es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el Quechua, y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su mamá que es jubilada, viven en una casa construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el servicio de conserjería y limpieza a edificios; A lo largo del día /noche, atiende el control, tanto la entrada como la salida de personas o vehículos, con el fin de atender el acceso al edificio de mensajeros, correos, etc., que se presenten. También se encarga de reparar cualquier desperfecto eléctrico o de agua que pueda tener algún departamento u oficina del edificio, para cumplir las funciones tiene a su cargo a dos operarios que se encargan de colaborar en la limpieza y mantenimiento. “la limpieza debe ser impecable, utilizamos todo tipo de productos de limpieza y siempre tenemos trabajo…” comenta. Su sueño es tener su casa propia, y desea invertir su préstamo en la compra de material de limpieza por mayor como; escobas, trapeadores, secapisos,  ceras, detergentes, manguera para agua, baldes, guantes de goma, botas de goma, uniformes enterisos,etc., para ampliar su negocio y realizar el servicio a otros edificios. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta labor.
Es por esos motivos que Roberto solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de limpieza por mayor para realizar el servicio a mayor cantidad de edificios.
texts.en:
Roberto is a 29 year old single man who does not have any children. His business provides cleaning services. He is an entrepreneur, active, independent, stable, responsible and hard working man. He works in the city in an area known for grouping office and residential buildings in the same line of work.  The climate is mild the entire year.  Roberto is dark-skinned of short stature and has short black hair. His native language is Quechua and he speaks Spanish. He lives with his retired mother in a brick house that has drinking water, electricity and sewage.

His business provides concierge and cleaning services to buildings. During the day/night he controls the entry and exit of people or vehicles, messengers, mail, etc. that come into the buildings.  He is also in charge of any electrical or plumbing repairs that any apartment or office in the building may have.  To fulfill the functions he is responsible for, he has two employees who help with cleaning and maintenance.  “Cleaning must be flawless, we use all kinds of cleaning products and we always have work…” he comments. 

His dream is to have his own home. He would like to invest his loan in the purchase cleaning materials in bulk, such as brooms, mops, floor squeegees, wax, detergents, water hoses, buckets, rubber gloves, rubber boots, one piece uniforms , etc., in order to expand his business and provide services to other buildings.

This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the 2 years he has been in this business.  For these reasons Roberto asks for a loan to purchase cleaning materials in bulk to provide his services to more buildings.

loans.use: to buy cleaning materials in bulk to provide services to more buildings.

loans.name: Jemmimah

texts.en:
Jemmimah is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

Her business is located in a semi urban area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to be the main supplier within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have an improved lifestyle. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Yamileth Del Socorro

texts.es: A sus 38 años de edad Yamileth ha logrado sacar adelante su mini pulpería y la venta de tortilla. Este es el segundo préstamo que obtiene y se siente agradecida con las instituciones porque le ha ayudado en gran manera. Está casada y tiene dos hijos pero solo uno a su cargo.  Solicita el crédito para comprar Maíz, Arroz, Azúcar, Aceite y bebidas gaseosas. El crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá incrementar su inventario y ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
At 38 years old Yamileth has managed to push through with her mini grocery store and tortilla sales.  This is the second loan that she obtains and she feels grateful to the institutions because it has helped greatly. 

She is married and has two children but only one under her charge. 

She requests a loan to purchase corn, rice, sugar, oil and soda pop. The loan will be very helpful because she will be able to increase her inventory and offer more variety to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase corn, rice, sugar, oil and soda pop.

loans.name: Ma. Cecelia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecelia is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of two grown up children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She operates a small sari-sari (variety) or retail store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her area.

She is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, like rice, soda, noodles, canned goods, biscuits, snack foods, soap and detergents, condiments and others. With this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store.

Ma. Cecelia hopes to sustain her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like rice, soda, noodles, canned goods, biscuits, snack foods, soap and detergents, condiments and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheets, wood and nails to change the roof of the shed of his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is a single man. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

His business is located in an area with potential. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor roads. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to service his motorcycle and buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own a taxi within 5 years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will be self sustaining. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle and buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy large and small Japon peanuts, chickpeas, pistachios, Huesitos candy, salted sunflower seeds, enchiladas, lollipops, gum, chocolate, and candy.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Esta emprendedora mujer de 63 años de edad inició su negocio gracias a la necesidad de generar ingresos para su familia, hoy en día Luisa es propietaria de un almacén misceláneo el cual está ubicado en la terraza de su casa y funciona desde el año 2009, en el cual ofrece golosinas, cosméticos, perfumes, útiles de papelería y detalles para toda ocasión.  Sus principales clientes son  vecinos,  referidos y amigos del barrio en el que reside en el municipio Soledad a quienes les  hace entregas a domicilio o desde su casa, también les ofrece facilidad de pago o de contado.  Luisa en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo capital que utilizará en la compra de articulos para cumplir con encargos de sus clientes, así mismo surtir de productos como golosinas, cosméticos y papelería. Sus compras las hace a empresas especializadas en ventas por catálogos y almacenes con pago de contado, su principal desafío es incrementar su capital de inversión y fortalecerlo razón por la que se dedica 6 horas diarias a trabajar en su negocio.
texts.en: This enterprising woman, 63 years old, began her business thanks to the necessity of generating income for her family. These days, Luisa is the owner of a small general store which is located on the terrace of her house and has been open since 2009, which carries candies, cosmetics, perfumes, paper goods, and small items for every occasion. Her primary customers are neighbors, people referred to her, and friends from the neighborhood where she lives in the municipality of Soledad, to whom she makes home deliveries or from her house.  She offers them a payment facility or in cash. Luisa is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan that she has gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, capital that she will use to purchase items to meet her customers' orders, and also stock products such as candies, cosmetics, and paper goods. She makes her purchases from specialist businesses by catalog or in shops with cash. Her principal challenge is increasing her investment capital and strengthening it, which is the reason she works 6 hours every day in her business.

loans.use: to purchase candies, cosmetics, paper goods and meet some of her customers' product orders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy baby bulls for fattening.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 44 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 13 años y su negocio es la confección de vestidos para niña.
Ella es independiene, trabajadora, emprendedora, constante, buena madre y responsable. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘la Mutualista’ un área comercial ubicada en el centro de la ciudad caracterizada por agrupar a la mayor parte de oficinas de empresas. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo a una temperatura aproximada entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el día.
Ana es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español para el comercio. su vida la realiza junto a su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de vestidos y faldas de niña para todo tipo de acontecimientos, para salir, o más casual, los vestidos camiseros, con nido de abeja, con tul, de rayas, flores o de punto, falda estilo tutú, etc., “Puedes acompañar un vestido de fiesta con zapatitos blancos o rojos y medias blancas cortas, para los brazos y cuello busca un accesorio sencillo, puede ser una cadenita de plata y una pulsera del mismo color…” comenta.  Su sueño es ser conocida por su producción y desea realizar la compra de una máquina industrial de coser para ampliar y equipar su negocio y de esa manera incrementar su clientela. Este es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ana solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina industrial de coser y con su nueva producción tener más clientes.
texts.en:
Ana is a 44-year-old woman, single, who has a 13-year-old son, and her business is making girls' dresses. 

She is independent, hard-working, tenacious, a good mother, and responsible. She does her work in the "La Mutualista" zone, a commercial area located in the center of the city, which is characterized by gathering the majority of the business offices. It has a warm, tropical and humid climate and a temperature of approximately 21-35 degrees centigrade during the whole day. 

Ana is tanned, has long black hair, is short, her native language is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish for her business. She makes her life alongside her son who is a student; they live in their own home which is made of brick and has drinking water, electricity and a sewage system. Her business is making girls' dresses and skirts for all sorts of events, to go out, or more casual, shirt dresses with honeycomb, tulle, in stripes, flowers or knit, tutus, etc. "You can pair a party dress with white or red shoes and white socks, for the arms and neck one can look for a simple accessory, which could be a silver chain and a bracelet of the same color..." she says.  Her dream is to be known for her products and she wants to purchase an industrial sewing machine to expand and equip her business and in this way expand her customer base. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 1 year that she has been developing this work.

It is for these reasons that Ana asks for a loan to purchase an industrial sewing machine and with her new production have more customers.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine and with her new production have more customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase blouses, dresses, skirts, shirts, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Dadojon

texts.en:
Dadojon is a young and hardworking man. He was born in 1992. Dadojon studies at the Technology University of Tajikistan. He is learning Economic Systems. He is a student of the 4th year course. 

He lives with his parents in the country and goes to the city for his education. He is not married and lives with his parents. Dadojon is asking for a loan of 900 USD to pay his tuition. He awaits your mercy, and in advance thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay his tuition.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes and onions. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. 

Her business is located in a fast growing area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes and onions. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a single woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be capable. She operates a butchery where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. 

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a single woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. 

Her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy  more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has 7 children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 9 years. 

Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. 

Her business goal is to own a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have more profits. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Alba Arminda

texts.es: Alba es una mujer trabajadora que cuenta con 52 años de vida en los que siempre se ha esforzado por salir adelante, por lo que desde hace 4 años se gana la vida vendiendo productos como: crema, requesón, queso fresco y duro blando, además buscando tener mejores ingresos vende prendas de vestir de dama y caballero. Ella habita en vivienda propia desde hace 16 años, la cual logró comprar con su esfuerzo, Alba tiene una hija mayor de edad que le apoya con los gastos económicos pero que no vive con ella por razones laborales. Alba desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que la madera y las láminas ya brindaron su vida útil, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alba, 52, is a hardworking woman who has always made an effort to get ahead.  For four years she has been earning a living selling products like cream, cottage cheese, queso fresco, and hard cheese.  She also sells men's and women's clothing to try to earn more income.

She has lived in her own home for 16 years.  She was able to buy it with a lot of effort.  Alba has an adult daughter who helps her with the expenses, but she doesn't live with her because of work reasons.

Alba wants to put a new roof on her house because the wood and the metal sheets have already outlived their usefulness.  That's why she's requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to put a new roof on her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a low wall for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, beams, and pins to replace the roof of his house.

loans.name: Durqui Paola

texts.es:
La  joven Durqui de 24  años de edad, vive con sus padres en su casa de habitación,  no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad de  San Lorenzo,  valle al sur de Honduras,  tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 07 años  a la venta de tortillas.
Durqui su venta es con los vecinos y amigos que le llegan a visitar en su caca. También vende tamales por temporada, esta solidando el préstamo para compra de maíz, leña y cal. que son la materia prima para elaborar sus productos, espera que esta inversión le permita mejorar sus ingresos, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante es su tercer crédito que solicita. Está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Durqui is a 24-year-old young woman, she lives with her parents in their residence. She doesn't have children who depend on her, she lives in the community of San Lorenzo, Valle in the south of Honduras. She has her own house and has worked for the past 7 years selling tortillas. 

Durqui makes her sales to her neighbors and friends who come to visit her house. She also sells tamales in season. She is asking for a loan to purchase corn, firewood, and lime powder, which are the raw materials to make her products. She hopes that this investment will allow her to increase her income. She is a hard-working woman with desires to get ahead. This is the third loan she has requested. She is very happy to continue working with Prisma. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  November 2014.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood and lime powder for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, and other provisions for his store, and to make some modifications to the patio of his home, where he has his parking lot

loans.name: Flor De Los Andes Uno Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE LOS ANDES UNO” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marcelina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chaquetas, venta de ropa, venta de juguetes, venta de mantas, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marcelina es integrante, ella indica que hace diez y ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, ya que conocía del negocio por un trabajo anterior, es por ello que decide emprender su negocio independientemente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "FLOR DE LOS ANDES UNO" communal association will begin its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Los Andes. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of which Marcelina is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal association carry out are varied and among them are: jacket sales, clothing sales, toy sales, blanket sales, and vegetable sales.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small business owners of whom Marcelina is one. She says that eighteen years ago, she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling clothing. She says that she undertook this business a number of years ago, since she knew this business from a previous job. So, she decided to undertake her business independently. 

The loan that she is now taking out will be to increase her capital (purchasing clothing in bulk) that she will get from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz and later will sell from her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically since she is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing in bulk

loans.name: Ingris Cecilia

texts.es: Ingris es una mujer admirable que cuenta con 34 años de edad, y habita en vivienda propia al lado de su compañero de vida desde hace algunos años. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida en el negocio de compra y venta de granos básicos actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años por lo que ya cuenta con una cartera de clientes. Ingris desea reparar las paredes de su vivienda, ya que actualmente se encuentran deterioradas, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y pintura para reparar las paredes de su vivienda lo antes posible y así evitar que pueda ocurrir un accidente por el deterioro de las mismas.
texts.en:
Ingris, 34, is an admirable woman who has lived in her own house with her life partner for several years.  She's a hardworking woman who earns a living in her business buying and selling basic grains.  She has done this work for six years, so she already has a customer portfolio.

Ingrid wants to repair the walls of her house because currently they're deteriorating.  She's asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, and paint to repair the walls as soon as possible to avoid any accident from the deterioration.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, and paint to repair the walls of her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, iron, brick, and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Estela Blanca

texts.es:
Estela de 35 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene tres hijos de 20, 17 y 7 años de edad y los tres están estudiando, solo pudo estudiar hasta 9° grado de educación básica y no continuó porque su familia no podía cubrir los gastos de estudio.

Estela es comerciante, elabora tamales y sale a venderlos en su comunidad, aprendió de su madre quien igual que ella le gustaba trabajar y apoyar a su pareja. Solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa de variados estilo y tallas para la reventa, antes también se dedicaba a este negocio pero por motivos de salud tuvo que dejarlo. El sueño de Estela es ver a sus hijos preparados y que tenga mejores oportunidades de trabajo de las que tiene ella.
texts.en:
Estela is 35 years old. She has a life partner and three children who are 20, 17, and 7 years old. All three children are in school. Estela only studied until 9th grade of basic education, and could not continue because her family couldn’t cover her school expenses.

Estela is a vendor, she makes tamales and sells them in her community. She learned this trade from her mother, who like Estela, liked to work and help her partner. 

She is asking for this loan to buy clothes of various styles and sizes to resell. She already had this type of business before, but for health reasons had to stop. 

Estela’s dream is to see her children prepared and with better opportunities for work than her own.

loans.use: to buy clothes of various styles and sizes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, and gravel to cement the walkway of his house.

loans.name: Dinora Elizabeth

texts.es: Dinora de 46 años de edad vive con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de especies (canela, esencias, achote, ajonjolí, etc.) desde hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal en una zona muy transitada, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas especies por mayor para continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Dinora, 46, lives with her husband.  She has earned a living for several years selling spices (cinnamon, extracts, achiote, sesame seed, etc.).  Her business is in the town market in a very busy area.

She's requesting a loan to buy more spices wholesale to continue making sales.

loans.use: to buy spices (cinnamon, extracts, achiote, sesame seed, etc.) wholesale

loans.name: Maria Domitila

texts.es: Maria de 59 años de edad es una mujer muy trabajadora ella se dedica a la venta de tamales y tortillas, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante, vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra materia prima para la elaboración de los tamales como maiz, verduras, pollos, tomates, etc. todo por mayor para continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria is 59 years old, and a very industrious woman.

She sells tamales and tortillas, and manages to make a living with her earnings. She lives in her own house with her husband and her son. 

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making tamales such as corn, vegetables, chickens, tomatoes, etc., in bulk, so she can continue her work, which generates a good income for her.

loans.use: to buy corn, vegetables, chickens, tomatoes, etc., in bulk.

loans.name: Sonia Yolanda

texts.es: Sonia cuenta con 26 años de vida y es madre soltera, por lo que habita en vivienda propia solo acompañada por su pequeña hija de 11 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que todos los días pone todo su esfuerzo y creatividad en su negocio, ya que vende sopa de gallina india, gallina india en alguashte, en pinol y platos de gallina azada, al ser la única que vende esta clase de platillos son muy solicitados por sus clientes. Sonia da todo por su hija y siempre busca lo mejor para ella, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, pines y polines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y evitar que el agua se filtre deteriorando sus pertenencias.
texts.en:
Sonia, 26, is a single mother, so she lives in her own home with just her little girl, age 11.

She's a hardworking mother who puts all her effort and creativity into her business every day.  She sells chicken soup, chicken with alguashte [seasoning made with pumpkin seed], chicken in pinol, and broiled chicken dishes with free-range chicken.  She's the only person selling these dishes, so her food is in great demand among her customers.

Sonia does everything for her daughter and always looks for the best for her.  She's asking FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized metal sheets, beams, and studs to put a new roof on her house to avoid leaking that might damage her belongings.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, beams, and studs to put a new roof on her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shrimp, curils, crabs, blue crabs, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Barnabas

texts.en:
Barnabas is a married man. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells metal boxes. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of metal boxes to sell.

His business goal is to own a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life.

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of metal boxes to sell.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a single woman. She describes herself to be God-fearing and aggressive.

She operates a chemist shop where she sells medicine. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a competitive area, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of medicine.

Her business goal is to own a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicine.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
Mujeres en accion es un grupo muy unido y luchador, que esta haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para que por medio de sus indicadores puedan conocer la situación de cada una.
Evangelista en su ultima encuesta se encontraba en un nivel uno, es decir, nivel inferior, ella se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para poder surtir su despensa con verduras, carne, bebidas, lácteos, panificados y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por crecer.
texts.en:
“Mujeres En Acción” (Women In Action) is a unified and determined group. The members are participating in the poverty elimination survey. The indicators of the survey help them become familiar with each of their situations.

In her latest survey, Evangelista found out that she was at a Stage 1 level. This means that she is at a subpar level. Evangelista devotes herself to making sales. She has a food pantry where she works every day, beginning the early morning hours.

Evangelista is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of various products to restock her food pantry such as vegetables, meat, beverages, dairy products, baked goods, and other items. This will enable her to continue with her sales as she strives to grow.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, beverages, dairy products, baked goods, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Mariza

texts.es:
Mariza estudia la carrera de Marketing, es soltera vive con sus padres que son empleados, tiene un hermano menor y otro que trabaja, dentro de unos años se ve ejerciendo su profesión en una empresa de Publicidad renombrada. Le gustaría  terminar su carrera y poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Mariza is studying for a degree in Marketing. She is single and lives with her parents who are employed. Mariza has a younger brother and another one who is working. Within a few years, she hopes to see herself pursuing a career at a well-known advertising company. She would like to finish her degree and be able to help her family.

Mariza is requesting this loan so that she can pay her degree fees. As a result, she can continue studying just as before.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Alma Yasari

texts.es: Alma de 34 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados, Alma quiere mejorar su casa haciendo una instalación de luz eléctrica ya que actualmente no posee, pero con lo que obtiene no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de los materiales necesarios y pago de mano de obra para que ella y sus hijos puedan vivir mas seguros y comodos.
texts.en:
Alma is a 34-year-old single mother who lives in her own home along with her two children. She sells clothes as a street vendor at different markets.

Alma wants to improve her home by having electricity installed. She currently does not receive this service. Alma does not earn enough income to pay for this expense, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy the necessary materials and pay for labor. As a result, she and her children will be able to live more securely and comfortably.

loans.use: to pay for the necessary materials and labor so that she can have electricity installed in her home.

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es:
“Las Rosas” es el nombre que decidieron dar las integrantes al grupo conformado para poder ser clientes de VisionFund e invertir sus préstamos en cada uno de sus negocios. La comunidad donde se encuentra el grupo es productora de caña y recientemente dio incio la época de cosecha, la cuál durará 6 meses. 

El nombre del grupo surgió del gusto que las clientas tienen por las rosas, ellas son:

Eva-Cocina Económica, Venta De Calzado Y Ropa Por Catalogo
Paola –Venta De Cosméticos 
Beatriz - Venta De Tacos
Tomasa - Venta De Cosméticos
Areli - Venta De Ropa De Cama
Nancy - Venta De Refrescos

Doña Eva es una gran mujer, tiene dos hijos uno de nombre Diego quien es mayor de edad y le ayuda en el negocio de comida que aperturó desde hace ya 5 meses, y Rodrigo quien tiene 8 años. Doña Eva comenta que el buen trato a los clientes y el sazón de la comida que prepara han hecho que todos ellos regresen acompañados de amigos o compañeros de trabajo quienes a su vez recomiendan su cocina económica. Eva levanta las cortinas del negocio de domingo a lunes de 8 am a 6 pm debido a que las personas acuden incluso a buscar comida para la cena. 

Quizá el reto más grande al que se enfrentó Eva fue su temor a que el pequeño restaurante no funcionara, pero hasta hace un mes Doña Eva sólo contaba con un empleado y con el apoyo de Diego para hacer entregas de comida a domicilio y de comprar los insumos faltantes. Apenas hace unos días, Eva tuvo que contratar a otra persona para ayudarle con el trabajo de la cocina. 

Sin embargo, la cocina no es la única fuente de ingresos de Eva. Desde hace 6 años también vende zapatos y ropa por catálogo y sus clientes principales son docentes, trabajadores del ayuntamiento y de los ingenios debido a que ellos tienen un ingreso más estable el pago por su mercancía es seguro.  

Actualmente Eva necesita un préstamo para mejorar su cocina, necesita comprar más ingredientes como aceite, arroz, queso, huevos, leche, chocolate en polvo, vainilla, canela, azúcar, jamaica, refrescos y gas para cocinar debido a que son los insumos que más utiliza. 

“Gracias a VisionFund  por la gran oportunidad que nos brinda al otorgarnos préstamos” comentó Doña Eva. 

*La fotografía fue tomada afuera de la cocina económica, Eva viste blusa blanca y pantalón de mezclilla y está parada delante de Beatriz quien viste blusa color rosa.
texts.en:
"Las Rosas" ("The Roses") is the name that the members decided to give to their group, which was formed in order to be clients of VisionFund and invest their loans in each of their businesses. The community where the group is located is a producer of sugar cane, and the harvest season began recently and will last for six months.

The name of the group came from the liking that the borrowers have for roses. The members are:  Eva -- home-style restaurant, selling footwear and clothing by catalog; Paola -- selling cosmetics; Beatriz -- selling tacos; Tomasa -- selling cosmetics; Areli -- selling bed linens; and Nancy -- selling soft drinks.

Doña Eva is a great woman. She has two sons. One is named Diego; he is an adult and helps her in the food business, which she opened five months ago. Rodrigo is 8 years old. Doña Eva comments that her good treatment of her customers and the flavor of the food that she prepares has made everyone come back, accompanied by friends and work companions. who in turn recommend her home-style restaurant. Eva raises the curtains of the business from Monday to Sunday from 8 am to 6 pm, since people even come to her to seek food for dinner.

Perhaps the biggest challenge that Eva faced was her fear that the little restaurant would not succeed, but even a month ago, Doña Eva only had one employee and help from Diego to make home deliveries and purchase missing ingredients. Just a few days ago, Eva had to hire another person to help her with the kitchen work.  

Nevertheless, cooking is not Eva's only source of income. For six months, she has also sold shoes and clothing by catalog, and her principal customers are teachers. city workers, and mill workers, since they have a a more stable income, and payment for their merchandise is reliable.

Now Eva needs a loan to improve her restaurant. She needs to buy more ingredients such as oil, rice, cheese, eggs, milk, powdered chocolate, vanilla, cinnamon, sugar, fruit beverages, soft drinks and gas for cooking, since they are the supplies that she uses most.

"Thanks to the VisionFund for the great opportunity that it offers us by granting us loans, " commented Doña Eva.

The photograph was taken outside the home-style restaurant. Eva is wearing a blue blouse and denim pants, and she is standing in front of Beatriz, who is wearing a rose-colored blouse.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, cheese, eggs, milk, chocolate milk, vanilla, cinnamon, sugar, fruit beverages, soft drinks, and gas for cooking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 10 years to 19 years. She describes herself to be God-fearing.

She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a secure area, and her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

Her business goal is to own her own business premises within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will live a good life.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to build her own business premises.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Myrian

texts.es:
Myrian  estudia la carrera de kinesiología y fisioterapia, a la vez que estudia también trabaja como secretaria de un edificio. Su aspiración es seguir enriqueciendo sus conocimientos profesionales, y al recibirse poder seguir estudiando para mejorar.
Ella está luchando  y esforzándose. Pide este préstamo para el pago de las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Myrian is studying for a degree in Kinesiology and Physiotherapy. At the same time, she is also working as a secretary at an office building. Her aspiration is to continue enriching herself with professional knowledge. Upon receiving her degree, she hopes to continue studying so that she can improve.

Myrian is striving to do her best. She is requesting this loan so that she can pay her degree fees.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 12 years to 28 years. She describes herself to be God-fearing.

She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a clean area, and her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be customers’ tastes and preferences.

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy materials to expand her business premises.

Her business goal is to have a large hotel within five years. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy materials to expand her business premises.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es una mujer trabajadora y estudiosa, su meta es llegar a recibirse y ser una exitosa abogada para posteriormente seguir estudiando y capacitandose para crecer.
Andrea lucha por ser una buena abogada, que pueda salir adelante y tambien poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Pide este prestamo para poder nvertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Andrea is a hardworking and studious woman. Her goal is to receive her degree so that she can become a successful lawyer. Later on, she would like to continue studying and training so that she can grow.

Andrea strives to become a good lawyer so that she can get ahead and also be able to help other people. She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the payment of her fees. This will allow her to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Risper

texts.en: Risper is a married woman. She has two children with ages two and four years old. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area with potential. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough working capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to have a large hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be self sustainable. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be open minded. He operates a barber shop. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an area with high customer inflow. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough  capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a hair cutting machine. His business goal is to have a large barber shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be self sustainable. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to open another barber shop.

loans.use: to buy a hair cutting machine.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be blessed. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, bread, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a rural area. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap and other items he sells. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap and other items.
